title: UX/UI Designer
description:
An established software house is on the lookout for an experienced UX/UI Designer to join their Glasgow base. Due to their success, they're looking to expand their team and as part of that are looking to enhance the UX/UI Design skills within the team.

The company already work with multi-national clients across many different industries, but their clientele is expanding all the time. Having been around for over 20 years now, they are globally known as the market leaders within their field!

What will I be doing?

Great question!

The company are also looking to re-develop and improve their award-winning platform and are working with a range of modern tech to ensure they stay ahead of their competition within the market!

You'll obviously work very closely with your design team and will report into the Head of Product. They have dedicated research experts, so you'll focus more on the design side of things but will still be expected to appreciate understand the importance of research... as well.

One of the best things about this role and company, is that you'll be working on a product that generally matters. It's a product that improves people's working environments across the world and you will play a massive part in improving the user experience of the product!

Who am I?

Ideally, you'll have experience working as a Digital Product/UX/UI Designer. This role will be key in re-shaping how the product is used by the company's customers so would suit someone that is motivated to make an impact in an already-successful business!

You should be someone that can take findings from research and transform these into attractive designs that are in-line with the research analysis. The company are in the process of building their internal Design System, so any experience of this would be ideal. Experience designing on a SaaS platform would be very beneficial as well.

In terms of personality, the team are super outgoing and collaborative, so they are looking for a similar personality. The team work really closely together, so you'll have a great support network and other passionate Designers to bounce ideas off of. You'll be dealing with different stakeholders so experience of this would be great but it's not essential as they can offer lots of training on how to improve these skills. The main thing that they're looking for is someone that is fanatical about their craft, if this is you then you'll fit right in!

What are the benefits and where will I be based?

This is probably worth knowing before applying. The salary range for the role is 40,000 - 55,000 which is dependent on experience.

The company have an office in Glasgow, but the team pretty much works fully remote. You might be asked to meet up with the team every now and then, but this is by no means essential. If you do prefer to work in an office, then they're more than happy for you to do so!

If you're an experienced UX/UI Designer that wants to work for a globally recognised, market leading company, then please apply and/or get in touch with Jack Steven at Cathcart Technology

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Our Client is a renewable energy organization that is undergoing rapid growth. It aims to help facilitate the energy transition demands of the UK and EU by developing and investing into large-scale solar and battery storage projects.

Their team comprises individuals with a proven track record in both infrastructure investment and the renewable spheres. As the team expands, we seek a Senior UI/UX Designer
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps
• Design graphic user interface elements, like menus, tabs, and widgets
• Build page navigation buttons and search fields
• Develop UI mock-ups and prototypes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look like
• Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)
• Prepare and present rough drafts to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)
•... Conduct layout adjustments based on user feedback
• Adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images
• Excellent understanding of databases.
• Experience of working within teams that use AGILE methodology (preferred); management, as required.

Requirements
• Bachelors Degree;
• Degree in Computer Sciences, Design, or relevant field
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role
• Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop
• Aptitude for organization and analytical reasoning;

Benefits

They are, an innovative scale-up renewable energy company with backing from a blue-chip investment fund provides a fast paced and dynamic workplace environment. A people focused company with a passion for environmental sustainability. Continuous learning and development opportunities, financial stability, healthcare benefits, attractive salary and bonus:
• Share ownership and profit-sharing scheme
• Premium Private Health Insurance plan
• Life Insurance
• Income Protection
• Corporate Gym membership
• EV Car Scheme (Electric vehicle purchase facility for employees)
• Season Travel Ticket Loans
• Company funded Training and Certification opportunities
• Flexible, hybrid working model

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
This is a hybrid role that requires occasional travel to the Edinburgh office. Suitable travelling distance to Edinburgh is advised.

This is a great opportunity for any Junior UI/UX Designer to join one of the biggest sports betting publishers in the UK and Brazil. They have an audience of over 5,000,000 passionate sports betting fans across a range of social platforms and websites.

This is an organisation that has seen continuous growth every year since 2014, with no plan on slowing down. It s a great opportunity to join an established team of designers, social media experts, marketing professionals and product developers to produce incredible user-centric design across a number of high traffic websites.

If you re looking to join a team that are passionate about what they do, provide UI & UX solutions, build on your wireframing & prototyping knowledge and be part of a growing, exciting, contemporary business, this is the role for you!

The Role

You ll be helping with the UI/UX... design process end-to-end, providing user-centric solutions to problems. You ll be helping maintain the current websites with a mobile-first approach, optimising the existing interfaces and improving on the overall user experience. This will be achieved through the creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to create the best user journey possible.

You ll be working towards the company s mission; to create the safest, most powerful and engaging sports betting communities and websites in the world.

Responsibilities
• Delivery of innovative, user-centred website designs with great attention to detail.
• Optimisation of existing user interface to improve the user experience and maximise the number of conversions.
• Creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to deliver compelling digital experiences.
• Implementation of Figma design systems and component libraries to create fast and efficient processes.
• Collaboration with the product manager, designers, and developers to help bring your designs to the user.
• Providing developers with proper assets like style guides, icons, graphics, etc.
• Effectively working across multiple brands, implementing and adding to each brand s creative assets and design systems.
• Reviewing front-end designs implemented by developers and provide feedback to ensure pixel-perfect experiences.

Requirements
• A strong portfolio that shows your strengths in both UX and visual design, particularly with mobile-focused website design.
• Experience using Adobe Creative Suite and Figma.
• Ability to use problem-solving skills to determine solutions to user interface challenges.
• Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team.
• A proactive, self-starter who takes pride in their work.
• An ambitious, team player who wants to contribute to long-term organisational goals.

Beneficial
• Experience creating design systems and component libraries from scratch in Figma.
• Experience working hands-on with developers and product managers.
• Experience working with Google Analytics, Hotjar or other digital analytics platforms.
• A passion for football as you ll love what they do!
• Knowledge and/or an understanding of sports betting.

Package
• Pension contribution.
• Remote-first working. Office based in Edinburgh
• Work from home setup budget.
• Training budget to aid professional development.
• Phone bill contribution.
• Laptop and essential items provided.
• Regular social events, including tickets to sports events.
• Bupa private healthcare after 2 years of service

To be considered for this opportunity, please apply below, or get in touch with Fraser Gillespie.

E: (url removed)

All submissions must include a portfolio

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
UI / UX Designer

Permanent, Home Based

Are you a UI / UX designer with experience using Adobe Creative Suite who enjoys creating and coding front end interfaces?

As a UI / UX Designer here at Netcall, you’ll predominantly be creating front end interfaces for our low code software platform, Liberty Create. Create is awesome and extremely versatile, it enables our customers to build custom applications quickly and easily to automate tasks, saving time and improving their customers’ experience…without the need to be a software developer!

You’re highly adept using Adobe Creative Suite, you’ll be creating and coding webpages for our clients, they’ll need to look great, be highly functional and really easy to use.

You’ll need to gather the requirements of the customer to get an idea of what they want their pages to look like and how they want them to function. You’ll then build a prototype page in Adobe to get the right look and feel for the layout, incorporating logos, graphics, text... and buttons on the different screens.

You’ll ideally have worked on a broad range of projects for different customers, perhaps you have worked for a web development agency managing multiple client projects which present different challenges which you need to adapt to.

You enjoy coming up with solutions to challenging design tasks, there’s plenty to get your teeth into here! There’s loads of opportunity to get your creative juices flowing – we’re always looking for new ideas and innovative ways of solving problems.

Why should you join Netcall?

· Reward – we are offering a competitive package, plus a whole host of other benefits from pension to Perkbox.

· Flexible working – we moved to remote working during the pandemic and it is working brilliantly, we also have offices in Bedford and Poole if you want a change of scenery.

· We are problem solvers – our software solves real-world problems, whether it’s automating laborious processes, via our suite of Low-code, AI and RPA technologies or centralising communication through call centre conversational messaging capability. What we call the Liberty Intelligent Automation platform.

· We are always learning – the day job is very important, but it’s also great to learn new things and we encourage our colleagues to grow. Our Academy is accessible not only to our staff but to all our customers and partners.

About You

Well versed in the use of Adobe Creative Suite.

Experienced in UI and UX design on a wide range of projects, it would be great if you had previously worked for a web development agency on multiple client projects.

Ideally some experience designing webpages for a SaaS platform / product.

You take ownership over your projects, but also enjoy sharing ideas with the team to gain collective input and problem solving.

You may have some knowledge of Vue.JS and Bulma CSS framework, though not essential.

Due to the nature of the role, you are expected to gain and maintain Non-Police Personnel Vetting Level 3 (NPPV3) clearance and therefore it is essential that you have held continuous residency in the UK for the past 3 years.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:
• Casual dress
• Company events
• Company pension
• Referral programme
• Sick pay
• Store discount
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
UI/UX Designer - Fully Remote - UK

About Us:

Headquartered in the City of London, OutThink is a start-up using some of the latest methodologies and technologies to build the world's first truly predictive Cybersecurity Human Risk Management Platform (SaaS). We are building an innovative, disruptive solution. OutThink is the evolution of traditional security awareness training. Used by large, complex organisations around the world, the OutThink software platform has been developed specifically to identify, understand, measure and manage cybersecurity human risk.

We are seeking a UI/UX Designer to join our exciting start-up, working within a high performing agile engineering squad, and playing a key role in building and delivering OutThink’s ground-breaking SaaS (Software as a Service) Cybersecurity Human Risk Management Platform.

The platform provides innovative and just-in-time learning experiences, nudges, and simulations to hundreds of thousands of users around the world via... both desktop and mobile devices. At the same time, the system monitors training responses, collects security system data and continually gathers feedback. All this data is collated and processed by our cloud engines in Azure, culminating in the provision of sophisticated predictive human risk management models. Our models can drive automated countermeasures, and present analysis results via the delivery of highly visual and interactive on-line dashboards.

The Role:

Have a commercial design background with valuable UX knowledge gained from commercial experience.

You will need to be a master at eliciting requirements from stakeholders, internal and external, and be able to design beautiful, elegant, and perfectly realisable user interfaces.

Possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level business requirements into effective design artefacts such as task flows and wireframes, and further ensure that they can be transformed into intuitive and functional user interfaces.

You will need to communicate scenarios, end-to-end experiences, interaction models, and screen designs to stakeholders and be able to realise complex data visualizations

This is a predominantly remote role in a remote team where open feedback, new ways of working, and thinking out of the box is not only encouraged but expected.

Responsibilities:

• Investigating user experience design requirements for OutThink’s digital SaaS platform, in collaboration with Product Owners and other stakeholders.

• Translating complex business processes into intuitive and elegant use and product experiences.

• Working with teams internally to ensure the creation and delivery of beautiful and elegant experiences for users.

• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, process maps, flow diagrams, storyboards, and prototypes.

• Assisting in the development and evaluation of user stories, and usability studies

What You’ll Need:

• A solid appreciation of art, beauty, and a keen sense of aesthetics to drive design innovation. • A positive and proactive attitude with strong initiative and team-working skills.

• Good communication skills, with the ability to communicate in English in all forms.

• An understanding of the principles behind great software design.

• An eye for clean and artful design.

• Experience building data-centric web visualizations with an understanding of the limitations of web architecture design decisions.

• 3+ years of solid commercial experience with UI design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Zeplin, Axure, Figma or Invision.

• Experience with Agile Development Methodology, working in short sprint cycles. • Experience with Purpose-Driven Design process.

• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and confident presenting your work and representing the team at all levels.

• Fluent in English.

• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.

• Ability to learn new processes and concepts fast with a demonstrated sense of curiosity.

• Intrinsic drive and motivation to build a ‘world first’ and share our start-up vision.

Why we think you will love it here

All OutThinkers are part of the journey, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark against other VC-backed companies to provide above market rate salaries for companies of our size.

Beyond this, there is plenty more that makes OutThink a wonderful place to work:

• Great start-up culture in a fun, friendly and hardworking team.

• Fully remote.

• Competitive salary and benefits package.

• Share options - a rare opportunity to get in early and have a significant stake in what could potentially be a unicorn start-up, with a huge financial payback.

• 34 days paid holiday (including public holidays)

• In-person hackathons and social events happening somewhere in Europe at least twice per year.

Equality & Diversity

Our mission to empower and protect people reflects two of our values:

(i) Human First and (ii) We Do the Right Thing. For us, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion is also a reflection of these core values.

As a human first company, we are committed to creating a diverse, equitable and inclusive environment where all our OutThinkers can thrive. We strive for a better OutThink, and a better world. We're working inside and outside OutThink to improve diversity and equity in our industry and foster an environment where everyone feels a sense of belonging.

Our strategy touches each part of an OutThinker’s life cycle, from applicant to employee, ensuring that we keep Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the core of every point in our candidate and employee experience

title: UI Designer
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North is on the lookout for a talented UI Designer who has great attention to detail and a passion for crafting beautiful UI experiences and building and maintaining design systems. We are considering both mid and senior candidates. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar’s unique game development studio in the heart of Edinburgh City Centre.

WHAT WE DO

We work as a global, cross-functional UX research, UX design, UX writing and UI design team to create intuitive, effective and engaging player experiences
We design and optimize player-facing user interfaces across... all Rockstar titles. -We build bridges and foster close collaboration with other teams to help shape all aspects of the player experience, and problem solve to create functional and efficient UI solutions.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Development of UI design language, components and layouts. Getting into the bones of the UI, thinking about all scalability, accessibility, usability and player needs.
• Support in the creation and iteration of UI mock-ups, prototypes and polished designs for game that enhance player interactions and complement the user experience.
• Produce flows describing UI states and the resulting visual information fed back to the user.
• Support in the creation, maintenance and governance of UI design systems in Figma, and in game.
• Identify when new components are needed, being aware of the downstream effects of UI design work on development and the overall game ecosystem.
• Create and maintain associated UI Design System documentation.
• Collaborate with UX Design and technical teams to identify needs, and challenges to solve within the design system, and assist with implementing UI solutions that ensure product consistency and effective use of components.
• Work closely with Visual Design teams, efficiently balancing the technical constraints while staying true to the look and feel of the UI design, and overall art-direction of each game.
• Consistently benchmark the useability and accessibility of new and existing products, and leverage creative solutions to make iterative improvements to designs.
• Support in the wider production of design flows, pre-vis and prototypes as required.
• Produce related game-ready assets as required.

QUALIFICATIONS
• 2+ years' professional experience in a digital product design environment, or in a similar capacity within the games industry.
• Portfolio demonstrating applied UI design work and use of design systems.

SKILLS
• Experience building, maintaining and managing design systems.
• Experience creating UI designs, screens, flows and documentation with a high level of craft and keen eye for detail.
• Experience working to accessibility and inclusivity best practices.
• Solid foundation and understanding of UX methodology and user-centred design.
• Analytical and methodical approach to working.
• Great communication skills for collaborating closely with our teams worldwide.
• 2+ years’ experience of using modern design tools and workflows (Figma, FigJam, Adobe CC, etc).
• Passion for playing and making games.
• A desire to share knowledge and expertise, and help others improve their skills.
• Ability to problem solve from a systems perspective, and not just one-off approaches.
• Show initiative when presented with a problem, even when that problem is presented as a solution.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• Experience applying design systems across multiple platforms in multiple languages.
• Understanding of the features of modern game ecosystems, and design patterns.
• Experience in the games industry, having worked on one or more shipped titles.
• Experience; or strong interest in graphic, motion design, typography and colour theory.
• Knowledge or experience of front-end development and mark-up languages such as Javascript, CSS, XAML.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you’ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
About Us

QikServe is an enterprise platform for guest self-service in hospitality, powering some of the biggest players in the hospitality industry. We’re looking for a UI /UX designer to join our design team to help deliver our digital ordering and payments systems.

QikServe are trail blazers, our founder holds the patent for QR based ordering and we have been at the forefront of digital ordering for 10 years. Our technology is used in over 5,000 sites across 35 countries. We specialise in guest facing products, staff interfaces, management tools, middleware and beyond. In other words, we enable operators to allow their guests the convenience to order and pay for their food whenever and however they want.

If you want to join an exciting company who are changing the digital ordering and payments landscape, we want to hear from you.

The Job

In summary, the job is focused on innovating and developing impactful interfaces and experiences for our customers and their guests. You... will:
• Work directly with our Head of Design across our suite of digital products, developing a deep understanding of our products and customer needs
• Craft rich, high-fidelity designs using Figma for handover to Engineering
• Create UI & UX deliverables such as personas, journey maps, IA, prototypes and wireframes
• Work closely with our technical teams on handing over design files, as well as ensuring the outcome is in line with the scope
• Interact frequently with customer facing teams to gather feedback and input during the design phase
• Drive improvements where possible, offering support to other teams to ensure our products are always well presented

We’re proud to say that our guest-facing products are built to be accessible and ethical, and you’d be expected to uphold and promote these values across your work.

About You
• You are skilled in Figma and common design tools including Adobe CC (XD, Photoshop, Illustrator), and have a strong capability for creating compelling digital interfaces, products or graphics.
• Design thinking, problem solving and understanding product capabilities are things you are familiar with and you have a user-first attitude, and truly want to design the right things, in the right way and in the right context.
• You will have strong self management skills, the ability to self-motivate and solid teamwork skills, with the ability to build momentum and pivot if needed.
• From ideas to live products you’re happy to communicate and collaborate design decisions with colleagues and stakeholders throughout the design process. This means you have good communication skills and English is one of your languages (bonus points if you also speak Portuguese).
• Collaboration and consistency are key and you will have experience of delivering multiple projects in a professional setting, under tight deadlines. You are inquisitive, passionate and creative as well as being a decent person.

This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious designer to join a growing team, being able to influence winning products and drive change across the business.

The Rest

To apply, send us your portfolio. This should include some case studies, and demonstrate your strengths and interests as a designer and how you have been involved in each project. Please send this along with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you think you'd be a good fit for this role.

Location: Hybrid working from our Edinburgh Head Office or fully remote from anywhere in the UK

Please note: You must be located in the UK and have the right to work in the UK

We look forward to hearing from you

title: UI / UX Designer
description:

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Our metaverse group helps our partners realise their metaverse ambitions. The team’s expertise encompasses creative (concept and design), production (art and content), engineering (game development and Web3) and operations (dev and live).

At Improbable, you’ll collaborate with some of the best in the industry. Together, you’ll create unique, tailored experiences that stretch the boundaries of what’s possible in digital spaces and virtual worlds – and help define what the metaverse can be.

Your Opportunity:

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
Senior UX/UI Designer
Flexible Working (UK)

As a Barclays Senior UX/UI Designer, you will form part of an integrated and innovative in-house Experience Design team, working to help transform the second oldest brand in the UK and to create award-winning experiences for our customers. Our team boasts experience from a range of industries including broadcast, telecoms, ecommerce, tech, start-ups and a wealth of creative agencies.

Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive, and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

You can apply from anywhere in the UK for this role. We will confirm your place of work at the point of offer, ensuring that this is considered in line with our future ways of working and overall location strategy. The hiring... manager for the role will discuss the appropriate defined time in office for the role with you as part of the application process.

This opportunity is open to job share arrangements. If you have a need for flexibility, please apply and discuss this with us during the hiring process.

Working Flexibly
We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees, globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.

Hybrid Working
We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.

What will you be doing?
• Delivering consistent, excellent, customer-focused design solutions
• You will lead projects, taking responsibility for communication and planning design activities
• Proactively collaborating with colleagues across the business and joining the dots where needed
• Managing stakeholder’s expectations and priorities
• Adhering to human centered design practices
• Keeping abreast of best practices in design led thinking and applying those as a leader both internally and externally
• You’ll act as a champion of trialing new and relevant design methodologies and practices and promoting this across the business
• Creating and reviewing design specifications for developers (across app and web platforms)

What we’re looking for:
• Experience of designing user centered experiences, with a solid digital portfolio showing examples of your work and processes
• Proven experience of working with UX and/ or service design principles and brand guidelines
• Experience creating and contributing to digital design libraries, pattern libraries or something similar
• Demonstrated ability to understand complex technical digital concepts, and present them as simple design solutions

Skills that will help you in the role:
• Previous experience of acting on making design decisions based on a range of data and insight
• Proven experience leading designers, developers, stakeholders or clients
• Experience managing stakeholders and timelines/ priority lists

Where will you be working?
We will confirm your place of work at the point of offer, ensuring that this is considered in line with our future ways of working and overall location strategy.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
The art team at Build a Rocket Boy Games is expanding! We’re looking for a passionate and exceptional Senior UX/UI Designer to come join us here in our newly refurbished Edinburgh office.

The Senior UX/UI Designer will translate high level design requirements into engaging experiences across the projects menu and HUD systems.

Our ideal candidate will be an insightful and creative team player with an enthusiasm for wireframing accessible menus & HUDs, maintaining UX/design documentation and working iteratively towards building one of the most ambitious projects in games. A strong eye for detail combined with clear and concise communication is a must.

As a member of the Art team you’ll work closely with the game director, core design group and UI artists, to create and maintain the vision across the Everywhere project. This is a great opportunity to develop your skills alongside an incredible worldwide team.
Responsibilities:
• Takes ownership in the design of screen layouts and... interface elements
• Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes and mockups, that leads to an intuitive user experience
• Ensure that signs and feedback clearly communicate the game information and that there is consistency across the board
• Work closely with game designers and UI artists to balance usability and functionality with visual appeal
• Work with the UI artists to create UI patterns and style guides.
• Communicate the UI designs with different departments (audio, animation, effects, narrative, script, etc.)
• Iterate on designs, based on team feedback, director feedback and playtest results
• Consider how the menus and HUD will work for different input methods (PC/Consoles)
• Ensure that menus and HUD account for localization
• Support/lead accessibility across the scope of the game
• Stay up to date on best practices and market trends
Requirements:
• 3+ years experience or 2 shipped projects as a UX/UI designer, with AAA title experience and an able to show/discuss your work
• A strong UX/UI sense and comfortable with the concepts of flow, layouts, and wireframes
• Excellent problem-solving, organizational, time management, communication, and presentation skills
• Confident in communicating ideas to directors, artists and scripters, and adapt the designs where necessary
• Good knowledge of usability testing methods and processes
• Experience with the Adobe Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign or XD) is a plus
• Experience with Unreal Engine is a plus
• Knowledge about Accessibility guidelines

Build A Rocket Boy is developing EVERYWHERE; an experience with a breadth of unimaginable gameplay adventure.

We are a mix of industry leading veterans whose credits include some of the best selling and most loved games of all time. We’re a creative digital entertainment studio with an open and progressive methodology, dedicated to delivering games of the highest calibre possible.

If you want to feel comfortable, inspired, and appreciated in your work pursuits then come join us. We have offices in Edinburgh and Budapest and are happy to sponsor your relocation to one of these cities. If you apply from outside of our hiring territory, we also consider WFH candidates from the UK, Hungary, France and the Netherlands in Europe; California and Washington states in the US; and from Québec in Canada

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
We are looking for a UX Designer who will be responsible for making our product useful, usable and enjoyable for our users. As well as acting as a subject matter expert on user behavior.

You Will...

Develop and maintain detailed user-interface specifications and design patterns

Proactively assess and recommend improvements to the user experience

Develop process flows, conceptual diagrams, sketches, wireframes, and prototypes to effectively conceptualize and communicate high-level design strategies and detailed interaction behaviors

Evaluating feature requests and working cross-team to determine value and prioritization

Creating user flows and UI optimizations

Establish consistent brand and creative designs

What You'll Need:

3+ years of UX design experience

1+ years experience working with a gaming or social media platform

Experience with prototyping software like Figma

Strong presentation skills

Nice To Have:

Experience working on heavily trafficked mobile applications and websites

SCRUM or Agile experience

Positions are currently equity based, with the potential to move into a full time paid role in the near future.

To apply or find out more, please email: jobs@zuvvii.com with 'UX Designer application' in the subject line.

Zuvvii Gaming focuses on Social Media, Games, Social Media Platforms, Mobile Games, and Console Gaming. Their company has offices in Argentina, United States, United Kingdom, Edinburgh, and Remote. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.zuvvii.com or find them on Twitter

title: UI/UX Designer - Veeva Link (Remote)
description:
Veeva is a mission-driven organization that aspires to help our customers in Life Sciences and Regulated industries bring their products to market, faster. We are shaped by our values: Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed. Our teams develop transformative cloud software, services, consulting, and data to make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do. Veeva is a work anywhere company. You can work at home, at a customer site, or in an office on any given day. As a Public Benefit Corporation , you will also work for a company focused on making a positive impact on its customers, employees, and communities.

The Role

You will create satisfying and compelling experiences for users of a product, drawing on results from user research and workflow analysis. You need to possess strong creative and problem-solving skills. Areas of focus include use case identification and definition, UI and UX design, asset creation and communication with... agile development teams.

This is a Work Anywhere role, however, you have to be based in the United Kingdom and be eligible for employment in the United Kingdom, as Veeva does not sponsor an employment visa for this opportunity.

What You'll Do
• Visualizing and presenting ideas for new functionalities
• Creating full designs and screen flows
• Creating product prototypes
• Creating and communicating assets and elements needed for development
• Analyzing user feedback and activity, and iterating to enhance the user experience
• Explaining user research results to internal stakeholders
• Conducting competitor and customer analysis

Requirements
• 3+ years of Design experience. You’ll ideally come from a similar industry, working in B2B saas companies with a strong emphasis on Design.
• A strong view on what good design means, you are detail-oriented and you can articulate to a variety of stakeholders what good should look like.
• Ability to understand business metrics and translate company goals and objectives into digital experiences
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to communicate ideas to developers
• Knowledge of main industry design tools; very good knowledge of Figma.
• Multi-tasking and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks
• Analytical mind with business acumen
• Ability to work both independently and in a team
• Experienced with UX for mobile (both iOS and Android) and Web
• Experience with the Design System
• Fluent English

Nice to Have
• Knowledge of the pharmaceutical industry
• Experience building data-driven products
Perks & Benefits
• Attractive compensation
• Annual charity contribution
• Annual learning budget
• Fitness reimbursements
• Home internet connection reimbursement

#RemoteUK Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world. Veeva is committed to fostering a culture of inclusion and growing a diverse workforce. Diversity makes us stronger. It comes in many forms. Gender, race, ethnicity, religion, politics, sexual orientation, age, disability and life experience shape us all into unique individuals. We value people for the individuals they are and the contributions they can bring to our teams

title: Senior UX/UI Designer: Tools
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North is on the lookout for a talented Senior UX/UI Designer: Tools who possesses a passion for video game content authoring tools and solutions. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar’s unique game development studio in the heart of Edinburgh.

WHAT WE DO
• We create and maintain software tools that are used by all game development disciplines to support the creation of all Rockstar Games projects.
• These software tools range from digital content exporters, a data processing asset pipeline to game, CI/CD automation systems and UI editors.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Drive... UI direction for internal tools; create high-fidelity finished assets for development.
• Help establish & maintain an internal Design System in collaboration with other departments, considering scalability, accessibility, usability and user needs.
• Lead the creation and governance of UI design systems in Figma, and in code. Identify when new components are needed, considering the downstream effects of UI design work on development.
• Work alongside other UXers on design of new tools & features.
• Create interactive prototypes of new tools & features.
• Conduct user testing on existing tools & prototypes.
• Collaborate closely with developers to bring designs to life & ensure consistency between design and development UI libraries.
• Collaborate closely with other UXers to ensure consistency across tools across the organisation.
• Help establish & develop internal process & practices around design.

QUALIFICATIONS
• 5+ years of experience as a UX Designer (or UI Designer with significant UX experience).
• Expert understanding of Figma, especially around library management & design systems.
• A degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) or a relevant field (design, software engineering) or equivalent qualifications or experience in a field of UX/UI.
• A portfolio or work samples demonstrating relevant experience in industry. (Pixel perfection not required! Examples of problem identification and pragmatic solution design preferred).

SKILLS
• Very strong interpersonal and communication skills.
• Excellent writing & presentation skills.
• Natural curiosity for how video games are made.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• Experience of working in an Agile environment.
• Experience working with large, complex applications or enterprise software.
• Experience working with game development tools.

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you’ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

title: UI/UX Designer - OutThink
description:
Remote (CET +/- 2 hours)

We are excited to be partnering with OutThink to support them in hiring for a UK based UX / UI Designer.

OutThink is seeking a UI/UX Designer to join their exciting start-up, working within a high-performing agile engineering squad, and playing a key role in building and delivering OutThink’s ground-breaking SaaS (Software as a Service) Cybersecurity Human Risk Management Platform.

The platform provides innovative and just-in-time learning experiences, nudges, and simulations to hundreds of thousands of users worldwide via desktop and mobile devices. At the same time, the system monitors training responses, collects security system data and continually gathers feedback. All this data is collated and processed by our cloud engines in Azure, culminating in the provision of sophisticated predictive human risk management models. Our models can drive automated countermeasures, and present analysis results via the delivery of highly visual and interactive online... dashboards.

The Role

You will have a design background with valuable UX knowledge gained from commercial experience. You will need to be a master at eliciting requirements from stakeholders, internal and external, and be able to design beautiful, elegant, and perfectly realisable user interfaces.

You should possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level business requirements into effective design artefacts such as task flows and wireframes, and further ensure that they can be transformed into intuitive and functional user interfaces.

You will need to communicate scenarios, end-to-end experiences, interaction models, and screen designs to stakeholders and be able to realise complex data visualizations.

This is a predominantly remote role in a remote team where open feedback, new ways of working and thinking out of the box are encouraged and expected.

Requirements

Responsibilities
• Investigating user experience design requirements for OutThink’s digital SaaS platform, in collaboration with Product Owners and other stakeholders.
• Translating complex business processes into intuitive and elegant use and product experiences.
• Working with teams internally to ensure the creation and delivery of beautiful and elegant experiences for users.
• Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, process maps, flow diagrams, storyboards, and prototypes.
• Assisting in developing and evaluating user stories and usability studies.

What You’ll Need
• A solid appreciation of art, beauty, and a keen sense of aesthetics to drive design innovation.
• A positive and proactive attitude with strong initiative and team-working skills.
• Good communication skills, with the ability to communicate in English in all forms.
• An understanding of the basics behind great software design.
• An eye for clean and artful design.
• Experience building data-centric web visualizations with an understanding of the limitations of web architecture design choices.
• 3+ years of solid commercial experience with UI design and prototyping tools, such as Sketch, Zeplin, Axure, Figma or Invision.
• Experience with Agile Development Methodology, working in short sprint cycles.
• Experience with Purpose-Driven Design processes.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills and self-assured to present your work and represent the team at all levels.
• Fluent in English.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
• Ability to learn new processes and concepts fast with a demonstrated sense of curiosity.
• Intrinsic drive and motivation to build a ‘world first’ and share our start-up vision.

Benefits

In Return, You’ll Receive
• This a rare opportunity to help build a global SaaS business and have full visibility of the entire operation
• You’ll learn and grow at a breakneck speed
• Great start-up culture in a fun, friendly, and hardworking team.
• Flexible remote working
• Share options package - a rare opportunity to get in early and have a stake in what could potentially be a unicorn start-up, with a huge financial payback
• 34 days paid holiday (including public holidays)
• Plus, an extra day off on your birthday!

Join us!

We are a remote-first company headquartered in London with teams across EMEA. You will be based in the UK, Spain or South Africa and are willing to travel, as the role requires.

We believe in: Trust and Integrity, Innovation, Customer Centricity, Purpose and Collaboration and are looking for someone who lives and breathes our values. We strive to be ‘exceptional’ in everything we do and have a lot of fun along the way!

All OutThinkers are part of our journey, so we offer equity options with every role and benchmark against other VC-backed companies to provide above-market-rate salaries for companies of our size.

Beyond this, plenty more makes OutThink an incredible place to work

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
This is a hybrid role that requires occasional travel to the Edinburgh office. Suitable travelling distance to Edinburgh is advised.

This is a great opportunity for any Junior UI/UX Designer to join one of the biggest sports betting publishers in the UK and Brazil. They have an audience of over 5,000,000 passionate sports betting fans across a range of social platforms and websites.

This is an organisation that has seen continuous growth every year since 2014, with no plan on slowing down. It’s a great opportunity to join an established team of designers, social media experts, marketing professionals and product developers to produce incredible user-centric design across a number of high traffic websites.

If you’re looking to join a team that are passionate about what they do, provide UI & UX solutions, build on your wireframing & prototyping knowledge and be part of a growing, exciting, contemporary business, this is the role for you!

The Role

You’ll be helping with the UI/UX... design process end-to-end, providing user-centric solutions to problems. You’ll be helping maintain the current websites with a mobile-first approach, optimising the existing interfaces and improving on the overall user experience. This will be achieved through the creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to create the best user journey possible.

You’ll be working towards the company’s mission; to create the safest, most powerful and engaging sports betting communities and websites in the world.

Responsibilities
• Delivery of innovative, user-centred website designs with great attention to detail.
• Optimisation of existing user interface to improve the user experience and maximise the number of conversions.
• Creation of interactive prototypes, wireframes, and user flows to deliver compelling digital experiences.
• Implementation of Figma design systems and component libraries to create fast and efficient processes.
• Collaboration with the product manager, designers, and developers to help bring your designs to the user.
• Providing developers with proper assets like style guides, icons, graphics, etc.
• Effectively working across multiple brands, implementing and adding to each brand’s creative assets and design systems.
• Reviewing front-end designs implemented by developers and provide feedback to ensure pixel-perfect experiences.

Requirements
• A strong portfolio that shows your strengths in both UX and visual design, particularly with mobile-focused website design.
• Experience using Adobe Creative Suite and Figma.
• Ability to use problem-solving skills to determine solutions to user interface challenges.
• Strong communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a team.
• A proactive, self-starter who takes pride in their work.
• An ambitious, team player who wants to contribute to long-term organisational goals.

Beneficial
• Experience creating design systems and component libraries from scratch in Figma.
• Experience working hands-on with developers and product managers.
• Experience working with Google Analytics, Hotjar or other digital analytics platforms.
• A passion for football as you’ll love what they do!
• Knowledge and/or an understanding of sports betting.

Package
• Pension contribution.
• Remote-first working. Office based in Edinburgh
• Work from home setup budget.
• Training budget to aid professional development.
• Phone bill contribution.
• Laptop and essential items provided.
• Regular social events, including tickets to sports events.
• Bupa private healthcare after 2 years of service

To be considered for this opportunity, please apply below, or get in touch with Fraser Gillespie.

E:

All submissions must include a portfolio

title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer
description:
Job Title: Mid-Level UI/UX Designer

Team: Design

Location: Sports Interactive, Here East, Olympic Park, London

Reporting to: Producer

Studio Overview

Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we’ve captivated a global audience of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We’re a wholly-owned subsidiary of SEGA, having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.

We’re a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. No matter how big we dream, though, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.

Further information on the company and its games is available at www.sigames.com.

Position Overview

We are seeking a talented UI/UX... Designer for our fast-growing Design team. Collaborating with the UI and Games Design teams you will be assisting in improvements being made to the overall UI of the product, with a specific focus on usability. This role offers the chance to work on and develop for the world’s leading football management simulation titles. We are also aiming to improve our accessibility support to ensure our games are enjoyed by a wider range of audiences and would hope the successful applicant shares that passion.

The successful candidate will be organised, self-motivated and able to communicate with all disciplines, both within the design team and across the wider studio. You'll be keen to share your expertise and experience as well as committed to the constant improvement of your own skills and knowledge.

Please note: Due to the high volume of applications we receive any applications without a portfolio link showcasing your best work will be discounted.

Key Responsibilities
• Collaborate with Games Design in developing new and exciting features for upcoming versions of Football Manager.
• Produce UI designs & assets of a consistently high quality.
• Communicate your work through Site Maps, User flows and early stage wireframing through to hi-res mock-ups.
• Work with the UI/UX Design Lead and Production to develop and grow your skillset.
• Within cross-disciplinary Feature Pods, collaborate with QA, Production, and other development disciplines to ensure all new features are placing the user and usability as a top priority.

Knowledge, Skill and Experience
• Strong understanding of key UI design principles
• Ability to produce high quality, visually appealing UI assets
• Ability to communicate clearly and tell stories throughout the design process
• Experience with visual design software such as Figma and Miro
• A passion for UIUX design
• A yearning to understand and meet the needs of the user
• Ability to work collaboratively and as part of a close-knit team
• Clear written and verbal communication.  

Desirable
• Experience creating prototypes, wireframes and developing user flows
• 2+ years UI/UX professional experience within software production (ideally within the games industry but not exclusively)
• Experience in Unity
• Animation or motion design skills (e.g. After Effects, Principle etc.)
• Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS or similar
• Basic Understanding of Accessibility settings in games
• Experience of Adobe Suite (Illustrator/Photoshop)
• Interest in Football Manager and Football, whilst very helpful, is not essential

Working Here

We approach everything with passion, whether that’s leaving our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who works here.

We like our talent to be tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to consistent improvement and encourage our people to truly realise their own personal potential.

We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you’re in. Above all else, we’re a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do and that’s one of the many reasons we’re one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).

If you want a positive work/life balance, we’re right behind you. While we live to create extraordinary games, we know that’s not all you’ve got going on, so you can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.

Our flexible working culture gives team members the responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid, and remote working options. Even in countries where we don’t directly employ*, we’ll explore what’s possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.

When you’re not here making the world’s best management games, there’s a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. We’re also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.
• We’re able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.

Inclusivity Matters

We’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.

SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process.

This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
THE ROLE:

We are looking for an intermediate or senior UI/UX Designer experienced in designing for PC and console games. You will find yourself within our creative team collaborating closely with our tech team. You would be responsible for the player's experience within the game systems and gameplay inside and out of the game's menus. Passion for unorthodox co-op mechanics is a plus.

While we prefer applicants with a right to work in the UK, candidates without it will still be considered due to the remote nature of the work. However, we do not foresee ourselves sponsoring visas in the short term.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Owning the full game user experience from onboarding, UX flow and controls to menu layouts and navigation.
• Defining UI/UX objectives & exploring the best possible solutions in collaboration with colleagues from other disciplines.
• Designing the logic, layout, and flow of the game's user interfaces based on information architecture and accessibility principles.
•... Illustrating design ideas using storyboards, animated mockups, process flows, and sitemaps and presenting them to others.
• Design of graphic user interface elements.
• Animation of GUI elements.
• Creation of functional prototypes for rapid iterations on key elements.
• Ensuring that signs and feedback clearly communicate the game information based on best practices in accessibility.
• Ensuring optimal interaction feedback.

title: UX Designer
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North is on the lookout for a UX Designer with great attention to detail and a passion for Human Centered Design principles and delivering user centered experiences. We are considering both mid and senior candidates.

WHAT WE DO

We work as a global UX design, UX writing and UI design team to create intuitive, effective, and engaging user interfaces across all Rockstar games.

We build bridges and foster close collaboration with teams across the business to turn the creative vision for the game into a seamless, high quality player experience.

We design for players and advocate for their... needs and expectations by applying user-centered design methodologies to our workflows.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Brief interpretation – able to dissect a design brief, identify knowledge gaps, additional information required, and objectives needed for the roadmap.
• Planning – choosing the correct deliverables for a project in collaboration with the necessary teams and wider business objectives.
• Process – understand, apply, and advocate for the users by employing user-centered design techniques and processes, from project initiation to on-going product evolution.
• Understanding – know how to interpret insights from existing and new research and how these apply to a project.
• Producing flows to demonstrate how an experience should function. These may be supported by the creation of complex interactive prototypes at various fidelity.
• Communicating complex architectures and content structures with clear diagramming and artefact creation.
• Collaborate and communicate with other teams continuously throughout the lifecycle of the project. Presenting work to stakeholders throughout project lifecycle.
• Always be aware of and learning evidence-based design methodology and ways to improve the work and design process.

QUALIFICATIONS
• 2+ years' professional experience in a design environment, or in a similar capacity within the games industry.
• Degree or equivalent work experience in a related field, such as Interaction Design, HCI, Human Factors and UX, Psychology, Anthropology, etc.
• Portfolio demonstrating applied UCD processes and full case studies.

SKILLS
• Experience in understanding complex content structures and designing and improving architecture for large scale systems.
• Problem solving for longevity and systems ready solutions rather than bespoke or one-off concepts.
• Strong creative problem-solving capabilities.
• Great communication skills to collaborate closely with our teams worldwide.
• Solid foundation and understanding of UX methodology and user centered design.
• Analytical and methodical in your approach to working.
• Build lasting relationships with internal stakeholders.
• Be proactive in your ongoing learning, skills development, and self-improvement.
• Proficiency in industry standard design tools (Figma, Framer, Adobe CC etc)
• Passion for playing and making games.
• A desire to share knowledge, expertise and help others improve their skills.
• Showing initiative when presented with a problem; even in moments when that problem is presented as a solution.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• Experience working on large scale enterprise projects and content management systems is advantageous but not essential.
• Experience with complex information architecture and content strategy is advantageous but not essential.
• Experience with compliance, accessibility for TV/GUIs/Console is advantageous but not essential.
• Multi-platform and omni-channel experience is advantageous but not essential.
• Understanding of the possibilities and limitations of front-end development and mark-up languages such as Javascript, CSS, XAML.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you've got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

title: UI/UX Design Manager
description:
Puffy is one of America’s fastest-growing e-commerce retailers. Our award-winning mattresses are developed with unrivaled attention to detail and are loved by millions of sleepers in America and Canada.

Since entering the bed-in-a-box market in 2016, we have experienced consistent and considerable year-on-year growth. Driven by a mission to make optimal sleep health a priority for all, we’ve made headlines on Entrepreneur.com and TechCompanyNews, to name a few. Puffy’s product range now extends to the entire bedroom, including pillows, bedding, and bedroom accessories.

The Role

Puffy are looking for a talented UI/UX Design Manager to help take our user centric design to the next level. The is a strategic, people management and operational role within our business.

What you'll be doing
• Enhance the user experience by creating seamless navigation within the e-commerce website and Landing pages
• Develop UI/UX strategy to support AB testing and Landing pages
• Develop wireframes and... prototypes around the business needs for AB tests
• Find creative ways to solve UX problems (e.g. usability, findability)
• Drive UI/UX strategy; manage and mentor junior designers about UX/UI design processes
• Communicate high-level design ideas and prototypes to stakeholders in meetings
• Understand user behavior and psychology, and review User testing results to support hypotheses made on UX.
• Understand and create compatible UI designs with UX wireframes in accordance with brand guidelines
• Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
• Build storyboards process flows, and sitemaps to conceptualize designs to accurately convey project plans to stakeholders.
• Collaborate with project manager and team for reporting, team assignments, status, and updates
• Take lead in creative development
• Keep UI/UX tasks up to speed and work closely with the digital project manager to ensure deadlines are met.
• Work closely with the Digital Marketing team to optimize the main funnel as well as dedicated landing pages for PPC.

Ideally you will have
• At least 3 years experience leading and managing a team of UX/UI Designers
• A minimum of 7 years of demonstrated experience in creating and implementing UX/UI design for e-commerce websites
• Proven work experience as a UI/UX Design Manager
• Background in research is a plus
• Proficient in design software (e.g. Sketch, Figma, InVision, Zeplin)
• Proficient with visual design programs such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and others
• Up to date with UX/UI trends and current design strategy and technologies
• Ability to prioritize and manage several milestones and projects efficiently
• Experience creating storyboards and website mapping
• Account for challenges using problem-solving skills and seek to optimize data for the best possible outcome
• Strong portfolio of design projects, willing to share in the interview
• Professional written and interpersonal skills when communicating with stakeholders

Puffy Perks & Benefits
• “We challenge the status quo.” Work with young and supportive colleagues. The leadership team are highly entrepreneurial, it reflects. Ideas, challenges, think tanks, it is all in your day to day.
• Not in Dubai yet? We will cover your visa requirements and help you settle with flights and temporary accommodation (2-week hotel stay).
• Flights home once per year.
• A modern and stylish open plan office in the heart of Dubai Marina. Dozens of restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and shopping within a 5 min walk! Ps. Don’t worry we have free company parking.
• We promote a healthy lifestyle! On top of world class health insurance (dental & vision included), our kitchen is stocked with organic snacks, juices, fruits, tea & coffee.
• Top tier tech stack. We are young and modern. G suite, Atlassian, Re-tool, Asana, Slack. Need something more? Ask away.
• The best equipment, whatever helps you get your work done. Choose your own laptop, monitor (we prefer curved Samsung screens;)), Super ergo office chairs, and whatever else you need.
• Closing the week with a delicious catered lunch on Friday

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer

Location:

London/ Hybrid Salary: £65,000 - £77,000 (Depending on Experience) About the Company:
Currency Solutions started in 2003 with the belief that every customer deserved access to excellent exchange rates, a premium service and the latest market insight and technology. Fast forward to today and weve successfully transitioned from start-up to a leading independent FX and international payments company. Headquartered in London with offices in four countries, weve sent billions securely around the world and been ranked Excellent on Trustpilot by our customers.

Today the world is different. Our core beliefs havent changed, but we recognise our delivery must if we are to successfully solve the complex challenges our customers are facing. In practice, this means finding both savings and stability in challenging trading environments, moving to an anticipatory model of servicing business and personal customers, and collaborating with industry partners to develop... new and compelling product and service offerings.

As part of our continuing growth, we are now looking for a skilled Senior UX Designer to join our technology team and play a key role in defining and designing amazing user interfaces. Role description:
As a Senior UX Designer at Currency Solutions, you will play a key role in working with both internal stakeholders and external users to research, define, validate, and design great user experiences. Using a variety of techniques and software, you will convert user needs into digital experiences, and in turn will go on to create the development artifacts needed to successfully take an idea through into delivery.

This will be the companys first UX hire, and you will need to be highly skilled in your field, operating with minimum oversight and prioritising your own workload. The role will report into the Head of Product. Your responsibilities:
Own the User Experience Take the UX lead in rebuilding our online products from scratch Run and facilitate in-person and remote workshops for both internal stakeholders, and external prospects and existing clients Working alongside Product and Engineering, take the lead role in defining design standards, guidelines, and templates, and ensure that they are adhered to Meet with clients to gather information about their requirements and validate your UX hypotheses Be comfortable with initial ambiguity, and be able to transform it into clearly defined requirements Run A/B / MVT experiments to test designs and validate assumptions Work closely with Product and Business Analysis to produce user stories and supporting collateral Create user personas, user journeys and site maps Produce great UX collateral across the whole product lifecycle, including rough sketches, interactive flat designs, high-def branded collateral, wireframes, prototypes and style guides using tools such as Axure, Miro, Figma, InVision, Balsamiq, etc.

Work on cross-platform applications to develop user experiences that transition multiple devices Work closely with both frontend and backend developers to ensure that user experiences are technically feasible and realistic The experience and competencies you will bring:
An ability to quickly build strong working relationships with stakeholders. Experience in leading change, driving decisions, and ensuring that all deliverables are fit for purpose and providing the intended value. Confidence in engaging stakeholders operating ls.

Experience working with cross-functional IT development teams within an Agile software delivery environment. A pragmatic approach to task prioritisation with outside the box problem solving skills. 5 years experience in a UX role within an organisation(s) using agile software development methodologies. Flexibility for occasional travel if required. Flexibility to of hours conference calls if required. Ideally experienced in using Design Sprints, but able to learn fast if not.

Experience in Fin Tech or Technology organisations would be beneficial, but not essential. A good working knowledge of and interest in currency exchange would be beneficial, but not essential.

Experience of working with both inhouse and offshore development teams would be beneficial, but not essential. If you think you are the right person for this role, please apply now

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
via: via HR Software For Growing Businesses | Freshteam
description:

💸 45-60k EUR per year (or local currency equivalent) full time contractor contract

ABOUT US

Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and... values as we do.

RESPONSIBILITIES

What can you expect?
• Designing websites and apps for internal projects and external clients and contributing to our internal design systems and processes
• Working closely with developers to bring your designs to life, by creating design specs, prototypes, and providing UI/UX feedback
• Creating effective and dynamic style guides and templates in Figma for other teams to produce social and digital marketing assets
• Producing fun, polished, well-designed assets using the Figma as primary tool and Adobe CC from time to time.
• Using a user focused design process to balance client, business and user needs to create the most effective design solutions
• Helping create polished client presentations
• Keeping up with design trends and tools
• Mentoring junior team members and helping set the standard of design for the company

QUALIFICATIONS

What's important to us:
• Excellent eye for detail particularly with regards to typography and layout
• Minimum of 3 years professional experience as a designer in a similar role: UI/UX design, product design, interaction design, etc
• Proven ability to design user flows, considering user needs, business needs, functionality, accessibility and aesthetics
• Mastery of Figma or willingness to learn quickly.
• Quick to learn and adapt to the dynamic nature of working with new tools, technologies and techniques
• High work-ethic, self-motivation and ability to work independently
• Strong time management skills with a proactive attitude towards communication with regards to your work
• Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities

YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT

Modern Tech Stack

We use the latest tools, hardware and methodologies across our teams. We’re always on the look-out for new ways of working and ensure everyone is setup with enough hardware firepower to excel, Windows or Mac.

Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here!

Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality and skills, we’re an international team with more than 125 people onboard and we’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working. In your role you will be working from 10am till 6pm.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.

PAYMENT

45,000 - 60,000 EUR per year, depending on experience and skills.

CONTRACT TYPE

Full time contractor contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

First, you will be invited for a 30-minute pre-interview via Zoom. We usually ask about your previous experience, future career path and motivation for changing your job.

If the pre-interview goes well, we will invite you to a second step - You will meet Jakub, our Design Manager, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom.
It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team.

If the technical interview with Jakub goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task.

And that’s it

title: UX / UI Designer

The successful candidate will have an eye for clean, simple design and be able to translate high-level user flows and wireframes into functional and intuitive user interface designs. WANdisco is the first and only data activation platform for accelerating digital transformation at scale. WANdisco makes infinite data actionable across clouds and enterprises in real time. WANdisco customers unleash the business value of the cloud with zero downtime, data... loss or disruption. WANdisco activates data to power AI and machine learning, create new services, and transform businesses. To learn more, visit www.wandisco.com

title: UI/UX Designer - Rocksmith
description:
Home to the North American Ubisoft headquarters since 1996, Ubisoft San Francisco opened its development studio in 2009 and since developed Rocksmith® and Rocksmith 2014, to teach millions of people how to play guitar and bass. With a song library of over 1,500 songs and 10 years of support the Rocksmith franchise helped millions of players around the world on their musical journey.
