Beâ€¯self-directed, able toâ€¯work independently and collaboratively with teamâ€¯members to solve challenges
Identify priorities and gaps in current designs, and contribute/iterate creative solutions
Be diligent and ensure quality of work in a fast paced, team based highly iterative development environment

A strong visual design and user experience background
Be able to conceptualize, present and execute ideas within a tight schedule
Extensive knowledge in design and wireframing tools
Strong visual, verbal, and written communication skills
Extensive knowledge ofâ€¯UI across multipleâ€¯platforms
Willingness to respond toâ€¯and adapt to feedback
Good positive attitude and outlook

Ubisoft is composed of over 20,000 talented people located in 55+ development studios and offices across the globe. With more than 80% of our teams dedicated to creation, Ubisoft is the biggest in-house creative force in the industry.

Ubisoft’s worldwide network of video game development studios and business offices work hand-in-hand each day to deliver rich and innovative gaming experiences that reflect the creativity and diversity of their teams. This cross-studio collaboration model means every team member has the opportunity to participate in challenging projects based on iconic brands including Assassin's Creed®, Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six Siege®, Tom Clancy's The Division®, For Honor®, Rabbids®, Rayman®, Watch Dogs®, Far Cry®, The Crew®, Just Dance® and more. title: UX Designer
description:
About Atos

Atos is a global leader in digital transformation with 110,000 employees in 73 countries and annual revenue of € 12 billion. European number one in Cloud, Cybersecurity and High-Performance Computing, the Group provides end-to-end Orchestrated Hybrid Cloud, Big Data, Business Applications and Digital Workplace solutions. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and operates under the brands Atos, Atos|Syntel, and Unify. Atos is a SE (Societas Europaea), listed on the CAC40 Paris stock index.

The purpose of Atos is to help design the future of the information space. Its expertise and services support the development of knowledge, education and research in a multicultural approach and contribute to the development of scientific and technological excellence. Across the world, the Group enables its customers and employees, and members of societies at large to live, work and develop sustainably, in a safe and secure... information space.

At Atos, our ambition is to be a diverse and inclusive company where people are truly free to be themselves. They can thrive, achieve their personal goals and innovate without limitations. We welcome everyone to apply.

Family friendly, flexible working arrangements will be considered across all roles.

The opportunity

Atos Digital Transformation Consulting (DTC) helps clients deliver innovation to their customers and improve cost and effectiveness by leveraging Information Technologies. With over 1,500 experts we provide advisory services and expertise so that our clients keep control of their processes and projects, can customise as much as required by directly managing the resources provided, and keep ownership of their assets and systems.

Our five clusters: Strategy, Insights & Experience, Efficiency, Technology Strategy & Transformation, Organisational Change and Digital Compliance offer a range of cost-effective transformation and innovative solutions tailored to each industry-sector.

We are looking for motivated forward-thinking UX Designers, who love working in a fast-paced environment to join our team!

Responsibilities:
• Leading the design workstream within Customer Experience or wider Digital Transformation projects.
• Managing relationships with client stakeholders.
• Refinement of our core offerings by providing expertise and keeping up to date with the latest trends.
• Working with senior practice members to support business development activities.
• Building thought-leadership to help position Atos's brand in the marketplace.
• Line management and mentorship of junior team members.
• Coordinating the transfer of knowledge and skills across the team, sharing best practice.

Skills & experience we can't do without:
• Understanding and experience working with quan and qual data to create evidence based design (and on occasions conducting your own research activities).
• UI/UX specialist for web/mobile/enterprise/emerging digital touchpoints.
• Strong design background, with experience defining design systems/patterns and an understanding of UX best practice.
• Affinity with creative design tools such as Adobe Creative Cloud, Figma, Sketch, etc.
• Ability to work across the end-to-end design lifecycle from strategy, conceptualisation, information architecture, wireframes/prototypes, UI content creation, art working, quality checking (ensuring the final product matches the initial designs).
• Workshop facilitation skills using Design Thinking/ Human Centred Design or similar techniques to elicit innovation solutions that solve customer needs.
• Appreciation of technology constraints and opportunities.
• Handling client relationships, particularly the ability to understand clients' needs and challenges.
• Circa 5 years of experience in Customer Experience and Digital Transformation.
• UK and Ireland mobility to deliver client projects.

Skills & experience we'd like:
• Government Digital Service (GDS) design system knowledge.
• Experience completing user research.
• Service design experience.

What we offer?
• Attractive salary.
• 25 days of Annual leave + an option to purchase more through our Flexible Benefits.
• Flex benefits system - exciting opportunity to choose your own benefits.
• Retail discounts.
• Pension - matching contribution up to 10%.
• Private Medical Scheme.
• Life Assurance.
• Enrolment in our Share scheme - subject to scheme eligibility criteria.
• Unlimited opportunities to learn in our Training platforms.

We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to the application process for people with disabilities. Individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation!

Here at Atos, we want all of our employees to feel valued, appreciated, and free to be who they are at work. Our employee lifecycle processes are designed to prevent discrimination against our people regardless of gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, neurodiversity, disability status, citizenship, or any other aspect which makes them unique. Across the globe, we have created a variety of programs to embed our Atos culture of inclusivity, and work hard to ensure that all of our employees have an equal opportunity to contribute and feel that they are exactly where they belong

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Are you an experienced and talented UI/UX Designer looking for your next career opportunity with a leading global SaaS organisation?

As a pioneering global technology firm and market leader in our field, VoucherCart is a voucher and gift card technology disruptor.

We are growing fast and are looking for an experienced and talented UI\/UX designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design across our platform. We pride ourselves on trust, respect, and teamwork and value our most important asset above everything else; our people.

The Role

This is a fantastic opportunity for a Senior UX/UI Designer with an appetite for learning and the ability to grow their own role within the organisation and push new boundaries in design.

You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimised for usability, and exceptional visual design. The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to... UI\/UX design by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

Requirements:

Working knowledge of some of the following technologies and software: Figma, Sketch, InVision, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, Adobe Creative Suite and Adobe XD.
• Display a strong portfolio of professional UI\/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms.
• Be Articulate & Confident with excellent English written and verbal communication skills.

A keen collaborator with the ability to work independently as well as in a team, you will:
• Investigate user experience design requirements for our full suite of new and existing digital assets.
• Develop and conceptualize a comprehensive UI\/UX design strategy for the brand
• Produce high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes
• Have strong graphic design skills in the production of all recognised file-formats including vector imagery for both digital and print production.
• Collaborate with the marketing team, product owner, developers, and designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user.
• Be highly driven and focused on taking ownership of the delivery of targets
• Prioritize projects, communicate progress, and deliver on time
• Adhere to branding and style standards on typography and graphic design.

What we offer

Salary range: £25K - £35K (Depending on Experience) + Annual Salary Review

You’ll be part of a friendly and focused team in an environment that promotes an open, empowered culture where everyone pulls together and is passionate about the solutions they’re delivering and the impact on UK healthcare. You’ll be encouraged to leverage your UX experience, along with your natural creative flair and great communication skills, to innovate design concepts across the full suite of web, desktop, and mobile user environments.

You’ll receive a competitive salary and pension package and opportunities to develop your career further, along with the chance to directly influence and impact the evolution and direction of the world’s leading voucher and gift card technology platform.

Working Hours

Full-Time

Location

Edinburgh, UK or Katowice, Poland + Remote/Work from Home

How to Apply

Please send all applications including CV and Portfolio of works to jobs@vouchercart,com

Additionally, you may choose to provide a Video CV - (Up to 120 seconds of intro about you, your experience, and why we should hire you

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer
Fully remote, Edinburgh HQ
£40,000-65,000

Overview:
We are working with a household name in Financial Services that build and deliver intuitive, customer-led products used by hundreds of thousands of customers across the UK to add to their highly respected Customer Experience and Design team.
The organisation have a deep understanding of the benefits of great design and is keen to maximise this, supporting a well-established and high-performing design team with a Senior UX Designer to deliver customer-centred design solutions.
If you are passionate about delivering engaging end-to-end, cross-channel experiences, this one’s for you!

About You:
Your background can be within any industry – from in-house with clients or agency side, but you will hopefully have strong experience delivering high traffic, data-driven applications and be passionate about delivering research-driven design decisions.
The design team work with multiple departments within the organisation, so... projects are highly varied and can include web updates, mobile app design, internal platform design, service design and looking to the future - how to design for customers in a cost of living crisis.

This position will join an established and experienced Design Function of almost 30, where you will have full support and backing from the team.

You will be part of a team responsible for:
• Researching and working on high-performing applications used by millions of customers across the UK.
• Looking for innovative ways to help customers manage their money as easily as possible
• Working to support the retail part of the business and using the data of thousands of shoppers to make informed, design decisions.
• Assessing design solutions after launch to evidence impact and driving future optimisation.
• Designing impactful products and journeys in a cost of living crisis.

This position can be undertaken on a remote-first basis, with current team members spread across the UK. The organisation will cover the expenses of any visits to their Edinburgh HQ when required. The team currently try to meet once per month for meaningful collaboration, something purposeful (e.g. design speakers) as well as social.

Company Details:
The organisations' senior leadership team are committed to user-centric development and invests heavily across the Customer Experience division of the bank.
This organisation is embracing the future. You will be supported by highly experienced Product and Customer Experience Teams who are passionate about creating exceptional products for their customers.
The company offer an excellent benefits package including matched pension up to 7.5%, 28 days + bank holidays, bonus scheme and discounts across the company's retail outlets and services.

You will work alongside UX/UI Designer and DevOps/Cloud engineers and Business Analysts to deliver innovative, high quality, solutions.
Barclays is one of the world's largest and most respected financial institutions, with 329 years of success, quality, and innovation behind us. We offer careers that provide endless opportunity – helping millions of individuals and businesses thrive and creating financial and digital solutions that the world now takes for granted.

We’re committed to providing a supportive and inclusive culture and environment for you to work in. This environment recognises and supports ways to balance your personal needs, alongside the professional needs of our business. Providing the opportunity for all our employees... globally to work flexibly empowers each of us to work in a way that suits our lives as well as enabling us to better service our customers’ and clients’ needs. Whether you have family commitments or you’re a carer, or whether you need study time or wish to pursue personal interests, our approach to working flexibly is designed to help you balance your life. If you would like some flexibility, then please discuss this with the hiring manager, and your request will be reviewed subject to business needs.

We are currently in the early stages of implementing a hybrid working environment, which means that many colleagues spend part of their working hours at home and part in the office, depending on the nature of the role they are in. We’re flexible on how this works and it may continue to change and evolve. Depending on your team, typically this means that colleagues spend a minimum of between 20% to 60% of their time in the office, which could be over a week, a month or a quarter. However, some colleagues may choose to spend more time in the office over a typical period than their role type requires. We also have a flexible working process where, subject to business needs, all colleagues globally are able to request work patterns to reflect their personal circumstances
Please discuss the detail of the working pattern options for the role with the hiring manager.
What you’ll be doing?
• You will be quality checking across various programmes of work and delivering this in a timely manner
• Presenting ideas and designs to colleagues and adapting work based on reviews and direct feedback
• Participating and providing feedback in code reviews
• Developing innovative solutions that will enhance the client experience and providing cost-effective solutions
• Developing fellow team members through mentoring and code review
• Working within a large & multidisciplinary team and coordinating and communicating with colleagues effectively
• Dealing with complex technical problems and making sound decisions and using independent judgment
What we’re looking for:
• University degree in an Engineering, mathematical or computer science discipline with experience of application client and server development in the web and/or mobile domain
• Language and UI Experience to include JavaScript, ReactJS and CSS3 with Middleware DB and familiarity with GraphQL/ Apollo, NodeJS & with RDMS of MariaDB
• Test experience with some form of unit testing and proven ability to take ownership of tasks - ability to monitor/ report progress and deliver to completion
• Ability to demonstrate previous evidence of drive, energy, commitment, and enthusiasm while operating in an Agile delivery environment with good logical reasoning
Skills that will help you in the role:
• Development experience for hosting on cloud platforms such as AWS
• Experience with REST and RDBMS (SQL Sever, Oracle SQL) and compatible ORMs e.g. hibernate/GROM
• Experience with Jest and Cypress, along familiarity in Selenium Webdriver, JUnit, Spock, Mockito, TypeScript, Java, .Net, Groovy and Scala
• Knowledge of tools like GIT, VSCode/ IntelliJ, SQLWorkbench, SonarQube, Jenkins/TeamCity, Docker/Kubernetes, OpenShift, NodeJS, Web driver/Cypress & Angular
Where will you be working?
Our new state-of-the-art Campus, right in the heart of Glasgow is a hub of creative collaboration. A place where everyone can bring their true selves to work and reach their full potential. Home to 5,000 of our colleagues, our Tradeston campus will support the community in more ways than one - by creating thousands of new career opportunities and celebrating local artists. A short walk from Central Station on the south of the Clyde, it will be a key location for the Barclays business that will deepen our ties with the city and its communities.

title: Product Designer, UX/UI - Dashboard and Listening Experiences
description:
About BeyondWords

BeyondWords was founded from a desire for instant access to information through audio.

Our all-in-one voice cloning and audio publishing CMS helps businesses easily make their articles, research, and insights listenable in AI voices that resonate with their audiences.

We’re looking for a capable UX/UI Designer to join our team to help us solve complex problems, enabling us to develop groundbreaking audio experiences that bring the convenience of audio to millions of listeners across the web.
• What you’ll do: *
• Collaborate with product and engineering to reimagine audio interfaces exposed to millions of listeners each day.
• Build and maintain a new design system.
• Collaborate with product and engineering to produce concepts, prototypes and mockups.
• Challenge status quo on creativity and quality of design work across the team.
• Collaborate with sales and marketing to align assets with the design system.

Who you are:
• You have 3+ years of experience... designing at consumer or enterprise tech or media companies.
• You are able to apply first-principles thinking and other mental models to your design thinking.
• You are passionate about new technologies (e.g. Figma) and are happy to work alongside technical teams.
• You have excellent visual design skills as well as a solid UX design foundation.
• You are able to provide a brief explanation and link to a portfolio/presentation in your application and explain why you think you’re excellent for this role.

More about BeyondWords:

We’re a remote-first team of 12, spread across the UK and Europe. Our technology is used by some of the largest news brands in the world, bringing audio to their articles that generates millions of streams every month. Our goal is to continue our expansion into new geographies and verticals, such as finance, consulting, and healthcare.

We’re backed by top angels and VC’s, including Audible’s Newark Venture Partners, and have been awarded an Innovate UK grant. We’re now developing voices for some of the world’s most well-respected news brands and businesses.

BeyondWords focuses on SaaS, B2B, Audio, and Artificial Intelligence / Machine Learning. Their company has offices in London. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees. To date, BeyondWords has raised $1.65M of funding; their latest round was closed on April 2021.

You can view their website at https://beyondwords.io/ or find them on Twitter and LinkedIn

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Everyday we tackle new and exciting challenges to empower developers to build responsive and flexible cloud, mobile, and edge computing applications that scale effortlessly. Couchbase delivers unmatched versatility, performance, scalability and financial value across cloud, on premises, hybrid, distributed cloud and edge commuting deployments. The database market is one of the largest undisturbed markets for enterprise software. The main catalyst for this is the need for digital transformation. Join Couchbase to be a part of a greater change. Here you’ll have the opportunity to learn and grow with some of the most innovative, passionate and humble individuals in the database industry.

You are a UI/UX Designer/Engineer who crafts delightful web interfaces, designs, prototypes new and innovative experiences, and implements features while advocating for UX.

Here's a brief look at what success looks like in this role:

In three months, you’ll have collaborated with the team to deliver a... material contribution, contributed to code reviews and fed into technical discussion.

In six months, you’ll have earned the trust of the team and are actively collaborating on the design of new features.

In twelve months, you are regularly delivering tasks through the entire SDLC and have established a cadence of timely delivery without cutting corners

• Ship code regularly.

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
As a UX Designer you would responsible for taking the UX research insights and apply them into actual designs of the web and mobile applications that meet the above experience goals for the customers. You will be involved in every aspect of the user experience right from paper sketching flows to using automated tools for wire-framing to using design tools like Figma, Adobe Creative Cloud etc. to generate production quality designs and then hand-off to developers.

You would be primarily responsible for performing the below activities:

•Gathering user requirements and identifying the key user problem areas
•Create User Personas and translate these insights into wireframes for web, mobile / tablet form factors (e.g. paper sketches or wire framing tools) and conduct early usability tests with the users to understand their interaction with the current system and refine the wireframes accordingly
•Get sign-off on wireframes and convert them to production quality designs using any of the... tools like Figma / Sketch / Adobe XD etc.
•Generate and hand-off assets for web / mobile developers to develop the application to match platform requirements (e.g. assets for iOS, Android and web based apps etc.)
•Conduct design audit to ensure the final deliverables meet the actual signed off designs and are both usable and consistent across the application

Skills (Mandatory): the candidate must have proficiency in the following namely:

•UX Requirements Gathering, Persona Creation and Customer Journey Mapping
•Understanding of Usability and Accessibility is preferable
•Knowledge of working with design systems is preferable
•Wire-framing and prototyping web, mobile and tablet experiences using tools (for example Sketch, Balsamiq, Axure, UXPin, Proto.io etc.)
•Knowledge of working with UX design tools (for example Figma / Adobe XD etc.) and ability to design for web and mobile user interfaces (as per iOS and Android design guidelines)
•Strong Presentation, Written and Oral Communication skills

Educational Qualifications:
•Any Graduate or Diploma holder, Undergraduates with relevant UX experience / certifications / work portfolio
•Any relevant certification in Human Computer Interaction, Human Factors and Accessibility will be highly preferred

Additional Requirements:
•The candidate is required to show a portfolio of his/her work before or during the interview

title: Senior User Experience Designer (UX)
description:
Senior UX Designer- Remote

Who We Are

At 8th Light, we take a human-centered design (HCD) approach to crafting digital solutions, collaborating with the people writing code as well as those using it. We embrace the need for adaptability in a constantly changing world. Our design team is composed of thinkers and doers, with a breadth and depth of experience across UX research, UX design, UI design, and implementation with specific expertise in software product design and delivery, ready to take on most any challenge that we encounter.

As an employee-owned software consultancy, we consider software design and development a craft. We’re driven by our deep commitment to excellence, and powered by our collective depth of knowledge and experience.. We value colleagues who enjoy learning and teaching, which creates our collaborative organization.

We enjoy working with empathetic, passionate collaborators who value the work they do. At this time, we are seeking a Senior UX Designer, with... a keen interest in user research, to join our human-centered software design team.

Who You Are

A UX Designer with a depth of experience focusing on understanding and advocating for users. You’ve contributed to all aspects of design, iterating through potential solutions, mental models, and feature priorities through personas, user journeys, wireframes, prototypes, information architecture, and detailed design. You’ve successfully:
• Performed user research through a variety of methods throughout the design process (including usability testing in preparation for delivery)
• Synthesized user insights into opportunity areas for design
• Established information architecture and content strategy informed by research synthesis
• Led UX workshops (project planning, design thinking, research and synthesis activities, generative co-creation and prioritization of design opportunities)
• Performed iterative design prototyping from low fidelity sketches to high-fidelity interactive experiences
• Regularly sought and participated in design reviews with project teams and the broader design discipline through a lens of usability, accessibility, feasibility, and aesthetic quality
• Collaborated closely with developers to ensure faithful interpretation of design through delivery

What You’ll Do At 8th Light

You’ll create user research procedures and assets (personas, journey maps, etc.) as well as user interface wireframes and prototypes, working with fellow design team members. You will also support client projects, performing user research and creating software user experiences . In unison with the design and engagement teams, you will be responsible for:
• Designing human-centered software solutions across a range of industries and client organizations, with 5+ years of experience.
• Applying the design process to solve complex problems across a variety of software contexts (e.g. mobile, desktop, web, and hardware) with a portfolio that demonstrates your skills
• Collaborating with designers and developers on integrated teams to bring designs to life
• Facilitating effective communication with internal teams, clients and partners in team and workshop contexts
• High-quality presentation and writing skills
• Intermediate experience with Figma, along with other industry design and prototyping tools and frameworks
• Knowledge of emerging technologies e.g., web3

Nice to Have

We work across many areas, and encourage anyone with the experience mentioned above to apply. Given recent client requests, we would particularly like to encourage applicants with experience in the following areas:
• Design consulting across a range of industries and client organizations
• Integrated human-centered design and Agile delivery practices

How You’ll be Supported

We recognize that creating a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization is an ongoing journey. We want our people to feel supported and encouraged to embrace their most authentic selves. Our wellness package at 8th Light is centered around the Whole YOU. Offerings that include:
• £1,500 annual budget for learning & development
• L&D time allotment of 120+ hours per year
• Flexible PTO
• Wellness days
• 12 weeks of new parent leave available immediately
• Fertility benefits
• Semi annual promotion panel

See our full list of Benefits

Join Us

We recognize that creating a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive organization is an ongoing journey, and we’re excited to share our journey with you. We have a proud tradition of hiring talented colleagues with unusual career experiences. We're more interested in your experiences, results, and impact than brand names, degrees, or keywords that may appear on your resume. We appreciate your time in completing a few application questions to help us get to know you better.

8th Light is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

#LI-Remote

8th Light focuses on Consulting, Web Design, Software, Web Development, and Testing. Their company has offices in Los Angeles, New York City, Austin, and Chicago. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.8thlight.com or find them on Twitter, Facebook, and LinkedIn

title: User Interface Designer
description:
A disruptive start-up in Glasgow is looking for a UI Designer to join the team. The company have identified an opportunity in a monopoly market that they believe they can shake up with new, end-to-end software and have managed to secure backing for this already.

They’ve started to bring together a highly-skilled team to begin the build of this new software after having extremely positive feedback through successful talks of their beta product.

Ideally, you’ll have experience of working across end-to-end design and experience of working across B2B products. If not, experience building customer facing applications would work fine too. There isn’t lots and lots of research to be done within the role as the founders of the company have continuously been doing research over the last year, so the role will be more focused on UX & UI Design. They've recently brought in a UX Designer to the team and are now looking for someone that is more focused on UI & Visual Design that will complement... the team.

The software that the company will be building involves 3D elements, so you’ll work very closely with the 3D/Visual expert as well as the CTO, Developers and founders of the company.

They aren’t looking for someone that has years and years of experience, as long as you’ve got experience across at least one product, that is fine with them. If you are super experienced, they are happy to consider you as well, but they do have a slight preference for someone a bit rougher around the edges.

The company is based in Glasgow, but they can offer fully remote working – there will be on-site meetings every now and then so they’re ideally looking for someone to at least be based in Scotland.

Salary for the role is up to £45,000 but they could potentially go above this for someone that is perfect.

If you’re a Designer that wants to work for a disruptive start-up, then please apply and/or get in touch with Jack Steven at Cathcart Technology

Proficiency in HTML, CSS and JavaScript
Knowledge of sports betting and sports data feed providers is preferable
The successful candidate can expect a salary of £40k - £50k and a range of excellent benefits including a generous annual bonus.

If you are an ambitious UI Designer seeking a challenging role where you can make a real impact and progress through the ranks then apply NOW!

If you are interested please apply ASAP. The People Network is an employment agency and will respond to all applicants within three - five working days. If you do not hear within these timescales please feel free to get in touch

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
We’re looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer with an eye for clean and artful design, superior UI/UX skills and the ability to translate high-level requirements into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

Requirements:
• Legally eligible to work in the UK
• 5+ years of proven UX UI experience.
• Strong portfolio of product design.
• Experience within the fintech and ecommerce industry - a strong advantage.
• Excellent communication skills.
• An eye for a clean and simple design.
• Experience in user research, user flows, and creating wireframes.
• A self-starter and an autodidact that is able to explore and progress by yourself.
• You have excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize and meet deadlines.
• Proficiency in Figma - a strong advantage.
• Ability to illustrate vector icons and figures - a strong advantage.

About Us:

Overwolf is the world’s leading platform for in-game creators and gamers who build or consume user-generated content around... their favorite games. We’re talking about some of the biggest AAA titles out there – games like Minecraft, League of Legends, World of Warcraft, PUBG, and Fortnite – to name just a few.

The way people create and play games around the world is changing, and Overwolf is leading the revolution. We empower just about 100K creators to make the best games even better - giving them everything they need to create unique gaming experiences that serve more than 33M gamers every month.

Our mission is to turn in-game creation into a new profession and build the next generation of games. And we’re just getting started.

Are you ready to join the pack and shape the future of gaming?

Responsibilities:

In this role, you will:
• Collaborate with our product and engineering teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, focusing on user experience.
• Create industry-leading eCommerce experiences with a focus on high conversion rates.
• Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering.
• Research, brainstorm, create wireframes, and design product UI to bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks.
• Work in constraints of a specific brand and within design system guidelines

title: FREELANCE Mid-weight UX/UI or digital designer
description:
Mid-weight UX/UI or digital designer (starting ASAP until the end of the year)

The project is a web redesign

- This role focuses on desktop screens and it would essentially mean that we need someone to take already signed-off mobile screens and rework them into desktop screens

Although there's a level of interpretation and UX skills needed, someone that's able to follow the pages on mobile and turn them into desktop pages without any issues is who the client needs!

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Stenn are looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer. Could this be you?

You probably want to know what’s involved?

Our designers work closely with product managers, engineers, and analysts to apply their passion for creating great user experiences and engaging features across every stage of product creation. A typical day may involve conducting user interviews, designing user flows, rapid prototyping, wireframing or creating polished final designs for release.

This role presents a unique opportunity to not only be hands-on with product development, but to establish a customer-centric design culture at a fast-growing startup in the early stages of growth.

How will we measure success in this role?

To be successful in this role, you will need to have a deep understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies, as well as experience with industry-standard design tools and software. You should also have excellent communication and leadership skills, and be able to work... collaboratively in a fast-paced, agile environment.

In your first 12 months we will be looking for you to deliver a great user experience with elegant design solutions within your product area, create a beautiful and flexible design system and level up our existing design capability.

How do you know if you are the right candidate?

You will currently have a great portfolio of work that clearly outlines both great design and value generated for the end customer, comfortable working with both in-person and remote teams using scrum methodology and hands on experience building products and/or features.

Last but not least - Who are Stenn?

Stenn is one of the leading FinTechs in Europe and a category leader in digital trade finance for international SMEs. Founded in 2015, Stenn’s purpose is to connect international SMEs to the global financial system, helping to bridge a reported $3.6 trillion (USD) financing gap through a fast, simple online platform. To date, Stenn has issued over $10 billion (USD) of finance to SMEs in more than 70 countries, with capital provided by several blue-chip banks and institutional fund managers across the globe.

Rapid expansion continues at Stenn, as under-served SMEs seek financing solutions to manage significant macroeconomic and supply chain disruption; and this follows our $50 million Series A fundraise earlier this year, valuing Stenn at $900 million.

Our HQ is in London with employees across the globe, including the USA, Europe and China. We are made up of diverse, highly skilled professionals who work in an innovative way to develop and drive our business further. Our people are empowered to work autonomously through a trusting leadership style which encourages learning

title: UI/UX Manager
description:
UX/UI Design Manager
This is a 12-month rolling contract paying up to £650 per day INSIDE IR 35 fully remote.
Company/project overview:

A global corporation with over 150,000 employees and a billion-pound turnover is currently a UX/UI Design Manager with technical leadership capabilities within an agile environment.
Ideally, the chosen manager will have proven experience providing global UX and UI leadership, interaction design and information architecture.
The UX/UI Design Manager will be responsible for the successful delivery, innovation and development of Design.
They will work effectively within the Agile methodology employed in the Digital team and ensure the UX and Visual Design team are a positive and constructive part of the Scrum working approach.
Role responsibilities:

They will work together with the UX&VD leadership team will prioritise a broad spectrum of projects and requests against organisational goals and Digital objectives, in line with the vision of the Digital... Director.
They will set clear deliverables and measures of progress for their team, and maintain a positive, supportive and inclusive work culture.
The UX/UI Design Manager needs to:

Provide leadership and mentoring to the team of UX AND UI designers
Successfully drive innovation in UX design across a complex range of digital platforms, products and services, spanning both our commercial English and Exams portfolio
Work with stakeholders to the highest level, providing insight into the principles and benefits of an enterprise-level focus on the organisations audiences and user centred design methodology
Successfully lead efforts to develop, document and systematise our design / interaction patterns into a global library
Help contribute to the development and delivery of a new domain strategy; leading the creation and UX and visual design solutions as part of its implementation
Ensure inclusive design is embedded in all our design solutions; creating and implementing an inclusive design strategy that enables the organisation to make its digital estate accessible to all
Improve the quality of our employee digital experience by improving the quality of design within internal platforms used by teams around the world
Experience required:

Must have strong leadership capabilities within a digital global corporation - preferably Education or Public Sector
Must have UX and UI leadership and technical experience
In-depth knowledge of Agile design and development processes
Significant knowledge and experience of delivering high quality UX/UI design, interaction design and information architecture.
Ability to influence and work collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels.
Experience in supporting and working in effective cross-functional project team
This is a 12-month rolling contract paying up to £650 per day INSIDE IR 35 - fully remote

title: Product Designer (UI)
description:
We’re looking for a Product Designer to join our Manchester studio. We need somebody who is passionate about learning from user behaviour, attitudes and emotions to create exceptional products and services.

Your background will be predominantly in UI design but we’re keen to see diversity in your work, such as your approach to research and insights and your ability to collaborate with other disciplines in the studio.

You'll have the skills to develop research and insights to visualise ideas, you love to see your work come to life and have a portfolio to prove it.

Your work will also show a clear thought process. It’s not all about the finished product, but how you got there that is most interesting to us.

Requirements

You will be working collaboratively with Absurd teams throughout all stages of a project. You will be a contributor to the design process, ways of working and looking to push the boundaries within our open agile environment.
• Experience working on digital products... and services within a number of sectors and industries.
• Portfolio to demonstrate your experience and product design work across a range of projects.
• Experience in designing for Web, Android and iOs and knowledge of respective Human Interface guidelines.
• Proactive problem solving approach to the design challenge with an inquisitive mind.
• Advocate for Human Centred Design approaches, tools and processes.
• Experience producing and using Design systems.
• Confidence in presenting your design rationale to colleagues or clients.
• Skills in communicating and influencing product strategy.
• Creative mind, collaboration skills and a desire to learn.
• Awareness of trends and best practice in UI and UX design.

Responsibilities
• Play a primary role in defining product direction, approaches, and apply research, data and insights to make informed design decisions.
• Contribute and assist with facilitation of a range of workshops in the design approach.
• Work with multidisciplinary teams to create and deliver solutions that satisfy the needs of the business and the end user.
• Produce Design Systems and supporting assets.
• Design prototypes to try things out, mitigate risk and learn.
• Work with the Engineering and Development teams to ensure design is successfully considered throughout the implementation stage.
• Share knowledge, trends and best practices with team members.

About Absurd

Absurd is a Product and Service Design agency established in 2016 by our two founders.

Due to the continued growth of the agency across both new and existing clients, we are looking for new team members to help shape the culture as well as the skill set within Absurd.

This is an exciting opportunity for somebody to come in and put their stamp on our growing team.

We offer:
• Flexible Working Hours.
• Pension Scheme.
• Discretionary Performance Bonus.
• Most importantly this is an opportunity to be part of a growing team and agency.

To do the best work, we need the best people in the best frame of mind

That's why our team are only welcome in the studio four days per week.

We encourage our team members to spend the other day working remotely. We don't mind where, because we all find inspiration in different places

title: Senior UX Designer Jobs
description:
About the job

You combine exceptional craft in working through the details of a visual design with good problem-solving and communication skills. You are a master with Figma and you can draw quick wireframes to communicate ideas.

You are at your best when collaborating with other designers, researchers, product managers, and developers to create designs that marry the best of user, business + technology thinking.

You are detail oriented. You empathize and advocate for the user. Sound like you? Great, read on for what is involved.

What is your typical day?
• Collaborate with project teams comprised of business and technology stakeholders at all levels
• Create wireframes, UI design, and prototypes using modern design tools
• Share your work with designers, developers, and stakeholders across multiple teams
• Participate n user research and partnering with internal researchers
• Provide solutions for applications that aggregate data from multiple sources
• Collaborate with other UX... designers and researchers offering advice and constructive feedback on design/usability review
• Write, speak and present information effectively and confidently in a variety of communication/corporate settings

What do you need to bring to be considered?
• Bachelor’s degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction/Interface Design, Graphic Design, Technology Communications
• Previous in depth experience as a designer for enterprise software, responsive web applications, mobile apps, and defining in-house style guides & documenting standards
• Experience with modern design tools – Figma, Sketch, Invision, or equivalent
• A balance of creativity, productivity + a passion for elegant, simple, emotionally rich design
• Excellent communication, listening, and negotiation skills with clients and senior executives
• Strong understanding and commitment to usability and user-centered design principles/methods; including experience in a variety of usability evaluation techniques such as usability testing, contextual interviews, and heuristic evaluations
• Strong understanding of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0) and assistive technologies (JAWS, NVDA, Zoomtext)
• General understanding of the capabilities of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React.
• Experience across multiple teams and release cycles working closely with design, product management + development to realize experiences using agile project management
• A11y knowledge/experience

title: Product Designer (UI design) (Hybrid)
description:
• Creating user experiences across our websites and native apps that will delight our customers.

title: UI/UX Designer - 13356
description:
Skillsearch has an exciting opportunity for a talented and experienced UI/UX Designer with Games experience to join our client's welcoming and inclusive team. This full-time UI/UX design role is remote in the UK and comes with a favourable salary and benefits package.

As a UI/UX Designer, you will establish the core visual interface of the company's platform. You will have a solid understanding of game UX, demonstrate superior visual design skills, translate high-level requirements into best-in-class interaction flows and transform those flows into beautiful, intuitive and functional user interfaces as well as previous games experience.

In your first few weeks in this UI/UX Designer role, you can expect to:
• Design creative, player-focused, user-friendly wireframes, user flows, animations and supporting material for the platform
• Produce stunning user interface art assets complimenting and enhancing the platform's visual identity style guide
• Work hands-on with developers and... other artists to implement user interfaces into the software
• Act as the player advocate during the development process, subjecting early-stage designs to usability testing and expert review to iteratively improve solutions

To apply for this UI/UX design job, you will need 3+ years of experience creating user interfaces for video games and an outstanding body of work demonstrating UI solutions. You will also require excellent visual design skills concerning colour theory, layout and typography with sensitivity to user-system comprehension and interaction. In addition, you should have solid experience in information design, creating user flows, wireframes, prototypes and other UX design material. A proven ability to work with designers, producers and engineers to develop the designs through an iterative process is also essential.

If you’re looking to make a positive impact and create change, possessing an inclusive and committed approach, you will be rewarded with an excellent salary and benefits package.

If this remote UI/UX Designer job in the UK sounds like the right career move for you, please get in touch with Jack from Skillsearch today. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Global UX/UI Manager
description:
At Arcadis we focus on attracting, retaining and developing people who share our passion and commitment to improve quality of life. In return we offer you the opportunity to transform your world and the world around you, that could be through client work, upskilling yourself, championing equality and inclusion or getting involved in charity work, to name just a few. Our people value different perspectives, they care about the sustainability of our planet and dare to shape the future.

One of our core values is ‘people first’, and supported by our Lovinklaan foundation, we invest in you for the long term, to ensure you reach your full potential. You’ll have the opportunity to own your career and work on industry-defining projects, finding solutions to real challenges that make a difference to people’s lives. You’re encouraged to have a growth mindset and are given the space to develop personally and professionally, building a flexible career that works for you.

Role description:

Are... you a passionate leader with an eye for elegant and effective design? Arcadis is seeking a UX Design Manager to establish a robust UX/UI practice as part of a dynamic global software development environment.

Role accountabilities:
• Lead, mentor, and guide UX/UI Designers on applying user-centered design methods to translate user needs, business objectives, and technology capabilities into world-class user experiences.
• Educate team members on making decisions about the appropriate practices to utilize and when, helping them to recognize when to deliver a prototype versus a bare-bones sketch or wireframes.
• Ensure that employees practice continuous learning aligned with User Experience and Design Thinking practices.
• Monitor product metrics as an indication of usability.
• Support UX/Ui communities of practice to promote awareness and knowledge of best practices across the larger Arcadis.
• Build and maintain strong professional, trusted relationships with senior business leaders, Tech peers, and other Arcadians.
• Perform line management duties for the User Experience Designers, including staffing and hiring new User Experience Designers.
• Gather feedback from teams and leaders to identify areas of strength and opportunities for further development for individual designers.
• Collaborate with leaders across the organization to remove organizational impediments to smooth collaboration between UX/UI, product development, and the business.
• Create comfort with an iterative design process that welcomes feedback and tests the product hypotheses at every stage.

Qualifications & Experience:
• A portfolio that shows your work, talent, and experience in UX, UI and UX Research
• Deep experience in user-centered design principles and practices, web standards, typography and color, inclusive design and web usability standards
• Demonstrated understanding of the principles of Agile product development and the software development lifecycle.
• Experience effectively integrating all elements of UX/UI design into the Agile software development framework.
• Skilled at coaching designers at all levels of their professional development & providing mentorship, goal setting, and accountability.
• Versatile, strategic thinker who is tech savvy with a strong business acumen.
• Bachelor’s or master’s degree in User Experience Design or related field, or equivalent work experience and practical knowledge.
• Experience as Manager or Team Lead for UX/UI including staffing, hiring and supporting employee growth.
• Experience in working in international environment and cross industries, business lines, functions, manging large projects

Why Become an Arcadian?

Our work with clients has a direct impact on people’s lives and on the planet. We make moving, living and belonging in cities safer, more resilient and more sustainable. By partnering with our clients as responsible custodians of our earth's resources, we can create a sustainable planet.

We continue to think of new ways to make positive impacts and create better experiences for people; data driven and digital solutions have become part of the Arcadis DNA. Working together with clients and using techniques like design thinking, we can get to the heart of our clients’ most pressing challenges and work together to solve them.

As a global business, we have committed to support five of the UN’s Sustainable Development Goals to ensure that our projects contribute to a better and more sustainable future for all. But it’s not just the work that we do on client projects that benefits communities and our planet. As a global business, we are committed to making a positive impact to society by supporting local communities where we operate.

To help protect our planet, we monitor and measure non-financial information to inform business decisions and reduce our own environmental impact as part of our commitment to be net zero carbon as a global company by 2030.

Our Commitment to Equality, Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging:

We want you to be able to bring your best self to work every day which is why we take equality and inclusion seriously and hold ourselves to account for our actions. Our ambition is to be an employer of choice and provide a great place to work for all our people. We believe that by working together diverse people with different experiences develop the most innovative ideas. Equality, diversity and inclusion is at the heart of how we improve quality of life and we work closely with our people across six ED&I Workstreams: Age, Disability, Faith, Gender, LGBT+ and Race. A diverse and skilled workforce is essential to our success.

Transform Your World

title: UI Designer
description:
ABOUT THE JOB

Why join us at Cyferd?

Cyferd is at the start of a very exciting journey. We’re a start-up company with an executive team that has significant experience building compelling solutions with previous tech start-ups. You’ll be joining a dynamic team that loves to build the best solutions in the market helping us to develop our platform components using leading cloud technologies with market-defining architecture and features. This platform will provide the base of our secure, robust, and extensive multi-tenant SaaS offering that converges capabilities to offer significant value to the early adopter customers we’re working with (and everyone else as we build out the future).

Job Description

We are looking for a UI Designer who is talented and wants to join a small but growing UI team. You will be working alongside the UX and UI leads to design an industry-leading low-code/no-code application. As the first UI designer on the team, you will have the opportunity to shape... how we approach UI for our application.

Your responsibilities are to:
• Create a design system to support dynamically generated user interfaces.
• Work collaboratively in architecting and designing a UI builder interface.
• In collaboration with the UX team, design the functionality and visuals of new features.
• Design responsive web, mobile, and tablet layouts.
• Create design specifications for components, layouts, and screens within the platform.
• Stay abreast of emerging technologies & industry trends.
• Ability to learn a lot quickly.

The requirements/skills to be successful are:
• Outstanding design skills with a focus on UI design.
• Experience designing UI for B2B applications is a must.
• Experience creating wireframes and prototype mock-ups.
• Experience in designing for design systems and pattern libraries.
• Understanding of atomic design principles.
• Understanding of HTML/CSS.
• Should be comfortable working as part of a cross-discipline UI/UX front-end team.
• Experience working in an agile environment.
• Experience working with design software such as Sketch, Figma, and Adobe XD.
• Ability to develop innovative solutions that are user-friendly from both a visual and a user interaction perspective.
• Experience designing for IOS and Android apps is a plus.

About your application:

Cyferd is an Equal Opportunity employer; at Cyferd, we believe in diversity and equality for everyone. Team meetings at Cyferd routinely involve members from all different levels, from CEO to intern, and all team members are invited to offer their ideas.

Cyferd is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Cyferd via email, the Internet, or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Cyferd. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Cyferd as a result of the referral or through other means

title: UI Designer
description:
