title: UI UX Designer
description:
Are you an experienced UI UX Designer looking for your next career opportunity with one of the Middle East's leading advertising and creative organisations?

Our client is one of the Middle East's most successful, fun, and ambitious creative agencies in marketing and communication. As an innovative company with locations in Dubai and Saudi Arabia, they deliver modern, interdisciplinary solutions for an increasingly complex world and work with some of the world's finest brands within automotive, medicine, technology, retail, real estate, hospitality, and telecommunications.

They have an immediate opportunity for a UI UX Designer to join their team in the GCC's most happening place – Saudi Arabia!

We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX designer who will be responsible for the user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design of our clients' various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimised for improved usability, usefulness, and... exceptional visual design.

The successful candidate will evidence a passion for delivering adaptive and creative solutions to UI/UX design problems by staying up to date with best practices and emerging trends in user experience design and user interface technology.

The Role

Investigating user experience design requirements for our suite of digital assets

Developing and conceptualizing a comprehensive UI/UX design strategy for the brand

Producing high-quality UX design solutions through wireframes, visual and graphic designs, flow diagrams, storyboards, site maps, and prototypes

Designing UI elements and tools such as navigation menus, search boxes, tabs, and widgets for our digital assets

Testing UI elements such as CTAs, banners, page layouts, page designs, page flows, and target links for landing pages

Collaborating with the marketing team, and internal and external designers to ensure the creation and delivery of tailored experiences for the digital user

Providing advice and guidance on the implementation of UX research methodologies and testing activities in order to analyse and predict user behaviour

Adhering to style standards on typography and graphic designIdeal Candidate

A bachelor's degree and a minimum of 2 years UI/UX design experience for digital products or services

A portfolio of professional UI/UX design work for both web and mobile platforms

Working knowledge of the following technologies and software: Sketch, InVision, Visio, HTML, CSS (SCSS), iOS, Android, Design Systems, and Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe XD and or Figma

A collaborator but can work independently too

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasksThis is a fantastic opportunity for a Senior UX UI Designer with natural curiosity to not only learn and grow as an Senior UX/UI Designer, but to also aid the organisation to push new boundaries in design!

The Package

Base salary SR 10,000 – SR 16,000 per month (depending upon experience) plus additional benefits and the opportunity to work with a highly motivated and enthusiastic team.

Application

If you're keen on learning more about this opportunity, apply now with your latest CV.

HCP are the Middle East's leading tech recruitment and search consultancy.

HCP International is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Role: UI/UX Designer

Location: Remote based, but the need to travel to the office 2 times a month (Oxford area)

Salary: £50,000 - £65,000pa + Benefits

Skills: UI, UX, Wireframing, Agile

Job Description

My client is looking for an excellent user interface (UI) designer to join their growing applications team working on a wide variety of technical projects. The UI designer will strive to produce easy to use, high-quality solutions for the applications (mobile and desktop) by designing application workflows, working closely with the software development team throughout the implementation process.

You would typically be working in a team of developers and product managers.

Examples of the types of work the UI Designer will be part of include:
• Collaborating with business and development stakeholders to produce designs.
• Designing application workflows and the user experience.
• Wireframing user interfaces.
• Communicating with the software development team throughout... implementation.
• Presenting designs to stakeholders.
• Conducting usability testing.

Candidates must have substantial UI design skills and love to work on projects. They will have a portfolio showcasing mobile and desktop work.

Experience in some of the following would also be advantageous:
• Qt, QML, JS
• Vector graphical asset creation
• Agile Development

This is a permanent position that is predominantly remote based, but does require you to be in the office 2 times a month

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
About Us

QikServe is an enterprise platform for guest self-service in hospitality, powering some of the biggest players in the hospitality industry. We’re looking for a UI /UX designer to join our design team to help deliver our digital ordering and payments systems.

QikServe are trail blazers, our founder holds the patent for QR based ordering and we have been at the forefront of digital ordering for 10 years. Our technology is used in over 5,000 sites across 35 countries. We specialise in guest facing products, staff interfaces, management tools, middleware and beyond. In other words, we enable operators to allow their guests the convenience to order and pay for their food whenever and however they want. 

If you want to join an exciting company who are changing the digital ordering and payments landscape, we want to hear from you.

The Job

In summary, the job is focused on innovating and developing impactful interfaces and experiences for our customers and their guests. You... will:
Work directly with our Head of Design across our suite of digital products, developing a deep understanding of our products and customer needs
Craft rich, high-fidelity designs using Figma for handover to Engineering
Create UI & UX deliverables such as personas, journey maps, IA, prototypes and wireframes
Work closely with our technical teams on handing over design files, as well as ensuring the outcome is in line with the scope
Interact frequently with customer facing teams to gather feedback and input during the design phase
Drive improvements where possible, offering support to other teams to ensure our products are always well presented
We’re proud to say that our guest-facing products are built to be accessible and ethical, and you’d be expected to uphold and promote these values across your work.

About You
You are skilled in Figma and common design tools including Adobe CC (XD, Photoshop, Illustrator), and have a strong capability for creating compelling digital interfaces, products or graphics.
Design thinking, problem solving and understanding product capabilities are things you are familiar with and you have a user-first attitude, and truly want to design the right things, in the right way and in the right context.
You will have strong self management skills, the ability to self-motivate and solid teamwork skills, with the ability to build momentum and pivot if needed.
From ideas to live products you’re happy to communicate and collaborate design decisions with colleagues and stakeholders throughout the design process. This means you have good communication skills and English is one of your languages (bonus points if you also speak Portuguese).
Collaboration and consistency are key and you will have experience of delivering multiple projects in a professional setting, under tight deadlines. You are inquisitive, passionate and creative as well as being a decent person.

This is an excellent opportunity for an ambitious designer to join a growing team, being able to influence winning products and drive change across the business.

The Rest

To apply, send us your portfolio. This should include some case studies, and demonstrate your strengths and interests as a designer and how you have been involved in each project. Please send this along with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you think you'd be a good fit for this role.

Location: Hybrid working from our Edinburgh Head Office or fully remote from anywhere in the UK

Please note: You must be located in the UK and have the right to work in the UK

We look forward to hearing from you

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
We have partnered with a dynamic, early-stage start-up that is looking for a Senior UI/UX Designer. The client is going to revolutionise the way in which business' can move people & money. Their mission is to help SME's remove the time-consuming travel management processes so they can focus on what really matters.

As our Senior UI/UX Designer you will be responsible for creating intuitive and compelling mobile and web interfaces and user experiences for Travel and Expenses apps and a new Dashboard app which will launch later this year.

The ideal Senior UI/UX Designer will have a track record of designing complex and highly secure interfaces, all while being highly intuitive and fluid.

The day-to-day for the successful UI/UX Designer will be as follows; you’ll be working closely with the development team and product owners to put together wireframes and storyboards to support new features and functionality. You will help to lay the foundation for best practice around UI and UX.

You... will also be working closely with the commercial team to help build the company identity and incorporate updates to branding and identity into their product designs.

Experience Required.

· Experience designing highly secure and trustable systems

· A good understanding of Open Banking products and the challenges that come with designing them in a way that communicates trust to the end user.

· Experience of working with wireframe and storyboard tools

· Experience of working with agile methodologies

· Familiarity with mobile development platforms including Android and iOS

· Familiarity with web development and styling technologies

· Track record developing complex, component-oriented applications

· Autonomy in your work and ability to reliably estimate design deliverables

· An interest in fintech, travel and business services

What we are looking for.

· Team spirit and strong communication skills to collaborate with various stakeholders

· You can work autonomously and take ownership of your tasks

· You operate best without lots of admin

What is in it for you?

· A competitive salary and benefits package

· Access to all the latest technology and tools that you need

· The option to work from home once a week after COVID restrictions have been lifted

· Free Premium subscription

· Health Insurance and Pension Plan

Senior UI/UX Designer Salary - Up to £65k

Fully Remote

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
WHY US?

💸 45-60k EUR per year (or local currency equivalent) full time B2B contract

🌎 Fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!

🏖️ 33 Days Paid Leave

✨ Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

💻 M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent

💡 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need

SUMMARY

Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!

We're looking for a Senior Designer with the creativity to produce amazing websites, app designs and high-quality digital assets.

The ideal candidate is someone who has experience in both UI and graphic design

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!

ABOUT US

Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based... in Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.

RESPONSIBILITIES

What can you expect?
• Designing websites and apps for internal projects and external clients and contributing to our internal design systems and processes
• Working closely with developers to bring your designs to life, by creating design specs, prototypes, and providing UI/UX feedback
• Creating effective and dynamic style guides and templates in Figma for other teams to produce social and digital marketing assets
• Producing fun, polished, well-designed assets using the Figma as primary tool and Adobe CC from time to time.
• Using a user focused design process to balance client, business and user needs to create the most effective design solutions
• Helping create polished client presentations
• Keeping up with design trends and tools
• Mentoring junior team members and helping set the standard of design for the company

QUALIFICATIONS

What's important to us:
• Excellent eye for detail particularly with regards to typography and layout
• Minimum of 3 years professional experience as a designer in a similar role: UI/UX design, product design, interaction design, etc
• Proven ability to design user flows, considering user needs, business needs, functionality, accessibility and aesthetics
• Mastery of Figma or willingness to learn quickly.
• Quick to learn and adapt to the dynamic nature of working with new tools, technologies and techniques
• High work-ethic, self-motivation and ability to work independently
• Strong time management skills with a proactive attitude towards communication with regards to your work
• Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities

YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT

Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here! Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Content Production team is 20+ people strong and made up of video editors, motion graphics specialists, project managers and graphic designers. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology & Industry

Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-notch Equipment

We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working. In your role you will be working from 10am till 6pm.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.

CONTRACT TYPE

Full time B2B contract - fully remote working from anywhere in Europe!

EXTRAS
• 33 days of paid time off
• High end laptop of your choice - M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent, it’s up to you!
• Top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
• Training and development opportunities
• Full refund for a trip to Edinburgh – we would love to meet you in person and meet from time to time in Poland or Scotland ;)

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

First, you will be invited for a 30-minute pre-interview via Zoom. We usually ask about your previous experience, future career path and motivation for changing your job.

If the pre-interview goes well, we will invite you to a second step - You will meet Jakub, our Design Manager, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom. It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team.

If the technical interview with Jakub goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task.

And that’s it!

Storm Ideas focuses on Entertainment Industry. Their company has offices in Edinburgh and Warsaw. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://stormideas.com/#intro
extensions: ['€45K–€60K a year', 'Work from home', 'Full-time', 'No degree mentioned']

title: UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits | SportsTech | Remote
description:
UX/UI Product Designer Role | £50,000 + Benefits| SportsTech | Remote

UX/UI Product Designer is required for a SportsTech firm who use technology to capture real-time fan consumption data and have enterprise-scale third-party data integrations enabling their clients to gain a better understanding of their fans, going well beyond who they are and delving deeper into their behavioural habits and fan characteristics. As a UX/UI Product Designer you will get the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products

The firm boasts an impressive array of clients, examples of which include; Formula 1, The MLS, ECB, 10 Premier League / Championship football clubs, Rugby Football League, Premiership Rugby and Sky Sports.

The UX/UI Product Designer Role:

As a UX/UI Product Designer you will have the opportunity to lead the design process for both web and app products that cater to sports fans. You’ll often be working on 1-2 product initiatives at a time, from kick-off... through to the launch and post-release improvements.

Communicating with various internal product stakeholders including the product owner and developers to establish the requirements and limitations for the scope of the product development itself. Ensuring products are truly user-centric by helping to conduct user research and testing.

● Exploring and drawing insight from initial research to help craft information architectures, wireframes and prototypes.

● Creating functional but beautiful user interfaces

● Understanding, managing and developing design systems.

Remuneration:

This UX/UI Product Designer role is paying up to £50,000 + package (Pension, Sky discount, remote, WFH equipment scheme)

The firm adopt a remote way of working. There are no set days in the office, however for specific team / firm get togethers, they have brand new offices in Paddington, London.

Culture:

The firm are all sports lovers, and working with some of the biggest names in the industry: Sky Sports, Premier league, UEFA, Fifa, 6 Nations Rugby, McLaren, MLS, Watford FC, Arsenal etc.. this is an opportunity to combine both a love for UX/UI Product design, with an industry that you are passionate about.

The firm also get the best tickets that aren’t always available on the market from their clients, giving opportunity to see your tech get used live by some of the clients mentioned.

Experience needed:

You will need to have experience within a digital product design-based role from which you can demonstrate an outstanding portfolio of digital product design projects

● An understanding of native app design/iOS Human Interface Guidelines and Android material guidelines

● Familiarity with the theory and limitations of accessibility standards for digital products

● A proficient use of Figma

● A background of digital product experience

● A knowledge and understanding of sport

If you are interested in applying for this UX/UI Product Designer role, please reply to this advert with your latest CV or send it to joe@virtuetech.io

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Mostly Remote. Competitive salary, dependant on experience

About the role

Kayo Digital are looking for an experienced and creative UI/UX Designer to join the team. You will be responsible for producing high end user experiences built around data from research reports and stakeholder interviews. Starting at a wireframe level you will develop concepts and layouts and work with clients to gather feedback and present creative solutions to UX/UI problems. As the project process flows through various sign off milestones, your concepts will evolve from prototypes into complete visual designs which will then be handed over to your colleagues in the production team to develop into fully functioning digital solutions.

Required experience
• At least 5 years of experience designing websites or mobile apps in a similar role
• Links to an online design portfolio
• Experience using Sketch to control the UI design process
• Knowledge of usability standards and fundamentals of modern human digital... interaction
• Knowledge of Adobe range of products including Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign.

Personal qualities
• Excellent communication skills
• Ability to discuss and explain design options
• Critical thinker
• Detail focussed
• Process driven problem solver
• Customer-centred approach regardless of ego

Benefits
• Free use of swimming pool
• Flexible working hours and regularly working from home
• Yearly personal training and conference budget
• Quarterly company Lunch
• Cycle to work scheme
• Free drinks
• Optional Gym memberships
• A training budget to benefit your personal growth

No commuting for computing

Since Covid-19 forced everyone leave the office, Kayo Digital's production team has taken on a remote working policy which enables greater productivity by following a "no commuting for computing" motto. The only thing we ask for in return is the ability to self-motivate while working remotely to get the job done and hit deadlines. Whilst geographical location is not important due to the remote nature, it would be sensible for applicants to consider practicalities in attending occasional team or client meetings at our office which will likely be required as working life returns to normal.

How to apply

In 1-2 sentences tell us why you want to work at Kayo Digital. Please include your CV. Do not include a cover letter. Please also include your current salary and expectations for your career at Kayo.

Get in touch with your CV and answers to the above by emailing recruitment@kayo.digital. Please mention where you found the role advertised.

Have you got what it takes to be part of Team Kayo

title: UI/UX Lead - Blockchain
description:
Animoca Brands, a Deloitte Tech Fast winner and ranked in the Financial Times list of High Growth Companies Asia-Pacific 2021, is a leader in digital entertainment, blockchain, and gamification that is working to advance digital property rights. It develops and publishes a broad portfolio of products including the REVV token and SAND token; original games including The Sandbox, Crazy Kings, and Crazy Defense Heroes; and products utilizing popular intellectual properties including Disney, WWE, Snoop Dogg, The Walking Dead, Power Rangers, MotoGP™, and Formula E. The company has multiple subsidiaries, including The Sandbox, Blowfish Studios, Quidd, GAMEE, nWay, Pixowl, Forj, Lympo, Grease Monkey Games, and Eden Games. Animoca Brands has a growing portfolio of more than 200 investments in NFT-related companies and decentralized projects that are contributing to building the open metaverse, including Axie Infinity, OpenSea, Dapper Labs (NBA Top Shot), Yield Guild Games, Harmony, Alien... Worlds, Star Atlas, and others. For more information visit www.animocabrands.com or follow on Twitter or Facebook.

We are currently looking for a UI/UX Lead to work with User Experience Designers, Visual Designers, User Researchers, Front End Engineers, Business Analysts, Copywriters, and other Marketers on a regular basis across several market leading Web3 projects focused on both Gaming and NFT’s.

Responsibilities:
• Collaborate with leadership and team members across design, engineering, product management, and marketing
• Define, craft, and evolve designs that fit within visual systems and/or standards
• Proactively solicit feedback from stakeholders and provide feedback to the broader product team to strive for better quality
• Review existing products and do product testings and improvement reports
• Work with outsourcing companies to review their UI/UX, research deliveries
• Lead and mentor the design team to streamline work flows and improve UX strategy across multiple projects
• Become familiar with crypto-user thinking and stay on top of upcoming trends and figure out the user behavior and user journey for our target user.
• Only candidates with an online (or PDF) portfolio will be considered
• Demonstrable UI/UX design experience within a lead capacity
• Proficiency in design software including Figma and Photoshop
• Experience with websites
• Strong sense of responsive design, UX and technology trends
• Ability to conduct user research, A/B testing and iteration usability testing
• Comfort with an iterative design process that includes accepting and acting on feedback
• Strong understanding of blockchain, cryptocurrency or e-commerce is preferable
• Self-driven, a growth mindset
• A player/coach mentality.

THE PERKS

- Dynamic and Multi-cultural work environment (15 nationalities and counting!)

- Token and NFT incentive schemes provided by Animoca Brands

- Flat company structure: your ideas get heard by the right people very quickly

- Casual work attire

- Opportunity to get involved in working with various subsidiary brands

- Benefits (Medical / Life / Transportation Allowances)

Personal Information Collection Statement:

Personal data provided by the Job Applicant will be used strictly in accordance with the Employer's Personal Data Policies, a copy of which will be provided immediately upon his/her request. All classified data will be treated confidentially within the Human Resources & Administration Department. Personal data of unsuccessful applicants may be retained for a period of up to 3 months

title: Senior UI/UX Artist
description:
The Multiplayer Group (MPG) are 300 developers and data scientists, helping our clients and partners build 20+ AAA projects at any one time. We’re probably the most experienced multiplayer dev group in the world and we’re set up to help the games industry make games more easily, to deliver the highest quality, and become long-term partners.

We hire the best people, our talented team is spread across the globe. We’re remote-friendly and big on wellbeing, so if you love the sound of us, we’d love to hear from you!

Your mission:

We are actively recruiting a Senior UI UX Artist to help MPG deliver the best possible Game User Interfaces to our clients.  Are you driven mad by certain design choices: the colour choice for that button, or the positioning of it? Font choice, alignment and kerning? Hate it when they put a handle on a door that you have to push? If these little things make you tick, then this may be the role for you.

You will work alongside the UI lead, collaborating closely... with the game designers, UX design, our global art team and production teams to deliver world class work and continue our drive for improvement in service and quality.

You’ll be an advocate for great communication in User Interfaces. Sharing knowledge on the subject and contributing improvements to our processes. You’re a skilled artist/graphic designer, with a good understanding of Core Game and Meta Game design and the technical challenges of development for UI.

What you'll be doing:

• Creating professional UI experiences. Focussing on the development of excellent UX design, visual layout and concept
• Organising and reviewing play-test of user interface prototypes and final in-game UI.
• Iterating on playable game flows so that all stakeholders can get a feel for the UI before any expensive implementation is conducted.
• Creating basic motion graphic mockups to illustrate complex interactions.
• Communicating with stakeholders, extracting requirements and advising solutions
• Leading by example, setting benchmarks, style guides, high quality standards, workflows, documentation and approvals
• Reporting for internal and client needs
• You’ll keep one eye on the future - research, evaluate and propose practices that keep us on the cutting edge!

What we'll need from you:

• You’re stylistically diverse, organised and precise.
• You have a deep understanding of the roles and workflows of an UI art team, how an art team and the wider development team operates and integrates and supports with those workflows
• You’re a fantastic Graphic Designer with a good knowledge of art theory
• Expert knowledge of User Interface theory and practice - terminology and best practices
• Expert knowledge of typical UI and graphic design tools and a general knowledge of typical art tools and game engines
• Ability to create and present high level documentation, style guides, ideation, etc
• Ability to advise team members on UI production matters - solid experience with production tools like Jira
• Attention to detail with a strong ability to analyse and comprehend Visual Direction
• A good communicator with the ability to verbalise conceptual thoughts and the willingness to accept constructive critique

What would help:

• Previous experience in a similar role is highly desirable
• Experience working on several projects concurrently
• Experience of direct communication with clients
• UI concept art and White Box Wire Framing experience

title: Senior User Experience Designer - Product Management
description:
Position: Senior User Experience Designer - Product Management

Location: UK / Remote

Engagement Type: Permanent / Mon-Fri

Salary: highly competitive plus excellent benefits

Job summary:

Senior UX Designers are responsible for delivery of innovative, intuitive designs, that will make a real difference to our customers. You will work within the design team and will take a key responsibility in translating complex design problems into simple, streamlined, easy to use interfaces that delight end users. You will work closely with engineering teams to ensure design intent is met, and a high-quality product is realized. The key to success in this role is managing user requirements, technical and time constraints as well as business objectives.

Responsibilities
• Have and maintain deep understanding of user requirements and use this to drive design thinking.
• Work with customers to discover opportunities and test ideas.
• Spot opportunities to improve upon existing user experiences and... iterate designs to get to the best solution.
• Define intuitive user interaction models and user flows, based on real user needs.
• Create and maintain wireframes, visual mock-ups and prototypes that communicate desired user flows, animations, transitions and intended style.
• Work across a range of platforms, from desktop to mobile applications, ensuring a consistent experience whatever context the user is in.
• Communicate ideas and concepts quickly and effectively with other designers and engineering teams across many geographical locations, using justification based on real scenarios and end to end experiences.
• Work closely with engineering teams to understand technical and time constraints and adapt designs where necessary to get the best UX possible.
• Help to progress and maintain the product design system, to ensure continuity and consistency across applications and platforms.
• Provide guidelines on how the design should scale responsively, to ensure a great experience at all screen sizes.
• Ensure design proposals meet accessibility requirements

Minimum requirements
• At least 5 years of hands-on experience creating complex design solutions for large organizations.
• Proficient in a range of UX software, for example, Figma, Sketch and InVision ..
• Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in UX design is a plus
• Knowledge of workflows for TV, Film and Post-production is a strong plus

Skills
• Excellent interaction design skills, with the ability to generate mock-ups and animated prototypes to communicate intended user flows.
• Experienced in planning and conducting user research and usability testing
• Ability to generate content that is directly usable by engineering teams.
• Creative thinker with excellent problem-solving skills
• Fluent in English with excellent spoken and written communication as well as receptive listening skills, with ability to present complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to technical and non-technical audiences.
• A keen eye for accuracy and detail
• Knowledge of agile
• Understanding of responsive design
• An excellent team player with the ability to work with a multi-disciplinary team
• Ability to work with deadlines in a fast-paced environment

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
I am recruiting a UI/UX Designer to join a cloud hosting provider. Please note that this project will have more emphasis towards UI.

In order for my client's platform to become more intuitive and user-friendly, it needs a facelift.

I am looking for an individual that has worked on large-scale applications. Applicants must be able to share examples of desktop-based applications they have worked on to be considered for this project.

Although the initial contract is likely to be less than a month (to be confirmed), my client has a larger project that will require a complete overhaul of their platform.

We anticipate the project to be outside of IR35, and the candidate will be able to work remotely. I need someone that can start on short notice.

£400-450 per day depending on experience.

title: Senior UX/UI Designer - Contract
description:
Job Title: Senior UI/UX Designer Contract Type: 18-month FTC, full time Location: Remote with adhoc travel to our Bournemouth office Salary: depending on experience

Ageas UK have an exciting opportunity for someone to join our Marketing & Digital team as a Senior UX/UI Designer on an 18-month Fixed term contract. The role of senior UX/UI Designer is to lead and oversee the delivery of the digital user experience strategy across all products, platforms and systems, enhancing the digital experience and site functionality for our customers.

You will also be responsible for mentoring and technically developing your direct reports (including other designers), encouraging them to learn and grow their skill set within a collaborative team environment.

To be successful in the Senior UI/UX Designer role, you will need a strong understanding of user experience and human-centred design methodologies to shape the online customer journey, as well as experience leading and managing a team to... support best practise and improve performance.

Please note: Most of your time will be spent working remotely, supported by necessary equipment, however adhoc travel to our Bournemouth office will be required on occasion.

Here are some of the main responsibilities of the Senior UI/UX Designer opportunity:
• Be accountable for decision making in changes relating to the online customer journey.
• Lead the delivery of an ongoing 'test and learn cycle' within the team, leveraging AB/MVT capability, usability research and competitor analysis to shape ongoing experience development to deliver the annual and strategic e-commerce and digital product plans.
• Work closely with performance analytics, analysing customer data and user research to inform and define appropriate customer experiences and obtain actionable insights.
• Work with the Digital Journey Manager in design planning and goal creation and deliver a refinement roadmap across a planning horizon of 12-18 months to feed the long-term pipeline of changes for continuous improvement.
• Work collaboratively with the Product Managers and other members of the team to understand a customer's requirements and proposed solutions
• Facilitate or run workshops to gather requirements and evolve design to optimise and drive performance of the online estate for Aggregator customers, identifying key areas of focus.
• Have a full understanding of the quote and buy and customer portal commercial performance and analytics data and proactively contribute to the development of the web site by making data-driven decisions
• Accountable for the commercial performance of the quote and buy and customer portal, delivering quotes, sales, value and engagement.
• Deliver a consistent experience across the end to end digital touch-points to ensure full integration and alignment with the offline experience.
Here are some of the key skills, experience and competencies required to be successful in the Senior UI/UX Designer role:
• Customer User experience is essential, particularly within UI / UX design
• Demonstrable experience leading and developing a team of direct reports
• Experience working with Agile and scrum teams
• Proven experience in the build, test and implementation of websites
• Ability to analyse and interpret user journey stats and digital analytics
• Knowledge of 'best practise' usability function.
• An excellent verbal and written communicator, being able to present and explain designs and key milestones deliverables to peers and senior stakeholders
• Comfortable identifying and escalating risk where necessary.
• Ability to take a project management approach to managing multiple projects and working under pressure
Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy within the Senior UX/UI Designer role:

At Ageas we offer a wide range of benefits to support you and your family inside and outside of work, which helped us achieve, Top Employer status in the UK.

Flexible Working - Smart Working @ Ageas gives employees flexibility around location (as long as it's within the UK) and, for many of our roles, flexibility within the working day to manage other commitments, such as school drop offs etc. We also offer all our vacancies part-time/job-shares . We also offer a minimum of 31 days holiday (inc. bank holidays) and you can buy and sell days.

Supporting your Health - Dental Insurance Health Cash Plan, Health Screening, Will Writing, Voluntary Critical Illness, Mental Health First Aiders, Well Being Activities - Yoga, Mindfulness.

Supporting your Wealth - Annual Bonus Schemes, Annual Salary Reviews, Competitive Pension, Employee Savings, Employee Loans.

Supporting you at Work - Well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.

Benefits for Them - Partner Life Assurance and Critical Illness cover

Getting Around - Car Salary Exchange, Cycle Scheme, Vehicle Breakdown Cover

Get some Tech - Deals on various gadgets including Wearables, Tablets and Laptops.

Supporting you back to work - Return to work programme after maternity leave

About Ageas: We're one of the largest car and home insurers in the UK. Our people help Ageas to be a thriving, creative and innovative place to work, which is echoed in the service we provide to over four million customers.As an inclusive employer, we encourage anyone to apply. We're a signatory of the Race at Work Charter and Women in Finance Charter, a Stonewall diversity champion and a Disability Confident Employer (which means interviews are guaranteed for applicants with a disability who meet the minimum role criteria). For more information please see Ageas Everyone.Our aim is to have great people everywhere in our business and we're always looking for outstanding people to join us. Most roles across Ageas allow a proportion of your time to be spent working from home and we're open to discussing flexible working, including full-time, part-time or job share arrangements.To find out more about Ageas, see About Us

title: Senior UI Designer
description:
About the role

We’re looking for a Senior UI designer with 3+ years of commercial experience to join the Tangent design team. We don’t mind if you’ve worked in-house or at an agency. What’s most important to us is that you’ve launched digital products at scale, leading the process of applying UI.

Tangent has a global client base across sectors, meaning you will get the opportunity to work on cutting edge design problems. That can be everything from websites, portals, apps to internal tools that drive our client’s businesses.

Our core design team is based in the UK but working remote. This has given us the opportunity to recruit further afield in other countries. Our initial target areas are the UK, Spain and South Africa. But we are open to speaking with Lead product designers based in time zones within 2 hours of the UK.

You are welcome to work 100% remote or hybrid from our London Kings Cross or Valencia offices. For applicants from overseas, we will fly you over at least once a... year to attend our London social events and help build in-person relationships with the team. We’re happy for you to work in a way that suits you best.

We need you to
• We work in cross-disciplinary teams of designers and developers.
• Your role will be to be a senior member of the team responsible for ensuring a high quality of creativity and UI design
• Have a passion for creative and all things UI, create beautiful digital experiences that are accessible, intuitive, consistent and delightful
• Create and manage design systems using Figma
• Collaborate with UX colleagues to create prototypes and validate ideas through user testing
• Support developers to ensure final product matches design vision
• Help train other designers to improve their own UI and design system skills

We want to see
• A strong portfolio that illustrates your design talent and the impact of your design work
• Highly skilled in creating & managing design systems using atomic methodologies in Figma
• Excellent communicator, able to articulate your design decisions to clients and colleagues
• Experience with mentoring other designers and the ambition to grow into a lead role
• Motion or brand experience would be considered a plus, but not 100% necessary

What we give in return

People are our biggest asset and we work hard to make sure Tangent is not only a fun place to work but also provides a platform for you to grow.

Mentorship. You will be working as part of a talented and experienced team. Our passion and desire to do great work is infectious.

Training. Learning new skills, attending events. We provide the time and budget to help you grow.

Flexibility. We understand life is about balance and we provide flexibility and support to help you achieve your life goals. This can include hybrid working from home and the office.

Social life. We have so much going on at Tangent; all designed to help you form friendships with your colleagues including monthly socials, free lunches and much more.

Benefits. We reward our people generously for their hard work. This includes enhanced leave for years of service and days off for voluntary work.

At Tangent our aim is to create a working environment where every single member of the team has the opportunity to be themselves. We are an equal opportunities employer and will welcome and consider all applications regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion, sex and sexual orientation.

title: Senior UI​/UX Designer
description:
Make your positive impact on the future of gaming

The gaming industry is changing at lightning speed. From the growth of free-to-play and battle royale games to the arrival of play-to-earn games and Game Fi, the industry is evolving at a rapid pace. Nyan Heroes is front of this evolution focused on building a AAA battle royale game that is launching its alpha late 2023. To further involve and empower players fairly in every aspect of the game and economy, Nyan Heroes will be leveraging the benefits of the blockchain while also positioning itself as the benchmark for fair, sustainable game development in this space.

We aim to lead the advancement of the Game Fi industry technologically, ethically, and inspirationally.

What you’ll be doing

The Senior UI/UX Designer role will be expected to fulfil the following activities:

Collaborate with the Design and Art teams to develop interfaces for the game Create designs for the game's user interface and interaction scenarios based on user... experience and creative vision

Lead and support others to carry out the designs, documentation, and implementation of our interfaces, including diagrams, mockups and/or prototypes

Develop the art style of our interfaces in collaboration with the Art Director Create and contribute to the creation of the visual assets for the interfaces from concept to engine implementation, including typefaces or other necessary elements.

Explain implementation processes, design ideas, or other issues

Strong time management skills

Ability to break down and prioritise assignments into workable tasks on a daily, weekly, and project length basis

Proactive personality, able to communicate in a fully remote development environment

Analytic and progressive thinker

Able to work on inaugural projects without predecessors

Experience working with Unreal Engine and UMG is a big plus Strong communication skills in both one-on-one and group settings

Passion about gaming, crypto, and blockchain technology

Ability to work remotely and independently with flexible hours

Strong communication skills

Optional: you love cats and enjoy our humour

FAQs

Location:

From anywhere in the world. We are globally remote.

Equity/tokens available:
Yes Start date: ASAPAbout Nyan Heroes Nyan Heroes is a AAA F2P play-and-earn third person shooter (TPS) that will first be deployed on the PC. In Nyan Heroes, you play as a Nyan cat piloting a Guardian Mech set in a futuristic world where elements of fantasy and science fiction intertwine. Our goal is to create a rich gaming experience, backed by a fair, sustainable in-game economy, that players deeply enjoy, regardless of skill or investment.

We’ve chosen to build on the Solana blockchain because it is a carbon-neutral blockchain and can support all of Nyan Heroes on-chain activities with minimal impact to our planet.

Nyan Heroes' talented team is currently composed of 45+ individuals from gaming, new media, and web3. Our heroes already have previous experience in building global communities and launching crypto native projects. More than two-thirds of our team comes from AAA game studios including Ubisoft, Crystal Dynamics, EA, 2K, Riot, and more. We are proud to have one of the most experienced design, art, and development teams in the play-to-earn ecosystem

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Location: Hybrid

The Product team at SamKnows aims to:

With over 30 million homes around the world reporting data into our platform every month we have an abundance of data. Our challenge is to build products that demystify home connectivity issues, find faults in real time across internet service provider’s networks, test the internet performance and reliability of your favourite applications. You can help us improve the internet for everyone, everywhere.

We’re looking for a UI/UX Designer to work in a multi-disciplinary team to:
• Develop structured understanding of business and user needs
• Prototype iterative solutions, validating usability, value, and feasibility
• Apply user-centred design practices
• Turn meaningful insights into product improvements that evolve our existing user journeys

You should have:

End-to-end UX design experience, from gathering insights through user research and analytics to designing the detailed workflows and interactions. You should have a... curious mind and a desire to teach and learn with an open mind to work transparently with your team members as well as being able to effectively present and articulate complex design concepts to diverse audiences.
• At least 2 years of UX/UI/Product design experience
• Experience with hypothesis-driven design to define quick and efficient ways of learning and iterating
• Confidence in choosing appropriate user research and user testing methods
• Experience using a design system and contributing to it
• Experience using Figma in a professional setting
• A good understanding of how design can inspire and impact development, along with a knack for creating design solutions that are elegant but practical
• Experience working within focused agile teams and finding solutions within a well reasoned approach

Recruitment process:
• Screening Call (20 mins)
• Questionnaire (At-home Assessment)
• Technical Interview, with Design Task (1h)
• Cultural Contribution Interview (1h)

What we offer:
• Team: Friendly team from all over the globe and a supportive company culture
• Environment: Amazing brand new HQ in Bermondsey, includes genderless bathrooms, collaborative and social spaces
• Pension: Pension contribution of 5% of your annual salary per year
• Sick Pay: Full sick pay for 15 days in any calendar year
• Hybrid working: Flexibility to work at home and at the office, allowance of £312 per year for you to spend on your home workstation
• Growth: Individualised career plan. And, own your personal development with a £1,500 training budget and 5 training days
• Family friendly policies: Enhanced parental leave for birthing and partner parents
• Financial support: Interest free loans including cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan and discretionary employee loans up to £5,000
• Holiday: 25 days holiday each year (pro rata) plus bank holidays. And an extra day off to enjoy your birthday!
• Health care: Medical insurance includes cover for dental, optical, private healthcare and mental health care for you, your partner and dependents
• Recognition: Company bonus

SamKnows

Founded in 2008, SamKnows is recognised as a leader in internet performance measurement, providing a research and monitoring service for internet, in-home and application performance. Over the last 14 years we have built a global measurement platform, considered vital to governments, ISPs and consumers, especially now. You can find lots of useful information about us at www.samknows.com and we’d also encourage you to listen to our podcasts and view our Spotlight magazine.

SamKnows welcomes applications from all sections of society. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional needs that require accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
What we're looking for:

A creative, collaborative and proactive UX/UI designer with 2+ years experience. An individual who can define and develop end-to-end amazing user experiences and interfaces for our web and mobile products.

What will you be doing?
• Leading user research activities to develop insight into customers needs to inform product decisions, direction and evaluate opportunities.
• Brainstorming new ideas and approaches
• Designing aesthetically pleasing, amazing user experiences across our web and mobile products utilizing human-centered design principles to identify and solve customer needs and pain points.
• Designing online and offline visual/graphic elements following the brand guidelines
• Delivering design mock-ups and prototypes through to beautiful UI interfaces.
• Leading user testing of concepts to ensure quality and usability.
• Pro-actively collaborating with the development team to ensure all design ideas and concepts can be practically applied.
•... Developing innovative methods to showcase design & user experience ideas in an iterative and collaborative way.
• Lead, collaborate and ensure the design team is full-filling the team's goals and objectives
• Stay up to date with the improvements and techniques of the design software.

What do you need ideally to succeed in this role?
• Design degree with/or 2+ years equivalent industry experience
• Proven experience in delivering the entire design process - from research through to design and implementation. A portfolio of related works (e.g. logos, animations, wireframing, and Figma)
• Experience in using Figma, Sketch software, or similar.
• Experience in using prototyping software like Invision, etc
• The ability to create UX documentation (transaction flows, scenarios, wireframes, navigation models, prototypes, user interaction specifications) to communicate concepts and designs to the team.
• Experience leading user research and user testing activities throughout the process.
• You have an exceptional portfolio that demonstrates the implementation of HCD methodologies to design beautiful UIs.
• Strong communication skills to collaborate with key stakeholders across the business.
• Strong aesthetic skills and attention to visual details
• Knowledge and experience with HTML/CSS; JavaScript and/or Shopify is a plus

An advantage to have:
• Development Experience
• Ecommerce Knowledge

Perks and Benefits:
• Highly competitive salary and bonus schemes
• 100% remote, WFH role opportunity (with an option to relocate to the UK/NZ if interested)
• To lead and shape the future of a thriving fitness-tech start-up
• Relaxed and Flexible working hours (you choose your hours)
• Flexible leave offerings (4 weeks annual paid leave), including opportunities to purchase additional leave
• Support for parents with 4 weeks paid primary carers leave
• Education Assistance Program
• Tailored, goal-oriented career development planning
• Empower sessions with industry-leading guest speakers
• Year-round company events
• Collaborating Environment

EzToned focuses on Fitness and Ecommerce. Their company has offices in United Kingdom and New Zealand. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://eztoned.com

title: UK Product Design (UX/UI) Intern - Summer 2023
description:
Mark43 is approved to hire in 27 states, including AL, AZ, CA, CO, CT, DC, DE, FL, GA, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, MA, MD, ME, MI, MN, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, OH, OR, PA, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, VT, WA, WV, and WI. Before applying to a remote role, please ensure that you are able to perform the position in one of the states listed above. State locations and specifics are subject to change as our hiring requirements shift.
Mark43’s mission is to empower communities and their governments with new technologies that improve the safety and quality of life for all. We build powerful, scalable, and elegant software that sets a new design standard for the tools our first responders rely on.

Come join our design team as a remote paid intern, and learn what it’s like to design software for police officers, detectives, and 911 dispatchers. You’ll be working not only with award-winning designers, but also directly with some of the industry’s best product managers and engineers. The intern... projects at Mark43 are real problems we need solved and have in the past included: a real-time map for dispatchers to keep track of first responders on the street, a dark mode color theme to keep first responders safe at night, and a command line feature to control our dispatch software. Get ready to be challenged and grow!

We are primarily looking for students graduating in the Spring/Summer of 2024. Our internship program will be running from June 6th, 2023 - September 1st, 2023.

What you can expect to achieve

• Collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of designers, product managers, and engineers.
• Work on complex, challenging, and meaningful projects.
• Practice accessible and inclusive design.
• Practice design techniques and processes (user research/product testing, flow diagramming, wireframing, prototyping, graphic design, etc.).

What we expect from you

• Solid grasp of design fundamentals (layout, hierarchy, typography, common UI patterns)
• Self-motivated (we love side projects), detail oriented, and committed to quality
• Willingness to empathize with users who may be unlike yourself
• Willingness to justify and defend design decisions
• Interest in technology, civic, and public safety issues
• Portfolio submission so we can get a sense of your work

What you can expect from us

• Mentorship on becoming a great product designer
• Building mission critical and socially responsible software to enable first responders to better serve their communities
• Constructive and actionable feedback on your work from designers at all levels
• Gain experience at the arising intersection of design/technology/government

Read more about our work from our design team on Medium:

• Records Privacy: Designing for our Users and their Communities
• Designing for First Responders: Keyboard Usability & Outdated In-Vehicle Computers
• My Remote Product Design Internship Experience at Mark43

We feel passionately about equal pay for equal work, and transparency in compensation is one vehicle to achieve that. Compensation for this role is paid at an hourly rate of £33 per hour

title: UX Designer
description:
As a UX Designer, you will help shape the future of the company's digital products by working collaboratively to come up with innovative ways to solve business problems centred around customer's needs.

Client Details

Our client are a large society that has been around for nearly 170 years helping people find a place to call home. They aim to deliver real help and value to its customers by providing the financial tools and support to enable them to achieve the things in life that matter to them most.

Caring about their people and working in an environment that promotes flexibility, development and inclusivity.

Description

In your first few weeks in this UX Designer role, you can expect to:
• Utilise your tried and tested UX and UI design skills at all stages of the design process, including research, ideation, prototyping, and UI design
• Carry out usability testing and other forms of validation to improve and iterate your designs
• Contribute towards the company's creative... culture by helping to drive awareness and understanding of design throughout.

Profile

To apply for this UX role, you will need a proven track record of experience, researching and designing engaging experiences that meet the needs of the people that use them.

You will also require the following:
• Experience conducting competitor analysis, using analytics tools, and customer insight to find opportunities and tease out pain points that drive your design decisions
• Solid experience bringing your ideas to life using design tools such as Sketch, Invision, Figma or Adobe Xd
• Experience planning, conducting, and analysing usability studies
• A willingness to learn and try new things - be it tools, techniques, or ways of working.

Job Offer

As a vital member of the team and in return for your expertise, inclusive approach and commitment, you will receive a salary of GBP40,000 to GBP45,000 and the chance to join a supportive and welcoming team.

To apply for this inclusive and collaborative Full time UX Designer job in Leeds, please contact PageGroup today.

title: Presales - UI/UX Designer
description:
Your Opportunity

Are you a smart hybrid UI/UX designer with an in-depth understanding of design and research principles? Can you translate prospects’ needs and business requirements into simple, beautiful, usable digital interfaces?

Do you have excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to liaise with, and balance the needs of multiple stakeholders?

About Applaud

We are an award-winning HR tech provider who are redefining digital employee experience. We have been serving Fortune 500 companies in all verticals, globally, for over 10 years.

Applaud is built on the belief that employees should have the same exceptional technology experiences inside the world of work, as they expect outside the world of work, as consumers.

We’re all gadget-obsessed, but people always come first, technology second, because it’s consumer expectations that set our technology standards.

About You

You have:

· 2+ years of experience in hybrid UI/UX design

· A Design ... Human-Computer Interaction or equivalent degree

· A natural flare for designing beautiful user interfaces

· Experience or interest working in a presales environment

· A deep understanding of research methodologies, usability, and UI design

· Excellent spoken and written English, with experience writing in brand tone-of-voice

· Remarkable attention to detail

· Technically-orientated and comfortable with simple HTML

· An organised and proactive approach to work

· The ability to take onboard feedback but also the confidence to challenge ideas

· A desire to work from home

· Experience working in an agile environment

The Role

You’ll join a team of 80 talented people, and enjoy a fun, rewarding and memorable employee experience. Your work will be varied and impactful; you may be wireframing or researching one day, creating production ready graphics the next – all leading directly to outcomes that will delight high-profile companies spanning a variety of industries. The role is home-based, permanent, full-time and reports into our Solution Consulting Director.

Responsibilities include:
• Designing beautiful, simple, and usable solutions for prospective customers and partners, from wireframing to hi-fidelity design to usable web assets
• Assisting with the build of proof-of-concepts within the Applaud no-code platform, tailored to a customer’s brand and tone of voice. Present back your concepts an designs to internal and external stakeholders
• Ongoing design and innovation of our presales demo systems
• Collaborating with partners and internal stakeholders including the Leadership team, Pre-sales, Product Management, Sales, Customer Success and Professional Services
• Using UI/UX design tools including Balsamiq (wireframing), Adobe XD, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Photoshop for both design and build (eg, creating brand assets and imagery; publishing optimized web assets)

Job Type: Permanent

Salary: £30,000.00-£40,000.00 per year

Benefits:
• Additional leave
• Company events
• Company pension
• Cycle to work scheme
• Employee discount
• Life insurance
• Private medical insurance
• Store discount
• Work from home

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday

Supplemental pay types:
• Yearly bonus

Work Location: Remote

Application deadline: 23/12/2022
Expected start date: 16/01/2023

title: Senior UI & UX Designer
description:
SENIOR UI & UX DESIGNER

CENTRAL MARKETING

BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD

REPORTING TO THE HEAD OF DESIGN AND UX

A BIT ABOUT SEGA

SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our seven development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, HARDlight, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.

At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Tech, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.

Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.

WORKING THE SEGA... WAY

We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours, even more so with everyone working remotely during COVID-19…
• For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our online gaming nights and free SEGA games on Steam
• Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership and ride to work scheme. You can find your zen with our weekly virtual yoga classes as well as online physical therapy with our masseuse.
• We hold regular company updates to keep everyone in the loop and we stay connected with social events like virtual pub quizzes and art workshops
• We support your learning & development with access to online courses through Udemy, and webinars and resources on mental health and financial wellbeing
• When you’re in the virtual office, we’ll make sure you have everything you need when it comes to tech/furniture, and we pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of your home office
• You’ll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be.

We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!

And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Check out our Careers website to find out why we are a workplace you’ll never want to leave!

POSITION OVERVIEW
• ** PLEASE NOTE THAT YOU WILL BE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE A LINK TO YOUR PORTFOLIO AS PART OF YOUR APPLICATION ***

We’re looking for a passionate UI Designer to join our growing and ambitious Product team! We’re looking for someone that understands that good design is not about trends but is built on top of principles and trade-offs, and that makes well-reasoned design decisions always advocating for the best possible user experience, inclusive design and accessibility.

The ideal candidate for this role will be an enthusiastic and experienced UI Designer. You will have some UX knowledge but perhaps your passion really lies in the UI-focused aspect of design. You’ll understand the need for easy-to-use, well-designed applications that enable the user to access what they need and complete their task in a timely manner, ensuring that enabling speedy patient care is at the heart of the process.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Focus on building collaborating relationships with key stakeholders, a cross-disciplinary team, to set priorities towards meaningful design solutions to meet player and business goals.
• Responsible for all design artefacts produced, from initial discovery and user journey mapping through to the execution of final UI design details.
• Identifying sudden and gradual consumer trends, cross gravitations, churns & attrition & pinpoint future data-driven opportunities through your learnings.
• Deeply understand the customers you’re designing for. Whether it’s joining user research sessions, learning from previous insights, or running your own research and analysis, you’ll strive to understand how our consumers use and interact with our services.
• Maintain best practices, create opportunities for challenge and growth, develop solutions and collaborate effectively with other departments.
• With focus and determination all the above will lead to learning & building Customer LTV (Customer Lifetime Value) – You will Experiment and Develop proven ideas to drive consumer adoption, retention & loyalties to SEGA brands.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

The successful candidate must have experience:
• Significant experience working within the digital sector
• Expertise in Adobe CC, Adobe XD or Figma.
• Demonstrable, basic level of HTML5 and CSS experience
• Using a user-centred approach, access and evaluate behaviours of our target audiences, to help inform and improve the experience and design of our online platform.
• Communicating ideas with senior client stakeholders while also managing their expectations.
• Delivering responsive/mobile friendly and content-rich website projects.
• Working in multi-disciplinary and cross-functional teams.
• Prototyping, creating story maps, writing user stories and agile software development practices.
• Must keep up to speed with legal compliances GDPR, PECR & ESRB

title: Senior UX/UI Designer
description:
We’re a leader in the pet care industry, which means we’re not only ahead in volume, profit and market share, but our associates dare to Stand Taller. We innovate new products, impart new agilities into existing processes, constantly advance pet nutrition, and always pay it forward in the form of service for our communities and families. Are you up for the dare?

This position is not eligible for Visa Sponsorship.

Position Summary:

CheckMark is where you’ll find the best of both worlds—the excitement and energy of ad agency life with the benefits of working for a leading corporation. Where else can you find career advancement, global exposure, and continuous training and development—all while flexing your creative and strategic muscles? It all happens right here.

As a Senior UX/UI Design Specialist, you demonstrate expert understanding of the UX landscape, a love for product design and the ability to provide UX/UI Design leadership when building products within digital environments... like .coms, apps, responsive & adaptive designs, voice, and other connected devices. With the swift pace of technical adoption, it is critical to be able to rapidly evaluate and optimize our products to keep up.

To help meet this challenge, our Senior UX/UI design specialists carry the responsibility of bringing expertise and utilizing consumer empathy and data, to critical problem solving for best-in-class user experience design for our digital products.

Collaborate with product owners and development teams to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience using wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps
Identify user needs and business requirements as inputs to design and facilitate user empathy mapping principles for cross-functional teams
Rapidly iterate on design prototypes and working applications executing all visual design stages from concept to wireframe, and UI hand off for development
Build professional, dynamic, and detail-oriented design systems for products and or groups of products
Provide design support during development and execution to ensure designs are implemented accurately and with the highest standards
Leverage data and consumer insights to validate UX approach
Act as the main point of contact for all technical related questions, support, and consulting requests regarding design

Requirements:

Bachelor’s Degree
5+ years of professional experience with 2+ years of that experience in UX or Digital Design
1+ years working knowledge of Sketch and/or Figma

Other:

1+ years of experience with D2C (Direct to Consumer) products or mobile applications is preferred
1+ years of experience in graphic design, UX research and designing mobile applications is preferred

It is our business imperative to remain a very inclusive workplace.

To our veterans and separated service members, you're at the forefront of our minds as we recruit top talent to join Nestlé. The skills you've gained while serving our country, such as flexibility, agility, and leadership, are much like the skills that will make you successful in this role. In addition, with our commitment to an inclusive work environment, we recognize the exceptional engagement and innovation displayed by individuals with disabilities. Nestlé seeks such skilled and qualified individuals to share our mission where you’ll join a cohort of others who have chosen to call Nestlé home.

The Nestlé Companies are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer seeking diversity in qualified applicants for employment. All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, gender, gender identity, age, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, perceived disability, medical condition, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other protected status, as defined by applicable law. Prior to the next step in the recruiting process, we welcome you to inform us confidentially if you may require any special accommodations in order to participate fully in our recruitment experience

title: UI/UX Designer
description:

To be successful in the UI/UX Designer role, you will need a strong understanding of user experience and human-centred design methodologies to shape the online customer journey.

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
With Ubuntu, Canonical created the first Linux for human beings. Our design team is on a mission to turn complex, open-source software into intuitive products that can change the face of enterprise IT. We are looking for an exceptional senior user experience designer, who shares our passion.

Our mission is to make enterprise-grade open source software, applications and services available to people everywhere. We create world-renowned software, impacting the lives of millions of engineers, enterprises, entrepreneurs and consumers every day. Our multi-disciplinary web design and production team includes visual designers, UX designers, front-end and back-end developers to bring exciting web projects to life. We help and learn from each other and strive to improve our work and processes.

We value:
• Excellent academic results at school and university
• Bachelor's or equivalent in User Experience, Design, or STEM
• Knowledge and passion for user experience, technology and design
•... Commitment to continuous learning and improvement - curious, flexible, scientific
• Drive to finish work and celebrate success
• Confidence in user research practices
• Engagement with the latest design research and innovation

UX designers should be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, designers and executives. They represent us at cross-functional company meetings and must present their design position with clarity and precision. They should be confident and excited to take on complex design challenges. They should also be able to connect their design leadership to the strategic vision of the company.

Read more about the design team
What we offer
• An opportunity to shape a company and products
• Influence in the open source community
• An inclusive work environment
• Learning and development
• Annual compensation review
• Recognition rewards
• Annual leave
• Priority Pass for travel

Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.
