title: UX/UI Designer
description:
SUMMARY

As a UX/UI Designer you will play a key role in creating emotionally compelling designs that are dynamic and enhance our customer satisfaction and make Kaspersky stand out from the pack.

You will achieve this by working closely with other teams to create seamless web/mobile designs that maximize positive business impact while applying user-centred design principles to ensure user needs are satisfied.

You will then present and defend these designs to stakeholders, to clearly explain how and why the psychology and UX principles used in the final design achieve the goals set by business input and user research.

MAIN DUTIES
Collaborate with multiple internal teams to define and understand business opportunities (Brand, Sales, CRO, Product development)
Create simple and intuitive solutions for complex business requirements
Interpret research findings to understand customer needs and motivation and how these affect the web experience
Identify and troubleshoot UX problems... throughout the website and mobile experience
Provide advice and guidance on the UX solution process from inception to completion, including wireframes, prototypes and final visual designs
Create user-centred UI elements that create positive impact on the user experience
Competitive analysis of websites and customer journeys and the ability to differentiate Kaspersky against these
Navigate changing priorities effectively in a fast paced, innovative environment whilst delivering adaptive and creative solutions

ESSENTIAL SKILLS and REQUIREMENTS
5 or more years of user experience design experience for websites, software UI, mobile websites, apps – leveraging emerging technologies
Expert level skill in all aspects of interaction design: wireframing, prototyping, storyboarding, IA design, navigation, content categorization, page layout, visual design
Fundamental understanding of Neuroscience, behavioural economics, and psychological persuasion as applied to web experiences
Strong conceptualization ability and exceptional visual communication ability
Strong attention to detail and have a keen eye for aesthetics
Proven ability to produce effective user-flows, wireframes and create high-quality visual design solutions
Strong working knowledge of design and interactive prototyping tools (Figma, UX pin, Adobe Suite, Axure, Invision, Sketch, etc.)
Ability to analyse data and research to drive user understanding and utilise this knowledge to drive UX objectives
Commercially driven with the ability to combine business needs and customer understanding to create beautiful solutions that convert
Proficient written and verbal communication skills

ADDITIONAL SKILLS
Experience working with pattern libraries and design systems
Familiarity with component-based design
Knowledge of conversion testing techniques
Knowledge of UX research methodologies
Proficient with visual design programs
Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, JS and development frameworks
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in interaction design, new media design or related design field; however, not necessary
Professional written and interpersonal skills

title: Junior UI UX Designer
description:
You’ll be responsible for identifying and designing improvements to the user experience, working with colleagues to implement recommended changes.

Review and improve the usability, accessibility and aesthetics of CLIENT’s websites and digital platforms globally, in line with our brand strategy and vision.

Collaborate with colleagues across CLIENT to identify and prioritise UX projects that will have the greatest positive impact on our audiences, providing advice and expertise on a range of initiatives.

Manage UX projects from research through to the approval of wireframes and prototypes – presenting concepts to internal and external stakeholders, incorporating feedback and advocating for the user throughout.

Support and contribute to the review and redesign of our key user journeys to ensure maximum engagement with CLIENT, particularly for organizations disclosing.

Run workshops for internal stakeholders to define objectives and priorities and facilitate idea generation.

Develop... a digital design system for application across our digital channels, ensuring a consistent, high-quality and cohesive user experience that meets brand objectives. Work closely with colleagues to implement changes.

Work with the wider Marketing team and technology colleagues to shape and conduct user research, drawing clear, actionable insight from findings.

Be CLIENT’s point person for adhoc UX design decisions through continuous improvement exercises.

Required Skills And Experience

Solid experience of designing UX solutions that drive tangible impact on organisational objectives and support brand strategy.

An ability to conduct competitor analysis & benchmarking, create user journeys, user flows, sitemaps, wireframes and interactive prototypes.

A keen eye for user-centric design, coupled with knowledge of UX for accessibility and inclusion.

Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to influence stakeholders at all levels to bring about change.

The ability to define UX research objectives and deliver on the results.

Experience working with complex organisations – either in-house or agency-side - managing multiple audiences, objectives and priorities.

Experience of working within a global organization that communicates in multiple languages.

A demonstrable track-record of staying ahead of UX trends.

Experience working directly with developers to optimise CMS website set-up.

Desired Skills And Experience

Experience conducting UX testing and research using a range of tools and methodologies.

Experience of UX design for B2B audiences.

Experience or running effective Conversion Rate

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
WHY US?

💸 £35-50k salary on a full time, permanent contract

🌎 Edinburgh office or fully remote working from anywhere in the UK!

🏖️ 33 Days Paid Leave

✨ Working with globally recognisable brands in US Entertainment

💻 M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent

💡 All the latest software and productivity tools you’ll need

SUMMARY

Storm Ideas work with globally-recognised clients in the US TV industry on extraordinary digital and marketing projects. Every day we produce work that is innovative, challenging and enjoyed by millions of people!
• We're looking for a Senior Designer with the creativity to produce amazing websites, app designs and high-quality digital assets.
• The ideal candidate is someone who has experience in both UI and graphic design

If the idea of a fast-paced, dynamic role with tonnes of opportunity for change, responsibility and innovation sounds exciting to you, then read on!

ABOUT US

Founded in 2008, we are an international team with our home office based in... Edinburgh, that works with incredible clients all over the world, particularly in the US TV industry.

Whether it’s developing our own products, producing engaging social content en masse, or designing and delivering services to help our clients work more efficiently, our work is varied, exciting and at the very forefront of the latest technology and trends.

Currently, we are a growing team of 100+ people but still looking for new colleagues who make an impact and believe in the same ideas and values as we do.

RESPONSIBILITIES

What can you expect?
• Designing websites and apps for internal projects and external clients and contributing to our internal design systems and processes
• Working closely with developers to bring your designs to life, by creating design specs, prototypes, and providing UI/UX feedback
• Creating effective and dynamic style guides and templates in Figma for other teams to produce social and digital marketing assets
• Producing fun, polished, well-designed assets using the Figma as primary tool and Adobe CC from time to time.
• Using a user focused design process to balance client, business and user needs to create the most effective design solutions
• Helping create polished client presentations
• Keeping up with design trends and tools
• Mentoring junior team members and helping set the standard of design for the company

QUALIFICATIONS

What's important to us:
• Excellent eye for detail particularly with regards to typography and layout
• Minimum of 3 years professional experience as a designer in a similar role: UI/UX design, product design, interaction design, etc
• Proven ability to design user flows, considering user needs, business needs, functionality, accessibility and aesthetics
• Mastery of Figma or willingness to learn quickly.
• Quick to learn and adapt to the dynamic nature of working with new tools, technologies and techniques
• High work-ethic, self-motivation and ability to work independently
• Strong time management skills with a proactive attitude towards communication with regards to your work
• Ability to adjust well to feedback and changing priorities

YOUR WORKING ENVIRONMENT

Agility & Openness for Ideas

We actively encourage the entire team to share their ideas, with that in mind we regularly adopt and implement suggestions across the company, you’re the specialist here! Operating with the agility of a high growth start-up, alongside the support you can expect from a larger organisation means we encourage quick decision making and a responsive, adaptive culture.

Outstanding People

We believe that great teams are built by a mixture of personality, skills and a passion for what people do. The Content Production team is 20+ people strong and made up of video editors, motion graphics specialists, project managers and graphic designers. We’re looking for people with a passion for what they do - just be yourself!

We’re an international team with more than 100 people onboard and we come from a mix of the biggest names in tech, to innovative start-ups and everything in between.

Forefront of Technology & Industry

Our culture is deeply embedded in harnessing technology and we're always at the forefront of the latest capabilities and trends. If you’re interested in the possibilities that technology can bring to both the way we work and how our clients communicate with their audiences, then we’d love to hear from you!

Top-notch Equipment

We’ll provide you with a high-end M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent as well as top of the range monitors, headphones, a keyboard, mouse and whatever you need to feel comfortable at work.

Flexibility

We’re a remote-first company and support 100% remote working. In your role you will be working from 10am till 6pm.

Joining us means becoming an integral part of the whole team no matter where we’re physically working, we have a number of initiatives to create a team environment regardless of geographic location.

EMPLOYMENT TYPE

Permanent / Full time. Either in our Edinburgh office or remote within the UK.

BENEFITS

Immediate Benefits
• 33 days’ holiday
• High end laptop of your choice - M1 Max MacBook Pro or PC equivalent, it’s up to you!
• Top of the range monitors, headphones, keyboard, mouse and gel rests
• Paid training to further your skills
• Annual Flu inoculation
• Team outings and monthly meets

After 3 Months
• Up to £700 to spend on a chair, desk or any other necessary workspace equipment to kit out your home office.
• £625 budget every two years to choose your own mobile phone + monthly mobile contract paid for
• Enrolment in workplace pension scheme with matched employer contributions
• Money towards glasses with Specsavers

After 1 Year
• Performance Related Pay Scheme giving an annual bonus of up to 100% of monthly salary whenever Storm Ideas is in profit
• Access to the Cycle to Work scheme

RECRUITMENT PROCESS

First, you will be invited for a 30-minute pre-interview via Zoom. We usually ask about your previous experience, future career path and motivation for changing your job.

If the pre-interview goes well, we will invite you to a second step - You will meet Jakub, our Design Manager, in a 60 minute interview via Zoom. It’s a mix of technical and culture-fit questions as well as providing you with more details about our projects and working in our team.

If the technical interview with Jakub goes well, we will invite you to complete a design task.

And that’s it!

Storm Ideas focuses on Entertainment Industry. Their company has offices in Edinburgh and Warsaw. They have a mid-size team that's between 51-200 employees.

You can view their website at https://stormideas.com/#intro

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Job description

UX/UI Designer
Location: Eastern Europe

As a UX/UI Designer you will be part of a collaborative, multi-disciplinary team of UX designers, UI designers, UX researchers and UX copywriters. We are a growing team looking for an ambitious and talented UX Designer to help craft first-class online experiences for our customers.

· Executing the User Centered Design (UCD) process from start to finish including the delivery of user journeys, sketches, wireframes and interactive prototypes

title: Product Designer (UI/UX) (Remote)
description:
Product Designer (UI/UX) (Remote)

Department: Technology & Product

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote, UK
Description

The UI/UX Designer role holds responsibility for the construction of application designs for both internal and external user audiences. The role is responsible for creating both functional and appealing features that address the client needs, and helping the company grow its customer base - as well as engaging with users to make their experience more user-friendly, intuitive and more efficient.

What that means day to day

· Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product analysts, product managers and developers.

· Understand product specifications and user psychology.

· Illustrate design ideas using storyboards, process flows and sitemaps.

· Design graphical user interface elements; e.g. menus, tabs and widgets.

· Develop UI mock-ups, prototypes and wireframes that clearly illustrate how sites function and look, focusing on ease... of use and minimize the need for training.

· Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. usability, findability and responsiveness).

· Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with Product Managers and Developers.

· Modify and revise existing designs to meet changing customer preferences.

· Work closely with Product Managers and Developers to suggest improvements for products and processes.

· Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate over your designs.

· Take an active role in quality assurance of designs developed.

· Collaborate effectively with other team members and stakeholders.

· Present UI/UX design ideas to cross-functional teams and senior leadership.

· Stay up to date on current industry trends and market conditions.

What you’ll need to be successful

You'll have demonstrable work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role with HTML/CSS designer experience. You'll have experience with tools such as Adobe products; PhotoShop/Illustrator, Balsamiq/InVision Mockups (or similar) and will have knowledge of JavaScript and Assistive technology.

You'll also have:
• Portfolio of design projects including digital experiences
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Knowledge of accessibility usability standards and guidelines
• Good skills in user interface creation, user experience, website and app design
• Good communication skills both verbal and written to collaborate with various stakeholders
• Good time-management skills
• Problem-solving aptitude
• Background in product research
• Familiarity with interaction design and information architecture

#LI-remote

What you’ll get in return

FOR THE HERE AND NOW – We provide a mature and flexible ‘work your way’ culture, generous holiday allowance, a ‘giving day’ to give back to others, enhanced family friendly leave (regardless of gender), an employee assistance programme, 24-hour online GP, gym discounts, cover for a variety of healthcare, dental, optical and wellbeing treatments/services, a cycle to work scheme and paid time off when you’re physically and mentally unwell.

FOR FUN – You spend a significant percentage of your time with your colleagues (and what a great bunch of people they are!) and it’s important to us that everyone contributes to an environment that is positive and full of laughs. We’ve always got something going on, from charity events and competitions to recognition events and awards and we encourage our teams to get involved and have fun along the way.

FOR THE FUTURE – To set you up for later on in life, we provide an enhanced pension scheme with generous employer contributions and a life assurance policy for peace of mind. We offer a plethora of development resources and support, including access to LinkedIn learning to support you as you develop your career with us. Last year alone we filled nearly 30% of our roles with internal candidates (which equates to almost 50 people being promoted!)

Sound interesting so far?

What you can expect if you apply:

· A response to your application within 10 working days

· An interview process consisting of:

o An initial discovery call with the recruiter

o A first stage interview via Microsoft Teams

o Additional interview (likely face to face) with the stakeholders you’ll be working with closely in the role

We’re keen to ensure our hiring process allows you to be at your best, so if you need us to make any adjustments, please just let us know.

title: Senior Product Designer: Design Systems
description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar North lookout for a talented Senior Product Designer who has great attention to detail and a passion for crafting beautiful product experiences; specializing in building and maintaining Design Systems.

This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar’s unique game development studio in the heart of Edinburgh.
WHAT WE DO
• We work as a global, cross-functional design team to create intuitive, effective and engaging product experiences.
• We design and optimize web products, and related digital applications across all Rockstar titles.
• We build bridges and foster close... collaboration with other teams to help shape all aspects of the player experience, and problem solve to create functional and efficient UI solutions.
RESPONSIBILITIES
• Create and develop UI design language, components and layouts. Getting into the bones of the product UI, thinking about all scalability, accessibility, usability and player needs.
• Support in the creation and iteration of mock-ups, prototypes and polished designs for web, and associated digital products that enhance and complement the user experience.
• Help to define Rockstar’s product design language, finessing our Design System to create guidelines and standards for our web and digital products.
• Create and maintain internal libraries and supporting documentation around our Design System, advocating for its use when applicable across the larger product organization.
• Produce flows describing UI states and the resulting visual information fed back to the user.
• Identify when new components are needed, being aware of the downstream effects of UI design work on development and the overall design ecosystem.
• Collaborate with UX Designers and technical teams to identify needs, and challenges to solve within the Design System, and assist with implementing solutions that ensure product consistency and effective use of components.
• Work closely with Visual Design teams, efficiently balancing the technical constraints while staying true to the look and feel, and overall art-direction of Rockstar’s products.
• Consistently benchmark the usability and accessibility of new and existing products and leverage creative solutions to make iterative improvements to designs.
QUALIFICATIONS
• 5+ years’ professional experience in a digital product design environment.
• Portfolio demonstrating applied UI design work and use of Design Systems for digital products.
SKILLS
• Experience building, maintaining and managing Design Systems.
• Experience creating UI designs, screens, flows and documentation with a high level of craft and keen eye for detail.
• Expertise in working to accessibility and inclusivity best practices; integrating WCAG and the latest research to ensure compliancy with current standards, requirements and guidelines.
• Solid foundation and understanding of UX methodology and user-centered design.
• Analytical and methodical approach to working.
• Great communication skills for collaborating closely with our teams worldwide.
• 5+ years’ experience of using modern design tools and workflows (Figma, FigJam, Adobe CC, etc).
• A desire to share knowledge and expertise, and help others improve their skills.
• Ability to problem solve from a systems perspective, and not just one-off approaches.
• Show initiative when presented with a problem, even when that problem is presented as a solution.
PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.
• Experience applying Design Systems across multiple platforms in multiple languages.
• Understanding of the features of modern design ecosystems, and design patterns.
• Experience in the games industry, having worked on one or more shipped titles or supporting digital products.
• Experience; or strong interest in graphic, motion design, typography and color theory.
• Knowledge or experience of front-end development and mark-up languages such as React, JavaScript, CSS, XAML.
• Passion for playing games.
HOW TO APPLY

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

Rockstar is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

If you’ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, or race

title: UI/UX Designer - DApps
description:
UX/UI Designer – Blockchain - Dapps
Location: London, Soho
Industry: Blockchain | Tech
Salary Range: Industry leading base, crypto LTIP (Tezos tokens) and great benefits
About:
TriliTech is a Tezos blockchain research and development hub based in London, UK. We are on a mission to advance the state of the art in blockchain technology, building the most scalable, secure and energy-efficient decentralised platform in the world.
Tezos is an open-source platform for assets and applications that can evolve by upgrading itself. We are one of the original proof of stake smart contract layer one blockchains. Since launching in 2018, Tezos has been utilised for hundreds of projects, attracted a vibrant, global community, and logged millions of transactions. Our proof of stake design means it can operate in an energy efficient manner, consuming over two-million times less energy than popular proof of work networks.
Our current corporate partners include Redbull Racing, McLaren, Ubisoft, Societe... Generale and many others. Projects built on the Tezos blockchain include Hic Et Nunc, Objkt.com, Interpop, OneOf and Kukai.
The Role:
Here at Trilitech, we are moving through rapid growth and are currently offering a fantastic opportunity for a UX/UI designer to come and join our small and expanding team.
You will be responsible for designing applications on the Tezos blockchain and digital tools – including websites and design resources – that foster ecosystem growth. To this end, you will contribute to design-related efforts surrounding product development and community outreach, including user research, prototyping, testing and iterating on attractive consistent UX.
Day to Day you will:
• Work with cross-functional teams to define scope and features of product
• Support the development team with the implementation of prepared design concept
• Develop design concepts for web and mobile applications and interfaces driven by personas, user-stories and user experience
• Develop user scripts, design layouts, development of user-first interfaces
Essential Requirements:
• Based in London or Berlin
• A creative, current portfolio that shows potential for experimentation
• Demonstrable UX skills: experience translating project specs to user flows, wireframes and final designs
• Visual design skills: the ability to present clear information architecture and craft inspiring visual designs
• Design systems experience: comfort working within and maintaining design systems
• User Research experience: Familiarity with different methods and use cases
• Accessibility and ethics familiarity: familiarity with principles and experience integrating into designs
• Genuine interest in Blockchain
Nice to have:
• Experience designing for open source projects
• Familiarity with front end programming languages
Benefits:
You will have the opportunity to:
• Become an expert in blockchain technologies
• Spend 20% of your time working on blockchain-related passion projects
You will also receive:
• Highly competitive compensation package
• Generous pension scheme and core benefits
• Tez (Tezos tokens) LTIP scheme
• Flexible hybrid working policy
• 25 days holiday plus a day off for your birthday
Culture:
We care deeply about our culture and have developed it across five key pillars:
Autonomy: we believe in hiring great people, then giving them the space and flexibility to work in the way that’s best for them. We will agree on goals, and then expect you to decide how you want to pursue those goals.
Collaboration: as a fast growing small business we all work together across multiple workstreams. We have a flat structure and encourage frank discussion, honesty and openness.
Learning and development: the blockchain space is developing at an incredibly fast rate. Having a growth mentality and being open to continuous learning is an important part of our culture. It’s always OK to not know the answer to something and have to do some research! We cement this by offering more formal perks to help fund employees’ continued education.
Diversity and Inclusion: inclusiveness is one of our blockchain’s core strengths, and in the same way we are committed to inclusiveness across all diversity dimensions. We are also actively looking for talent outside of the immediate blockchain space. What we primarily look for is general markers of excellence and ambition.
Mission driven: we believe that the Tezos blockchain is going to change the world and our goal is to promote its adoption. Blockchain technology will power new positive change, increase the democratisation of previously restricted systems and create transparency and trust

title: Principal UI Designer​/SaaS
description:
Position: Principal UI Designer (SaaS)
An opportunity to join a unicorn enterprise SaaS scale-up valued at £1.5

Billion. Own the build out of their brand new design system with the goal of winning awards and setting the standard for B2B design. Remote-first policy with travel to the Manchester office once a quarter.

The client

They are building a product that helps teams get data business-ready, faster — accelerating time-to-value and increasing the impact data can have.

An extensive client roster in the the thousands (including Cisco, Docu Sign, Slack, and TUI) trust their technology to load, transform, sync, and orchestrate their data for a wide range of use cases from insights and operational analytics, to data science, machine learning, and AI.

They are now looking to add a Principal UI Designer based in the UK but can be based out of their Manchester HQ ss the UK.

The role

The Principal UI Designer is responsible for making user interactions with the product second to... none, empowering customers to achieve their goals with delight. Working alongside the Director rience in close collaboration with Principal UX Designers and Product Marketing Managers, you’ll establish a resonant, evolving vision of the future and a strategy to realise it.

As the most senior designer for all things UI, you’ll lead the way towards UI and visual design excellence. By establishing and continuously improving principles that encompass interface, interaction, visual and animation design in accordance with the validated needs of our customers.

You will own the continued creation of the Design System and work with the Platform UI team to build a pattern library, which will include creative direction in building out a visual language that creates distinctive and memorable brand experiences across the product suite. What will you do?

Work with Principal UX Designers to define the vision and milestones for UI as part of the UX strategy

Work with Product Marketing to form strong narratives — defining product and UX principles that strongly resonate with customers

Lead market/trend analysis and research initiatives to uncover and validate UI design opportunities

Attain alignment and strategic adoption by regularly communicating the vision for UI across the team Cultivate a comprehensive Design System that allows efficient, consistent design to take place at scale

Participate in user research activities to optimise extendable components and pattern UIWork with the Platform UI team (Front End Engineers) to build out a Pattern Library that promotes consistent and accessible foundations for the product teams to build upon Support wider members of the design team to bring visual coherence to the customer experience outside of the product suite (brand, web, marketing, video, events collateral etc.)

Is this you?

UI Obsession — you were born to realise beautiful interactions in everything you do, leaving those who experience it delighted.

Collaboration mastery — able to inclusively generate alignment on direction, approach and concepts from all levels of stakeholder.

Excellent communication skills — able to form narratives that align strategic business decision making.

Advanced presentation skills — able to present ideas/concepts to stakeholders with confidence.

Hyper-aware and proactive — able to autonomously discover and action opportunities to drive design excellence through ambiguous or complex circumstances.

Design Intuition — visually literate with a keen eye for aesthetic and fluency in the language of design.

Proactive — self-organised and ability to plan your work and the work of the team in line with commercial goals.

What’s in it for you? Strong leadership – Work under a highly experienced and award winning design leader.

Autonomy – An environment that encourages autonomy and flexibility as well as high performance.

Ownership – As the most senior UI Designer in the team, you will have complete ownership of a fundamental part of the customer experience – the Design System and Visual Language.

Rapid growth – As a growing unicorn, joining them presents an opportunity for accelerated career development.

Package and

Benefits:

Salary between £80,000 and £100,000 DOEA truly flexible & remote working culture

A culture that promotes work life balance

Company Equity Access to mental health support
25 days holiday that increases to 30 after 12 months service + bank holidays5 days paid volunteering leave

Health insurance

Life Insurance Pension Career development with monthly hackdays and access to a Udemy account& much more!

If this sounds like it could be your next challenge, then get in touch with your CV and portfolio at shreya

title: Graphics & UX/UI Designer
description:
—Who are Piovis Consulting—

We're just a bunch of young, fun, smart professionals who have come together to establish an innovative business consulting, mentoring and delivery service.

We have over 15 years of success working with FORTUNE 250 and FTSE 250 companies, from change management and product delivery right through to advising at the Board level.

-- What we are doing --

We are creating a series of award-winning, high-engagement websites that will help solve other people’s problems. We’re building a great team to create thought-provoking content that is different from any other company, based on current affairs.

-- Where you come in --

We're looking for someone hungry, open-minded and proactive to create user flows, widgets and graphic designs. You will be a good listener, someone that can present their work and can focus on multiple projects at the same time

You will learn some ground-breaking concepts that will help you with business and in your personal life. As part... of this journey, you will learn how to manage relationships to win us opportunities and get your designs seen by large audiences!

-- Who's this role for? --

This role is perfect for anyone passionate about troubleshooting UX problems and designing key elements to improve the user experience. You'll learn some straightforward and smart concepts that will put you ahead of your competition. You'll learn how to think laterally and see things in a way that most others cannot. Most importantly, you will be a crucial part of our success.

This will be a fantastic way to get your foot through the door for any industry from digital media to management consulting, plus some great bragging rights!

-- Key responsibilities --

Create user-centred designs by understanding business requirements

Create user flows, wireframes, prototypes and mockups

Translate requirements into style guides, design systems, design patterns and attractive user interfaces

Design UI elements such as input controls, navigational components and informational components

Create original graphic designs (e.g. images, sketches and tables)

Identify and troubleshoot UX problems (e.g. responsiveness)

Collaborate and manage expectations of your team

Design icons and widgets

Attend meetings to discuss and review progress, take notes and actions

Qualifications are not mandatory, although the following are preferred:
• Experience in creating written content (journalistic articles, conversational style, online journalism, investigative journalism, news, reviews, columns, feature writing) in either magazines, newspapers, and/or online but must have been based on facts (no sensational articles)
• Experience of working as an editor is a good to have but not essential
• Experience in interviewing

About you:

Good vocabulary

Strong communicator written and speaking

Good investigative skills

Excellent grammar, spelling and punctuation

Keen interest in news, current affairs and trends

Highly analytical (looks at something from different perspectives and sources)

Can explain complex topics in simple language

Can work within tight deadlines

Highly organised

High attention to detail

Polite

Proactive

Sociable

Very punctual

Enjoys helping others

Very honest and reliable

Positive energy

Good at listening and ensures that they understand

Naturally inquisitive and wants to understand the why

Able to "read the room" and understand how people are feeling

Be able to receive constructive criticism well

Candidate must be eligible for Kickstart.

Piovis consulting focuses on Web Design and Web Development. Their company has offices in United Kingdom. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.youtube.com/channel/ucdiyk8w8xdzuqn167xwdeng

title: User Experience (UX) Designer Internship
description:
Design at Amazon has been growing steadily in reach and impact—from devices to fashion, delivery logistics to search and streaming video, from voice and sound to physical retail, and more—all while creating and cultivating experiences that touch Amazon customers everywhere, every day. Amazon design teams include every flavour of UI, UX, visual, motion, illustration, brand, and marketing design roles—as well as design technologists, researchers, writers, and more. Check out Amazon.design, and come build the future with us.

As a UX Design Intern, you will collaborate with a team that defines and designs user interfaces, systems, and interaction, visual, and motion design patterns.

Responsibilities
· Design thoughtful, beautiful, and useful software user interfaces and experiences in a team environment.
· Create user-centered designs by considering market analysis, customer feedback, site metrics, and usability findings.
· Use business requirements, user and market research to assist... in developing scenarios, use cases, and high-level requirements.
· Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, and prototypes.
· Work with stakeholders to plan projects for effective delivery while maintaining high standards for design.
· Be a passionate and effective advocate for design with non-design audiences.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

· Design experience
· An available online portfolio
· Currently working towards a Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Design, Human-Centred Interaction, Statistics, Psychology, Computer Science, or other equivalent discipline.
· Previous design internship(s) and/or project experience in design
· Experience working in a collaborative team environment to deliver high-quality design solutions
· Experience in a variety of design, wire-framing, and prototyping tools
· Creative materials demonstrating past work experience and deliverables (e.g., study plans, reports, portfolio)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

· Experience with consumer brand experience design and a understanding of storytelling
· Visual design expertise demonstrated through mockups and style guides
· Additional design skills in related fields, including film-making, motion design, and prototyping
· Experience in designing cross platform experiences
· Ability to extract complex concepts and quickly turn around rigorous flows and mock-ups reflecting a range of options
· Ability to proficiently present design solutions to stakeholders in design, product management, and engineering
· Ability to drive the design review cycle and close on design requirements independently
· Able to use best practices for mobile and web-based information architecture and design, as well as knowledge of usability principles and techniques
· Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills

Amazon Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO)

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your
passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.
Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page?region_id=region_eu) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

title: UI / UX Designer
description:
Great opportunity to join a high calibre team and use your skills for good. This is a growing organisation looking to significantly impact climate change. We are looking for a UI / UX designer with a background in analytics, design and presenting data. You'll be working closely with product management, modellers and software engineering.

Growing SaaS organisation based in Cambridge supporting organisations to achieve Net Zero.

In this role you sit within the Product team and work to enhance the climate analytics platform. You will collaborate with data scientists, modellers and software engineering and create compelling data visualisations and drive the overall design of the platform.

In this role you will be expected to:

• Design data heavy graphic user interface elements such as tables, graphs maps to simplify and highlight key insights
• Prepare and present designs to internal teams and key stakeholders
• Ensure brand guidelines are adopted to harmonise look and feel and improve readability

This is a great role for a candidate looking to join a rapidly expanding company:

Essential Skills

• Proven experience with data visualisation design

£60,000 to £70,000 plus bonus and shares.

title: Visual and UI Designer
description:
WHO WE ARE

Launched in early 2019, we are a FAST GROWING TECH START-UP and we are scaling at pace. Our

vision is to be the #1 Global Social Fundraising platform for nonprofits. AND THE BEST BIT? We help our

nonprofits to increase their fundraising, in turn supporting hundreds of amazing causes around the world.

ABOUT YOU

As part of a start-up team, you’ll need to be prepared to ‘roll up your sleeves’ and get things done. We

‘move fast and ship’ which means you’ll need to work at pace, be productive and have high output! You’ll

be expected to share your ideas, work collaboratively, have a growth mindset and act like an owner. It’s

hard work but with that comes an amazing opportunity to be part of a business with huge growth potential

and fantastic learning and development opportunities.

ABOUT THE ROLE

This is a brand new role which will work across the company to create visually appealing and on brand

designs to help build and market GivePanel across a variety of... platforms.

You will sit within the Product team, working closely with the UX Designers to translate their prototypes into visual designs that can be used for development. You will also work as part of the Marketing and Growth team to help spread the word about Social Fundraising and how nonprofits worldwide can use GivePanel to smash their fundraising targets and save a tonne of time and money, through the development of the GivePanel brand and related assets.

You will be an expert in your field and know the company’s brand and products inside and out. Success in

this role is tracked by your ability to create the right designs, for the right interface and audience, and done

with high velocity.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

● Establish the look and feel for various interfaces, including the GivePanel web app, website,

presentations etc.

● Work within our brand guidelines to create layouts that reinforce our brand’s style and tone of voice

through its visual touchpoints

● Influence, develop and implement a truly product-focussed visual brand identity for GivePanel

● Translate prototypes into visual designs that can be used in our development process

● Work with the Head of Marketing and wider team to enhance our users’ overall experience with the

GivePanel brand

● Contribute to the design and development of our new GivePanel website

● Develop and design visuals for web applications

● Support the team with the development of assets for marketing purposes (slide decks, logos,

collateral, videos etc.)

● Stay abreast of current visual design trends and bring these back in to the team

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR

● We are not looking for just anyone - we are looking for go-getters, those fearless and willing to fail,

those with a growth mindset, a creative thinker who challenges the status quo and works at pace.

● 3-5+ years’ experience in creating and implementing UI design

● Proven UI experience with a strong portfolio

● Proficient with visual and design programmes (Adobe Creative Cloud / Creative Suite / Sketch /

Invision)

● Creative and artistic with an eye for amazing design

● Experience working in a fast-paced Agile environment

● Experience of working with/in a marketing team on creative projects

● Understanding of analytics and reporting to driven data-driven decisions and insights

● Excellent organisational skills with ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines

● Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal

● Positive and flexible attitude towards your work

● Degree and/or professional qualifications in Graphic Design, Web Design, IT or related field

● Experience with front-end dev coding (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) is a bonus but not mandatory**

● Basic knowledge of User Experience (UX) principles and techniques

● Experience with working with other UX and Product designers

WHAT WE OFFER

● We put FAMILY FIRST and we work FLEXIBLY - this means you choose when you work, where you

work AND how you work.

● We believe that having an AWESOME SPACE to work matters. We don’t have an office but will

provide everything you need to set you up at home, in a local co-working space or somewhere else!

● We celebrate our WINS and work collaboratively through regular away days and events with the

team.

● 25 days’ annual leave + bank holidays.

GivePanel focuses on SaaS, Charity, and Non Profit. Their company has offices in United Kingdom. They have a small team that's between 11-50 employees.

You can view their website at https://givepanel.com

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Senior UX/UI Designer

Reporting to the Experience Design Director

Hello! We're Hi Mum! Said Dad.

We're one of the UK's most awarded and innovative digital product studios with a ten-year pedigree in innovation and digital product design. We design for real needs and build digital products that people truly value. In the Strategy and Design team, we're at the product front-line - crafting digital products for mobile, web, voice, and exciting emerging technologies.

We believe creating innovative digital experiences is both a science and an art, so we champion rigorous research and testing as well as giving the Strategy and Design team the space to follow a flexible creative process.

We’re a close-knit team that believe learning from each other is essential to our personal growth. We have dedicated time every week devoted to developing each other’s skills and critiquing each other’s work - even if we’re not on the same project.

As a Senior UX/UI Designer in the Strategy and Design... team, you’ll be involved in every step of the way of creating new digital products from scratch; from research, product strategy, UX design, UI design, and user testing, to collaborating with developers through build and launch.

In return, you’ll get the opportunity to grow your craft and leadership skills, taking on responsibility that stretches you in a way that matches your career aspirations.

Who we’re looking for

We’re looking for someone who has played a role in creating a range of new digital products and is passionate to grow their skillset.

You’ll have a strategic, solution-focused mindset with the ability to translate concepts and ideas into practical and tactical outcomes. You’ll play an integral part of a team that will deliver world-class digital products and experiences for our globally recognised clients.

Your main strength lies in UX design. However, you are also competent at UI design when needed. You’ll have a basic understanding of research, strategy, visual design, and service design. While you’re not necessarily an expert in all of these, you’ll know what good looks like and can have a decent conversation about them. You’re a keen learner and are excited to develop your skills in these areas.

Above all, you’ll be an excellent communicator having presented work and explained your design rationale to a variety of stakeholders.

What Will You Be Doing?

You’ll usually be working on one project at a time, bringing highly effective digital products and experiences to life. You’ll be working in multidisciplinary teams - collaborating with other designers, strategists, developers, product managers, and project managers. As a Senior UX/UI Designer, you’ll be coaching and supporting more junior designers, while in turn being supported by a Principal Experience Designer. You’ll be reporting into our Experience Design Director and Managing Partner.

In a little more detail, you will:
• Usually work on one project at a time. Occasionally two.
• Work directly with the client executing all the necessary design work - creating deliverables such as user flows, mockups and prototypes
• Work across a broad range of projects spanning websites, mobile apps, services and voice skills
• Coach and inspire more junior members of the team; demonstrating best practises, and promoting a culture of collaboration
• Work with strategists and designers to ensure that products are research-driven, validated with user testing and deliver against business objectives
• Support the costing and planning activity of design deliverables, report on the status of deliverables and quickly notify the project management team of risks
• Design and run both internal and client-facing workshops
• Contribute to company culture, blog posts, social media, white papers, as well as attending or speaking at industry conferences
• And most importantly; be part of a team that creates exceptional design work

Essential experience
• Been hands on at every step of creating a new digital product
• Worked as part of a multidisciplinary team following an agile approach
• Designed native experiences for both iOS and Android, and understand how experiences differ between the two
• Designed responsive web-based applications across different devices
• Collaborated with developers to understand technical constraints and create appropriate deliverables
• Communicated the underlying principles and rationale of designs, constructing compelling narratives that sell ideas to stakeholders and team members
• Created or maintained design systems and component libraries
• Proficient in both Sketch and Figma

Bonus experience
• Worked in both agency and in-house design roles
• Worked in a startup environment
• Worked in Fintech, Auto, Energy sectors
• Created new voice skills
• Service design - both documenting existing services and creating new services

And what will you get in return?
• A competitive salary
• 25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)
• ½ day off on your birthday
• A great pension scheme
• Health and dental insurance (it can even be used towards a spa day)
• Craft-focused skills development
• Sector-specific training courses help take your career to the next level

title: Senior Product Designer (UX/UI, Remote in the UK only)
description:
Who we are

We’re a digital CX agency, collaborating with healthcare and pharmaceutical organisations around the world to create digital experiences that are truly aligned to audience needs. Our services fall under three core pillars; strategy, research and design. In joining Graphite, you’ll become part of a creative, diverse and rapidly growing team that is making a measurable difference to people’s health and wellbeing through creating exceptional digital experiences.

We’re headquartered in Brighton, with our teams working remotely across the UK.

The Role

You will be responsible for helping to lead the way of design on one of our key pharmaceutical accounts. You will be in constant interaction with other departments and clients. Your work will be outcome-focused, user-centred and data-informed. You will share your work early and often, seeking feedback from across the board and taking part in design reviews. You will be part of a talented team of Designers, Researchers, Account... Managers and Project Managers.

As a storyteller, you will be responsible for presenting your work to high-level client stakeholders and make them see the positive impact of your design strategy and vision. You will comfortably facilitate and lead various design and concept workshops. You will also be planning your work, creating compelling visions for our clients, estimating tasks and communicating those to the rest of the team.

You will feel comfortable zooming in and out of BAU project work, as well as flexing to contribute to the strategy and processes of the squad. With an eye for detail, you will help manage our Design System, and work closely with developers to maintain it. Your expert problem-solving skills will be effective in creating solutions that are in line with the regulatory requirements of the sector.

Your Manager will help you achieve your goals and enable you to create your best work. You will have regular 1-2-1 sessions and training budget to make sure you get the best out of your time at Graphite.

Your responsibilities
• Think strategically about the future of our client's key products and services.
• Create, iterate, communicate and own design that is anchored in user and business needs.
• Supporting the Project and Account Managers in maintaining and growing our relationship within this key account.
• Communicating your approach and ROI of your work to clients, involving key stakeholders along the way to make them feel engaged.
• Communicating and improving your design process (Design direction and strategy, research, UX, Ops, workshops, etc...).
• Brainstorm concepts, facilitate & plan workshops (UX/Roadmap/etc..).
• Working with researchers and UI Designers to refine the final product.
• Maintain a Design System and contribute to its growth and documentation.
• Line manage one or two designers (1-2-1, goal settings and personal development).

Skills Required

Please apply even if you only have experience 6 out of 8 criteria
• Extensive experience in user experience (UX), user interface (UI), information architecture and interaction design.
• Strong understanding of product strategy and research.
• Ability to ideate fast and explore multiple routes to solve a problem.
• You are able to recognise and act on pain points and opportunities within customer journeys to fulfil user and business needs.
• You have facilitated multiple workshops and are comfortable adapting the framework to the business needs.
• You have a good understanding of key design methodologies (Design Thinking, Design sprints, Atomic Design, UX, etc…)
• You have worked in an Agile environment.
• You have experience presenting your work to clients and leading client meetings.
• Figma experience, including working with Design Systems.
• Desirable but not essential: Experience managing multidisciplinary teams (UX designers, UI designers, Researchers)
• Desirable but not essential: You have worked within regulated sectors such as Healthcare, Banking or Insurance.

Benefits

Read our employee experience introduction to see all our benefits; including:
• Private health insurance with high standards of cover
• Comprehensive private dental plan
• Enhanced maternity and paternity leave
• Personal development time and annual training budget
• Monthly social meet-ups and events
• 25 days holiday, increasing after 2 years
• Opportunities to give back with dedicated time for community engagement and charitable initiatives to suit your interests — young talent; diversity and inclusion; environment and sustainability; wellness
• Free employee assistance support for personal challenges, whether legal, financial or medical
• Cycle to work and electric vehicle car lease schemes
• Pension scheme with employer contributions

Salary

£42,000 to £51,000 a year (Depending on experience)

Applying

Please apply via our online application system and include a cover letter and your CV. Be sure also to include a link to your digital portfolio.

We can only accept applicants with the right to work in the UK.

We value diversity of experience, knowledge and perspectives and all they bring to our teams. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, religion, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other basis as protected by applicable law. If you have a disability or additional need that requires accommodation, please do not hesitate to let us know

title: Lead UI / UX Designer
description:
Important:

We have a need for a part-time contractor who can work remotely anywhere in Canada, the US, the UK or Europe. This is an ongoing need and could develop into a permanent part-time contract or staff position.

Who we are: Chelo is the latest AI Tech startup to come out of Post Urban Ventures, a highly successful deep tech AI venture builder. We are a team of serial entrepreneurs with PhDs from Cambridge, MIT, and UCL that is, fully funded, and on a mission to transform the way companies operate, grow, implement their vision, create cultures and products. You can learn more about us here: https://posturban.vc/

What we are working on: We operate in the deep tech AI space, where we focus on applying fundamental science to business problems as we create solutions. As such, we are often developing prototypes to prove our fundamental science hypotheses and we need help creating product on top of these scientific prove outs. For Chelo, we are focusing on the application of graph... structures and AI to knowledge base creation.

The Role:

We are looking for an experienced Senior UX Designer to lead the research activities that will help define and drive the future of our products. You’ll be working on a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team in order to discover, explore, and validate Chelo's business propositions as we grow the product. Any experience with: database visualization, graph databases or large qualitative data knowledge bases would be helpful in this role

What we are looking for: In this role here are the key competencies we are looking for.
• Creative: You will help define the problem—not just help influence the solution. You will come up with practical ways to formulate research and design questions, explore problem spaces, and surface insights before having all the information.
• Quick. You can scale—up and down—your research activities to reflect the need: not everything needs to be completely understood or take weeks to deliver value. You look for opportunities to leverage other learning's and insights, even if they aren’t a perfect fit.
• Unconventional. We work on complex challenges that invite bold and unorthodox approaches. You’re not afraid to suggest something that sounds odd or risky, and you build on the ideas of others.
• Comfortable with iterative change. We often need to quickly change direction based on what we’ve learned—or still need to learn. We can be working on more than one idea at a time, ideas can move forward, or ideas can be shelved.
• Embracing ambiguity. We deal with challenges that no one else has tackled yet. We make decisions based on the data we have, knowing there are areas of the problem space we just don’t know much about yet.
• Experimental: Open to trying new ways of doing things. We embrace experimentation, look for inspiration in non-traditional spaces, and measure things to see what works.
• Imperfect. You don't let perfection be the enemy of the good or good enough, to start.

If this is you and you are comfortable working in undefined creative space, we would love to here from you

title: UI/UX Designer
description:
Netcall is a high growth business providing industry specific software solutions that accelerate and simplify the path to digital. Spanning the entire customer journey across the public, healthcare and corporate markets, our solutions combine the skills of business experts to craft incredible customer experiences.
Purpose of Role:
To develop UX and UI solutions using Adobe Creative Suite and implement custom SASS to modify the Liberty platform UI to a high standard.
Key Responsibilities:
Take responsibility for the development of tasks within any given project
Work proficiently with a range of stakeholders within the business and its customers.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement in all areas of technology and the software development process. Help instil the principle of this culture across the entire development organisation.
Help ensure that the Development Team adheres to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001, PCI-DSS and any future quality or security accreditations that... Netcall holds.
Essential Skills:
Demonstrate a deep understanding of SASS and Grid CSS and their role in building flexible front-end interfaces.
Demonstrate an excellent working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, in terms of UX and design.
You'll have the ability to design user interfaces from a UX, design and development perspective on a range of products and systems
You have experience working within a multidisciplinary team including project managers, product owners, developers/builders and QA/test resources.
You have the ability to manage conflicting messages, influence stakeholders whilst retaining a focus on core business requirements
You are able to prioritise your work and deliver to tight timescales, demonstrating good organisational, communication and administrative skills.
You take responsibility for your own professional development and learning and encourage others in the team to do the same.
Desirable Skills:
Experience of the latest Vue.JS v3.
Experience of the Bulma CSS framework.
Experience of some of the tools and libraries used by the wider team, including PHP, MySql, Git and the Linux command line.
Behavioural competencies:
At Netcall we measure how results are achieved using a competency framework. Definitions of the competencies applicable for the role are listed below:
Teamwork - co-operates with others to accomplish common goals; works with others within and across his/her department to achieve shared goals; treats others with dignity and respect and maintains a friendly demeanour; values the contribution of others.
Communication - listens to others to gain a full understanding of issues; comprehends written material; presents information in a clear and concise manner orally and in writing to ensure others understand his/her ideas; appropriately adapts his/her message, style and tone to accommodate a variety of audiences.
Drive - having the sustained energy and determination to achieve results by overcoming obstacles.Drive is about demonstrating the urgency and motivation in setting and meeting challenging targets with required quality and service, and to time.
Accountability - accepts full responsibility for self and contribution as a team member; displays honesty and truthfulness; confronts problems quickly; displays a strong commitment to the success of the Company acting as a credible representative of the business.
Agility - adapts to change and different ways of doing things quickly and positively; does not shy away from addressing setbacks or ambiguity; deals effectively with a variety of people and situations; appropriately adapts thinking or approach as the situation changes.
Creativity & Innovation - applies creative problem solving skills in order to develop solutions; recognises and demonstrates the value of taking "smart" risks and learning from mistakes; develops multiple alternatives and understands the feasibility of each; effectively shares and implements ideas.
Customer Focus - understands that all employees have external and/or internal customers that they provide services and information to; provides helpful, courteous, accessible, responsive and knowledgeable customer service
Personal Development and Developing Others - enhances the capabilities of the organisation by openly and effectively sharing his/her expertise with others; supports a continuous learning environment by preserving and compiling intellectual capital which can be used by others within his/her team and the organisation as a whole.
Special conditions:
Satisfactory completion of pre-employment screening, including a DBS/NPPV3 check dependent on role and responsibilities.
There may be some requirement to travel to other locations within the UK
Implement and act in accordance with the Company's Information Security and Acceptable Use policies.
The above list of duties is not exhaustive and you may be required to undertake other tasks within the scope of your role. Any job description provided to you by the organisation will not form part of your contract of employment unless specified otherwise

title: Senior UI/UX Designer
description:
Plentific is one of the fastest growing property technology companies in the world, backed by renowned investors including Brookfield, Highland Europe, A/O Proptech, Target Global and Mubadala. We are headquartered in London, UK, with offices in Germany, USA and Turkey. Our mission is to improve lives by making property work better for everyone. We do so by streamlining how repairs, maintenance and compliance services are delivered. Our platform gives clients rich insight into management, operational and performance data, helping them deliver their customer service promise, while optimising supplier costs and adhering to their environmental, social and governance goals.

Come and be a part of:
• A leading Proptech with a global footprint and an HQ in heart of London’s bustling centre
• A diverse, multicultural workplace with over 30 nationalities amongst our employees
• A stimulating atmosphere and fast-paced growth led by our recent $100m funding round
• A flexible work culture and a... number of programmes built around your physical and mental wellbeing

Developing acclaimed technology is only possible when we’ve got a great team on our side. Our culture is open and empowering. If you are passionate and driven, you will fit right in.

plentific.com/careers

The Role

The role designs a wide variety of graphics, layouts and user interactivity for web pages, prototypes and product illustrations across digital and offline media both on the marketing side, and UI side with a primary focus on Plentific’s core product. It is a hands-on role, helping to set the vision and driving concepts to create innovative and interactive design experiences.

To be successful in this position, the role holder will be a self-starter, high energy, capable of delivering brilliant creative ideas, and show amazing attention to detail.

Responsibilities:
• Support the design team objectives by accomplishing tasks as needed on time.
• Creating user-centred designs by understanding business requirements, and user feedback
• Work with product managers to create prototypes for new product ideas.
• Create and help maintain the design system and style guides.
• Coordinate with internal and external stakeholders as necessary throughout the lifecycle of projects
• Collaborate with other designers and help disseminate design best-practice across the team.

Requirements
• Proficient with Sketch and inVision, basic experience in Abstract workflow, general proficiency with Adobe CC, Office, Google apps, Dropbox.
• A deep understanding of mobile app design patterns.
• Strong attention to detail with a keen eye for aesthetics
• A good understanding of accessibility patterns in design.
• High energy, happy to learn, positive attitude, passionate about design.
• Ability to collaborate across teams.
• Expert understanding of how visual layouts affect user experiences.
• Proficiency in prototyping tools such as Sketch, InVision, Abstract and Figma.
• Extensive experience in the industry as a digital designer, preferably in a start-up or a digital design agency.
• Excellent communication skills and can clearly articulate your ideas, designs, and suggestions
• Experience designing web and mobile apps with complex user flows.
• Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus

Benefits

As you can see, we have big plans and are eager to grow our team of dreamers and doers to achieve our vision of managing over 1 million properties through our platform across various countries. You can help us shape the future of property management. Here’s what we offer:
• A competitive compensation package
• A flexible working environment + 25 days annual holiday
• Private health care including discounted gym membership
• Life insurance
• Employee assistance program
• Company volunteering day and charity salary sacrifice scheme
• Learning and development fund
• Referral bonus and charity donation if someone you introduce joins the company
• Season ticket loan, Cycle to work, Electric vehicle and Techscheme programs
• Pension - 3% employer contribution, 5% employee contribution
• Regular company-sponsored lunches, dinners and social gatherings
• Fully stocked kitchen with drinks, snacks, fruit, breakfast cereal etc.
• An inherently diverse culture with over 18 nationalities and 25 languages spoken

title: UI/UX Design Graduate
description:
Are you ready to start your career in an inclusive, flexible, and dynamic work environment? What are you waiting for? Apply today! Join the Jacobs Graduate Development Programme (GDP) to start your career within a supportive and diverse team who always strive to do the right thing for our people, environment and communities. As a Jacobs Graduate you will be part of a larger network of talent who are Challenging Today and Reinventing Tomorrow. Some of our very own Jacobs Graduates have contributed to this advert - so you're getting a firsthand account of what it's like to work with us! What we do at Jacobs Our People & Places Solutions (P&PS) business focuses on providing solutions to future challenges such as climate change, the need for renewable energy, low carbon economies, transportation, and material resource and waste management.

While we shape some of the very largest and most challenging landmark projects in the UK, we also deliver local projects that protect communities. We... lead with the environment and make social and natural capital central to how we solve our clients' challenges. We are helping to create the sustainable and resilient cities and communities of the future, making attractive places for all to live and work.

What's in it for you? As a Jacobs Graduate you will join a structured 2-year programme aimed at progressing Graduates into global project leaders and problem solvers. Our GDP provides the framework, mentoring and expertise, supporting you to reach your full potential. On joining our programme in September 2023, you will rapidly gain knowledge of how our company works, what motivates us and how you can make innovative contributions to our projects, helping us build a more connected and sustainable world.

Be working towards a relevant Degree or Masters level qualification such as Computer Science To be a flexible and innovative self-starter who brings a curious mindset to finding solutions for real-world problems The adaptability to learn, unlearn and reprioritise as things around you change You must have the permanent right to work in the UK. We want you to bring your whole, authentic self to Jacobs - have you travelled around the world? Worked in a bar? Been captain of a sports team or volunteered for a charity? Tell us - we're looking for people with interesting stories and experiences! Selection Process Step 1: Apply Online Step 2: Gamification Assessment Step 3: Interview What else we provide In addition to work-life balance and flexibility, UK employees also receive; Free single medical cover and digital GP service Reimbursement towards relevant professional development and memberships An inclusive and diverse environment, embracing the variety of cultures, backgrounds and lifestyles of our employees through Jacobs Employee Networks A focus on safety, health, and wellbeing, prioritising our people through a culture of caring and a network of positive mental health champions Opportunities to give back to our communities through our Collectively program, incorporating matched-funding, paid volunteering time and charitable donations. We are truly passionate about inclusion and diversity and recognise that this application and selection process may not suit all candidates.

If this is the case for you, please get in touch with us to discuss how we can make this process more accessible. #EarlyCareersUK #GraduateUK #GraduateJob2023 #GraduateCareersUK #GraduaterecruitmentUK #GraduateJobsUK #GraduateopportunitiesUK #GradsP&PS

title: Senior UI Developer
description:
We have a great opportunities across the UI and UX space within Pega. In case you have never heard of us, we are a leader in Cloud Software for customer engagement and operational excellence. The world’s most recognized brands rely on Pega’s AI powered software to optimize every customer interaction on any channel

Every day, Pega powers...MILLIONS of automated processes BILLIONS of customer interactions TRILLIONS of dollars of business. If you’ve used your credit card, called a company for service, opened an account, applied for a loan, accepted an offer, flown on an airplane, paid a bill, submitted a claim, or countless other things you do in your day......you’ve interacted with Pega.

Meet Our Team:

Our team lives and breathes the Pega delivery vision: quickly building high-quality, outcome driven applications that evolve with the changing needs of business. As a key member of the Pega Consulting team, you will work with passionate and driven colleagues, delivering innovative... user-centric business and technical solutions using Pega technology.

Picture Yourself at Pega:

In an enterprise world filled with poor design and implementation, we’re looking to you to help save our Fortune 500 clients! You will provide UI configuration leadership and Pega-specific user interface design guidance on multiple clients facing implementation projects.

Activities include owning the UI implementation and making design decisions that are grounded in User Experience best practices.

What You'll Do at Pega:

• Partner with our clients to deliver cutting edge UI solutions across all phases of the software development lifecycle

• Utilize your outstanding technical consulting skills to demonstrate new and innovative ways to implement software solutions

Who You Are:

• You are a highly technical hands-on individual who is passionate about exploring and applying Pega technology to help solve business problems.

• Intimately familiar with leading–edge web technologies with an emphasis on HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, ReactJS, and UI architecture

• Understands enterprise software design principles, best practices, and dependencies

• Aptitude to pick up new concepts and technology rapidly; ability to explain it to both business & IT stakeholders

• Capacity to work in teams as well as alone

• Ability to match technology solutions to customer needs

What You've Accomplished:

• You’ve engaged with the various technical landscapes of multi-channel business architectures, including CRM, web, mobile, legacy and 3rd party software systems and the key linkages between them

• You have experience in all phases of software development including design, configuration, testing, debugging, implementation, and support of large-scale, business centric and process-based applications

• You’ve built and implemented model-driven, enterprise-level business solutions and applications

• You’ve worked alongside UX Designers to bring user-centered concepts to life

• You’ve delivered solutions in Agile and Scrum methodologies

Pega Offers You:

• Gartner Analyst acclaimed technology leadership across our categories of products

• Experience building mission-critical, high volume applications which truly make a difference in user’s lives

• Continuous learning and development opportunities

• An innovative, inclusive, agile, flexible, and fun work environment

• Competitive global benefits program including pay + bonus incentives, employee equity in the company

Inclusion and Diversity - Inclusive is one of our values at Pega. Pegasystems is committed to inclusion and diversity and strives to foster a fair and inclusive environment for all. We believe Pega can achieve more when we create a culture that inspires each of us to fully contribute each and every day. We encourage diverse thinking and collaboration for better outcomes for all. Learn more about our inclusive culture.

As an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, Pegasystems will not discriminate in its employment practices due to an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, veteran or disability status, or any other category protected by law.

Accessibility – If you require accessibility assistance applying for open positions please contact PegaApplication@pega.com.
