title: Sr. UX Designer, VP (CAO)
description:
Description

We are the Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT) design team in JPMC's User Experience (UX) Center of Excellence. We are looking for a highly creative, passionate, and driven user experience designer to join our team focused on the CAO and Audit pillar of applications to create a better experience for our global network of employees.

We are looking for someone with extensive digital and usability design experience that can be a great partner to both business and technology teams. The ideal candidate will operate as the UX lead for high profile and priority applications - responsible for delivering best in class solutions in collaboration with UX researchers, UX Designers and supporting UI Designers.

What are the ingredients of a successful designer at JPMC?

You combine exceptional craft in working through the details of a visual design with good problem-solving and communication skills. You are a master with Sketch + InVision or Figma and you can draw quick... wireframes to communicate ideas. You are at your best when collaborating with other designers, researchers, product managers, and developers to create designs that marry the best of user, business + technology thinking. You are detail oriented. You advocate for the user.

What is your typical day?
• You will be collaborating with project teams comprised of business and technology stakeholders at all levels
• You will be creating wireframes, UI design, and prototypes using modern design tools
• You will be sharing your work with designers, developers, and stakeholders across multiple teams
• You will be participating in user research and partnering with internal researchers
• You will be providing solutions for applications that aggregate data from multiple sources
• You will be collaborating with other UX designers and researchers offering advice and constructive feedback on design/usability reviews

Responsibilities
• Creating wireframes, and interactive POCs leveraging our design system
• Working with project teams and researchers to understand our users
• Working with business analysts + developers to define user stories and product backlogs
• Participating in usability research to iterate and refine your designs
• Presenting your ideas to stakeholders and advocating on behalf of the user
• Working with developers to realize and polish user experiences
• Actively contributing and using our common design language + design systems
• Mentoring and offering guidance to junior designers
• Collaborate with team and stakeholders to create UX artifacts such as journey maps, empathy maps, and personas
• Lead the UX design process for multiple projects
• Evangelize UX to business, stakeholders and technology

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Human Computer Interaction, Interaction/Interface Design, Graphic Design, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university
• 5+ years or equivalent compelling experiences as a designer for enterprise software, responsive web applications, mobile apps, and defining in-house style guides & documenting standards.
• 5+ years of experience with modern design tools - Figma, Sketch, Invision, or equivalent.
• A balance of creativity, productivity + a passion for elegant, simple, emotionally rich design
• Excellent communication, listening, and negotiation skills with clients and senior executives- write, speak and present information effectively, persuasively and confidently in a variety of communication/corporate settings
• Strong understanding and commitment to usability and user-centered design principles/methods; including experience in a variety of usability evaluation techniques such as usability testing, contextual interviews, and heuristic evaluations
• Strong understanding of Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG 2.0) and assistive technologies (JAWS, NVDA, Zoomtext), and proven track record of incorporating into your day-to-day work.
• General understanding of the capabilities of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React.
• Experience across multiple teams and release cycles working closely with design, product management + development to realize experiences using agile project management.
• A11y knowledge/experience.

Qualifications (+)
• Master's or other terminal degree in Human Computer Interaction, Design, Technology Communications or related discipline from a major accredited college or university
• Working Knowledge of modern web application technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript, Angular, Bootstrap, LESS/Sass, React. Working knowledge is a plus.
• You are a CUA (Certified Usability Analyst)
• You have experience in conducting UX Research

To Apply

In Particular, We Want To Hear About

Submit your resume and portfolio. Your portfolio should include at least 3 examples of work-related projects.
• The opportunity you were trying to solve
• The process involved in developing the design or project

About Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT)

We deliver streamlined and consistent solutions supporting JPMorgan Chase's Controls, Compliance, Legal, HR and IT Risk agendas, with a focus on stability, delivery, efficiencies and people. The goal of CTR's drive to standardization, consistency and simplicity is a JPMorgan Chase architecture that fosters long-term productivity, quality and innovation across the entire enterprise. The disciplines within this organization are Compliance Technology, Oversight & Controls Technology, Legal & e-Discovery, Identity & Access Management, IT Risk & Controls, HR Real Estate & Global Services Technology, and Third-Party Risk Management.

About JPMorgan Chase

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and

asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com .

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2 trillion and operations in more than 60 countries. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers, small business and commercial banking, financial transaction processing, asset management, and private equity.

Employee Experience Corporate Technology (EECT) organization develops applications and provides technology support for corporate functions across JPMorgan Chase, including Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and all functions within the Corporate Administrative Office (CAO).

EECT teams are aligned with corporate partners' evolving technology needs and the firm's ever expanding technology controls agenda.

A top EECT priority is building scalable corporate systems. Teams focus on:
• Responding to the evolving regulatory environment and helping to meet the firm's regulatory commitments by addressing internal and external commitments
• Advancing the firm's Roadmap programs -- Single Sourcing of data, Architecture Convergence, and Rationalization of Platforms
• Adopting industry leading technologies to support best-in-class business capabilities for high performance computing and data storage solutions
• Driving innovation across the firm's corporate technology portfolio, increasing efficiencies through process automation, and Agile application development, with an emphasis on user experience and shorter development cycles
• Investing in security & controls for cyber, access/entitlements uplift, data protection and application resiliency

J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs

title: Digital UX/UI Designer - First Direct
description:
At first direct change is a way of life. You’ll be in the thick of it helping first direct to drive forward its ambition and be the UK’s number one digital bank.

As a digital UX/UI designer, you will be a key part of first direct digital design team, looking after our key products, customer journeys and features. You’ll be responsible for identifying, implementing and managing solutions from experience design perspective that help progress these digital capabilities, so we can meet our ambition.

As a part of the fd team, you will also have access to specialist and tailored professional development opportunities and a competitive pay and benefits package. This includes private healthcare for all UK-based employees, enhanced maternity and adoption pay and support when you return to work, and a contributory pension scheme with a very generous employer contribution.

We have a very rare and exciting opportunity for a Senior / Lead UX/UI designer as part of first direct team, to support... cross channel (mobile first) design activities to serve first direct and UK customers better.

In this role, you will:
• Design flows and experiences that simplify and distil down complex actions into useable interfaces.
• Design new experiences or layouts that evolve and define visual systems and generate new visual language.
• Collaborating with the broader design team to create prototype designs for user testing.
• Working with a cross functional team to capture and act upon requirements.
• Contribute to the broader product roadmap with the relevant product, business, and tech stakeholders.
• Identify and deliver best practice in user experience methodologies within first direct, collaborating with wider local and cross border teams and functions.

Requirements:

To be successful in this role you should meet the following requirements:
• Strong understanding of digital business with emphasis on app design.
• Experience of delivering customer-facing financial services product is highly desirable.
• Possess a blend of business and technical savvy; ability to drive strategy into action with a creative flair
• Strong UX/UI skills and experience (portfolio will be kindly requested)
• Strong experience of digital product design and delivery on native mobile platforms (iOS and Android) and knowledge of responsive web is advantageous.
• Good working knowledge and experience with design system.
• Proven ability to build strong relationship across stakeholder groups with the ability to effectively influence and communicate across various business lines and units and at senior levels within the organisation.
• Customer focussed, result-based approach, able to deliver to deadlines
• Demonstrated flexibility and resilience when addressing shifting or competing priorities.
• Strong analytical skills.

The base location for this role is hybrid with travel to Leeds.

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment.
Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

As a business operating in markets all around the world, we believe diversity brings benefits for our customers, our business and our people. This is why HSBC is committed to being an inclusive employer and encourages applications from all suitably qualified applicants irrespective of ethnicity, religion, age, physical or mental disability/long term health condition, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by local law in the jurisdictions in which we operate.

Within the work place you will have access to various employee resource groups which aim to promote and achieve a healthy work / life balance and support our diversity ambitions. HSBC has in place processes in order to avoid nepotism, which means to avoid creating circumstances in which the appearance or possibility of conflicts of interest may exist within the hiring process.

We want everyone to be able to fulfil their potential which is why we provide a range of flexible working arrangements and family friendly policies

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
Your new company
Our client is a global leader in the creation of software tools for security testing of web applications

Your new role
Our designers are pivotal to the success of our product teams, working alongside highly experienced software developers and product experts. This means that you will be involved in a wide variety of activities, including:
• Modernization, research and design of future generations of our product.
• Working alongside the product team to define customer needs through bringing a design influence.
• Designing simple, elegant, data-driven, user-centric experiences that will delight our customers.
• Helping to shape the product strategy and vision, bringing your insight and expertise from a design perspective.
• Extensive and thorough user research with the primary responsibility of bringing forward new findings and learning to influence design decisions.
• Conducting user testing to validate all design solutions.
• Producing high quality sketches... wireframes and mock-ups at various degrees of fidelity.
• Collaborating closely with development teams during the prototyping and building of UI components.
• Contributing to the wider design systems and practices

What you'll need to succeed
You come from a technical background as someone who may have started their career as a developer or programmer but have taken a keen interest into all things UX. You are a UX Designer whose career demonstrates technical experience, as well as a strong portfolio of visual design and problem solving using UX methodologies and principles. You thrive in a hands-on design role in a highly collaborative flat team environment. This means that:
• You have a good understanding of technical concepts.
• You are a strong visual communicator.
• You are naturally organized with great time management skills.
• You have the ability to adapt within fast paced agile environments.
• You are humble and open to constructive feedback.
• You are always looking for ways to improve your knowledge and skills .
Essential:
• Strong technical background and knowledge - comfortable having highly technical conversations with developers and customers.
• Full-stack, cross-platform design experience, from discovery to design, through to building and delivering an exceptional product.
• Previous experience modernizing the design for a desktop application and understanding the challenges and opportunities that go with it.
• Ability to keep the customer at the heart of everything you do. Validating your ideas with data and customer research to build products that will delight the user.
• Exposure or experience with working in a cross-functional agile team solving complex user problems and evolving your design in rapid iterations to meet changing requirements.
• Experience using design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Axure, XD.
• Experience with moderating user testing and conducting interviews.
• Experience using user story techniques.
• A depth of hands-on experience with various UX methods such as empathy mapping or customer journey mapping.
• Good understanding of interaction design, including common UI patterns.
• Experience in creating user personas.
• A healthy understanding of accessibility standards.
• Proven ability to multi-task and deliver continuous, incremental value to the team.
• Self-motivate with the ability to adapt quickly, forming outstanding and innovative ideas.

Although not essential to the role, it would be beneficial to have some knowledge or interest in the following area:
• Cybersecurity - although direct experience with Application Security is not required - you'll learn quickly!

What you'll get in return
Our client firmly believes in paying people what they're worth. Paying excellent salaries above the normal market level, and this is always determined based on your individual skills and contribution. In addition to a generous base salary, they offer share options and a comprehensive benefits package.

What you need to do now
If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now.
If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career

title: UX/UI Director
description:
UX/UI Director

80,000 - 120,000 (bonus car allowance benefits)

London

Our Client

Our client is an exceptional global leading fleet management services and solutions company. They have been pioneers in the automotive industry for more than 130 years and will continue to be for the next 130 years. They continue to innovate through offering tools and information that transform business operational effeciancy on a day to day basis, reducing costs and improving productivity.

Following a period of transformation and repositioning, they have launched a growth strategy covering go-to-market, product, and a significant investment in talent, to include the appointment of a high calibre UX/UI Director.

The Role

As UX/UI Director you will be responsible for company's UX/UI approach, with specific focus on customer-facing solutions and services. You will assess and diagnose UX/UI needs for the business through close collaboration with key decision makers, as well as designing, building and... delivering the UX/UI strategy and deployment plan globally. You will become the UX/UI expert in the organisation and will be required to spread this expertise through mentoring, training, internal engagement and communications.

To be successful in this role you will require 7 years of experience as a UX designer, interaction designer, information architect, or similar. Along with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in design, human-computer interaction (HCI), or equivalent professional experience. You should have excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical skills including the ability to present design concepts clearly and persuasively.

To Apply

This is an excellent opportunity in a challenging, fast paced and dynamic business. Interested parties should apply accordingly or contact Freddie Rademacher in the first instance for a confidential conversation. Contact details can be found via the Newman Stewart website.

About Us

Newman Stewart is a privately owned, leading provider of Executive Search, Talent Advisory & Psychometric Assessment Services.

With offices in Leeds and London we identify excellent people for our excellent clients, nationally and internationally and we are proud of the results that we deliver

title: UI UX Designer
description: Job Description UI UX Designer - Tech Scale Up - Hybrid/Remote Commutable to Cardiff - £30,000 - £40,000 Remote, flexible working, shares, pension, private healthcare, income protection, 33 days hols About Them Over the last 3 years, this tech scale-up have been revolutionising an outdated industry and now at a size of 60 people, they show no signs of stopping with the success of their cloud & mobile applications

title: UI/UX Engineer
description:
Financial Conduct Authority – Permanent, Full-Time

Background

It Is Responsible For

There are few jobs where you can make a real difference to the 40 million consumers of financial products, the 2 million people who work in the UK Financial Services industry, and the stability of our economy. The FCA has three objectives.

ensuring that markets operate with integrity. promoting effective competition; and protecting consumers of financial services.

Advanced Analytics is driving digital innovation at the FCA. Our purpose is to change how we regulate financial services. Our team of change experts and data scientists combine cutting-edge techniques and the latest technology to generate breakthrough insights. We believe the best approach is sometimes an innovative approach. We place emphasis on curiosity and experimentation. We collaborate widely with academics, innovative companies, and the rest of the FCA. We believe that people need space to continue learning and the support to... develop new ideas, so we commit to giving them both.

Come and join our diverse team of creative and passionate innovators.

What does the role involve? What are the key responsibilities?

As a front-end engineer (Senior Associate) in the Advanced Analytics Engineering team, you will design, implement, and deploy Advanced Analytics Applications. You will take a proactive approach to planning and delivery based on Agile principles and values. You will take pride in your product and the quality of its implementation.

You will collaborate with end users, product managers, data scientists and other SMEs to make design decisions and formulate implementation strategies. You will form lasting partnerships with data scientists to develop new data science ideas into enterprise grade applications with real business value. You are an advocate for innovation and get excited about new technologies and new ways of doing things. You will invest time in both learning and advancing your knowledge and sharing your knowledge through peer reviews, demos, debates, and other knowledge sharing platforms.

What will the candidate get from the role?
• Experience in with graphic design and image manipulation software
• Understanding of UI/UX design including user research, prototyping, testing and accessibility design
• Knowledge in Python programming and Linux OS

Which minimum, essential & desirable skills are required?

We’re a signatory to the Government’s Disability Confident scheme. This means that we will offer an interview to disabled candidates entering under the scheme, should they meet the minimum criteria for a role. A minimum criterion needs to be measurable from reviewing a candidate’s CV. Exceptions may apply if due to the volume of applications we are not able to interview all eligible candidates who qualify under the scheme.

Minimum
• Experience developing JavaScript applications
• Experience using UI frameworks (Angular/React/Vue) and CSS frameworks

Essential
• Experience building and consuming RESTful APIs.
• Experience working with Node.JS and web development tools (e.g. Webpack)

Desirable
• Experience in with graphic design and image manipulation software
• Understanding of UI/UX design including user research, prototyping, testing and accessibility design
• Knowledge in Python programming and Linux OS

About The FCA

At the FCA, we’re creating a fair and more resilient financial system. We’re establishing more transparent relationships between financial services and their customers, building trust in financial markets and protecting vulnerable consumers.

The FCA's Values & Diversity

Our ambition is to create a diverse and inclusive workplace that reflects the society we serve, helping us to be a better regulator.

The FCA supports hybrid working and you will be expected to work 40% of your time over a month, in our office. We will consider other flexible arrangements, for example part time working, and you can discuss this with the recruiter.

Useful Information

We are looking for A UI/UX Engineer/ Front-End Engineer, graded Senior Associates within our Regulatory Career Family.

London salary range is approximately £50,000 to £65,000 plus a competitive benefits package and non-contributory pension.

National salary range (including Edinburgh and Leeds) is approximately £47,000 to £58,500 plus a competitive benefits package and non-contributory pension

Job post will close on Tuesday 20th December 2022

For more information, please contact Melanie.Dubock@fca.org.uk if you are an internal candidate and Ifrah.Azam@fca.org.uk if you are an external candidate

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
UX/UI Designer
£60,000 - £75,000

Are you a UX/UI Designer looking to join an exciting start-up in the Property Investment industry?

Do you want to join an exciting start-up in the early stages, and be on their journey all the way to household-name status?

My client, a Trailblazer in the Property Investment industry, are after a UX/UI Designer to revamp the look and experience for their innovative iOS and Android Apps.

You will be responsible for performing all functions of the product design lifecycle - sketches, wireframes, concept designs, end-to-end user flows, interaction design, prototyping, documentation, accessibility checks, and testing/design QA.

The successful UX/UI Designer will be:

A creative, innovative, solutions driven UX/UI designer, able to execute high level user experience, while also having a keen eye for detail.
Comfortable with native mobile design patterns on Android and iOS, as well as web and cross-platform.
A team player and excellent communicator, able... to effectively collaborate and communicate with stakeholders and customers.The successful UX/UI Designer can expect a salary of between £50,000 - £70,000 DOE.

This role is based in London, but is a hybrid position, with lots of flexibility to work from home.

Benefits include, but aren't limited to:

A generous 36 days holiday allowance - with the ability to buy and sell up to 5.
Private healthcare
Pension

If you are interested please apply ASAP. The People Network is an employment agency and will respond to all applicants within three - five working days. If you do not hear within these timescales please feel free to get in touch

title: UI Visual Designer
description:
Explore a connected marketplace

We connect data, markets and customers to create a comprehensive, trusted view of the global commodities markets. For our customers, the intelligence we provide is empowering, which as a result influences thousands of decisions across supply chains every single day. We believe the right culture has the same effect. Our culture empowers our people, giving them the confidence and inspiration they need to achieve their aspirations, thrive on innovation and explore more.

Job Summary:

ICIS are hiring for a Visual Designer to define the visual identity of our products, working collaboratively with senior designers and other business teams. She/ he suggests new design patterns but primarily works within pre-existing frameworks.

Responsibilities:

Customer (or User) Focus

Understands how UI design impacts the overalll user experience.
Is familiar with and can use customer frameworks (e.g. Jobs To Be Done, personas, journey maps).
Keeps up to date on... news/incidents and understands what is happening in the market and with competitors.

Creative Problem Solving
Asks the right questions to explore the problem.
Iterates and tests solution to check it solves the problem.
Considers the problem from a number of angles.
Independently identifies different creative solutions.
Collects feedback from users, other designers and stakeholders.

Product Design
Follows a User-Centred visual design process.
Creates original visual design assets.
Works with UX Researcher to understand the user needs.
Works with UX Designer to define structure and layout of the product.
Works with existing design patterns and style guides, occasionally introducing new patterns.

Data Driven Analysis & Testing
Iterates work based on testing and data analysis.
Regularly tests design work with users in partnership with UX Research team.
Explores data from analytics packages, customer insight or other sources to understand context of design work.
Proactively uses data to establish key metrics for projects.

Technical Skills
Has a good knowledge of the tech stack of the organisation.
Uses relevant tools for communicating designs to developers (InVision, Zeplin).
Uses design software (Adobe, Sketch) to intermediate level.
Proatively identifies needs for training in technical skills.
Understands the nuances of designing for different platforms.

Competencies:

Personal Capability
Practices Self-Development
Is curious and keen to learn and develop new ideas, skills and knowledge
Acts on feedback to improve him/herself
Looks for developmental opportunities in day-to-day work
Invests time and energy in self-development (professional qualifications , relevant reading, networking meetings, etc.)

Solves Problems and Analyzes Issues
Is able to ask effective questions and collect facts from multiple sources in order to solve problems
Is able to effectively identify and analyze problems and propose solutions
Effectively manages day-to-day issues and problems without intervention

Innovates
"Brainstorms" with others to look for different approaches to current process and tasks
Looks for opportunities to develop new ideas or thinking within own role
Experiments with new ideas as part of role

Interpersonal Skills
Communicates Powerfully and Prolifically
Demonstrates effective conversational skills, including active listening and questioning
Shares information relevant to own role
Participates in team presentations

Collaboration and Teamwork
Develops co-operative working relationships within the team
Considers how own style affects others and tailors interactions accordingly
Looks for ways to develop mutually beneficial relationships across teams

Builds Relationships
Is approachable and friendly
Asks for opinions of others
Participates in formal and informal gatherings to meet new people and develop new relationshipsOur Benefits

In addition to all of this, we offer the following 'core' benefits:

25 days annual leave (with option to buy up to 5 days)

3 discretionary days over Christmas

2 paid charity days, where you get paid to help the community (as a business we do a lot of charity work)

Pension

Life assurance scheme (4*Salary)

Share options scheme

Private Medical Insurance

Women in technology:

We are very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. Currently 27% of our Technology workforce are women which is much higher than the UK average of 17%. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:

Mentoring scheme for women in technology

Women's network forum

Regularly run events for schools girl about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in tech.

At Lexis Nexis Risk Solutions Group having diverse employees with different perspectives is key to creating innovative new products for our global customers. We have 35 diversity employee networks globally and prioritise ensuring inclusive leadership is part of our culture. Our aim is for every employee to be the best version of themselves. We would actively welcome applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups.

We encourage applicants and employees to tell us about any health issues they may have to allow us to put in place reasonable adjustments that may support applicants in the application process and support employees to succeed in their role.

#LI-MH1

#LI-Hybrid

title: UI / UX Product Designer - 6 months
description:
Global Financial Services client is hiring for a UI / UX Product Designer for their team based in London. This is a 1-year Contract role offering a rate of £500 - £600 per day Inside IR35. This is a hybrid office working role in the City with 3 days working in the office.

Responsibilities include:
- Collaboration with cross-functional teams to deliver product experiences
- Lead user-centred design principles and rely on these experiences that meet user needs
- Ability to articulate design rationale from both a site architecture and product point of view and present findings
- Facilitate and participate in workshops and discussions to promote the communication to ideas

Required Skills:

- Must have 5+ years experience as a Designer in either product-related or agency environments designing consumer facing applications, websites and mobile experiences
- Skilled in visual design, developing wireframes, prototyping, user flows and interaction design
- Strong presentation skills in... explaining interactions, scenarios and story boards
- Experience running user research and user testing - and subsequently identifying user needs, action and behaviours through research
- Experience with Figma and Sketch

Please apply for immediate interview!

The JM Group is operating and advertising as an Employment Agency for permanent positions and as an Employment Business for interim / contract / temporary positions. The JM Group is an Equal Opportunities employer and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds

title: Volunteer: UX | UI DESIGNER NEEDED FOR NEW LIVE-LEARNING PLATFORM!
description:

We want to expand to 30 volunteers, to help create this beautiful live-learning platform for people right around the globe.

We aim to help facilitate 10,000's of lessons every day using our platform.

We're creating a new education system for the world. For everyone to teach and learn from each other without needing money!

We are looking for people who want to join this incredible journey of enabling skills and knowledge to be exchanged worldwide without needing money!

title: UX Designer
description:
• Manage and support ExD team from User Research, through Interaction Design to Visual Design.
• Provide day-to-day work direction to additional product designers and review and critique work done by the team.
• Generate new concept ideas and hypotheses, rapidly prototype and test out those ideas, conduct UX research, and pivot quickly to new directions.
• Work with other business areas-especially product management and development-to ensure our products and services are the best in the industry.
• Ensure the user interfaces are intuitive for the end users of the particular platforms; supported platforms may include web, mobile web, Android and iOS mobile apps, and Windows and Mac applications.
• Assist in generating requirements for UI to support usability.
• 3+ years' UX/UI design experience
• Experience working with some of our preferred design tools (Sketch, Invision, Figma, Adobe)
• Experience and/or knowledge of front end technologies HTML5, CSS3, REACT, Angular a bonus.
• Good... verbal and written communications skills.
• Consultancy background would be a plus.
• Ability to participate with a team to achieve a common goal and the ability to work independently (with little oversight) to achieve a pre-defined goal.
• Ability to support multiple concurrent project responsibilities.
• Experienced in MS Office suite.

Our employees' safety is priority, so currently you will be working from the comfort of your own home most of the time. In the future we can spend more time in some of our offices, in Glasgow, Bank or Epworth House.As a result, you will be able to enjoy London's vibrant dynamics!

.... And another thing, you will be joining a close-knit team that is supportive and approachable.Which means that as a new joiner, you will always have someone available to offer help and guidance.

This employer is a corporate member of myGwork - LGBTQ+ professionals, the business community for LGBTQ+ professionals, students, inclusive employers & anyone who believes in workplace equality

title: Senior User Experience Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer

Working at Ito World

We’re a mission-driven and diverse team of 80+ people from over 18 countries with a passion for technology and transportation.

We’re interested in talented, curious people that share our mission and love data as much as we do.

What we do

At Ito World, we solve transportation challenges across the globe for millions of travellers every day, by delivering real-time transit data feeds to journey planners and a platform for transit authorities and operators. Our clients include Google, Apple, Microsoft and public sector organisations such as the Department of Transport and Transport for West Midlands.

The Senior UX Designer role

As a member of Ito’s growing product team and reporting into the Head of Products, the Senior UX Designer will take responsibility for leading our product UX/UI strategy. You will primarily be working on our Ito Transit Hub product, our solution for cities, transit agencies and operators.

Working as part of a cross... functional team of Product Managers, Product Owners, Software Developers and QA Engineers, you will be responsible for designing software that’s elegant, intuitive and easy-to-use.

This is a hands-on role with responsibility for gathering user requirements, designing graphic elements and building navigation components. The Senior UX Designer will create functional and appealing features that address our clients’ needs and help us grow our customer base in the UK and internationally.

We’re looking for someone who has demonstrable experience in UX/UI design for an enterprise SaaS company, ideally operating in B2B and B2G markets. This is an important role that requires exceptional UX/UI design skills, product vision and leadership. The ideal Senior UX Designer is someone who can both lead the UX/UI strategy and delivery as well as roll up their sleeves and get things done.

Ito World has a flexible and remote working culture and will consider applicants that want to work fully remote from anywhere in the UK. We also have an office in Cambridge to accommodate those who prefer to work onsite / hybrid.

What the Senior UX Designer will do
• Design and execute research activities to inform product discovery, including surveys, customer interviews, user testing, and data analysis
• Gather and evaluate user requirements in collaboration with product managers and engineers
• Work closely with the product and development teams to gather requirements, define problems, and create solutions that incorporate the applicable accessibility standards
• Own the build and maintenance of a design system in Figma (or similar) for our rapidly scaling product suite
• Work with development to ensure the design system meets all requirements and integrates seamlessly with workflows
• Implement and maintain existing UI patterns and behaviours to create polished UIs that are consistent with the rest of the product suite and the design system
• Produce detailed personas, user journeys, user flows, sketches, wireframes, and prototypes for new products and features
• Communicate your design decisions, process and solutions to the wider team to keep everyone up to speed and to ensure buy-in
• Lead and direct the activities of an external team of designers
• Keep up to date with competitor analysis within the transit tech/geospatial industry and general software industry trends
• Maintain a good understanding of our customers and what they want out of their interactions
• Lead a data-driven approach to problem solving and increase analytics capability within the team
• Contribute and adhere to style standards on fonts, colours and images

What the Senior UX Designer will need to have
• Proven experience as a Senior Designer or similar role
• A portfolio of work that demonstrates your experience in leading the design of complex systems interfaces
• Proven experience of leading and managing a design team
• Skilled in Figma, Sketch, Adobe Suite
• Ability to ideate fast and explore multiple routes to solve a problem
• Experience in preparing and conducting user research and usability tests
• Knowledge and curiosity about technology and its impact on design solutions
• Experience working in an Agile environment
• Some knowledge and experience of Government Digital Service Standards would be beneficial but not essential

What you need to be
• Comfortable being involved in direct conversations with external users and stakeholders in order to understand the detail of complex problems and communicate this to your team
• A strong leader, with sound technical judgement, and the ability to influence decision-making
• A team player who leads by example, and supports, mentors and motivates others around you
• Committed to self-development and a subject matter expert

What we offer for the Senior Product Designer
• Flexible & remote working to suit all lifestyles and life stages
• Enhanced pension and health insurance after 2 years' service
• Life insurance
• 25 days + bank holidays as standard
• Flexible public holidays - option to swap up to 5 UK public holidays to celebrate the festival of your choice. Choose an alternative day that fits your personal values, beliefs or celebration calendar better
• Enhanced parental leave policy
• New parents take a day off to celebrate your child’s first birthday
• Wellbeing and employee assistance programme
• Cycle to work scheme
• Free bike repair service for those that commute by bike
• Regular team lunches and team socials

Equity, diversity and inclusion at Ito World

At Ito World we believe diverse perspectives make for a better company and better products too. We strongly encourage applications from underrepresented groups and are committed to equality and inclusivity in our hiring processes and company culture.

By submitting this application you agree to Ito World retaining your personal data on a "legitimate interest" basis. For further details see our privacy statement

title: Senior UX Designer
description:
Senior UX Designer
London (minimum 1 day in the office)
£60,000 - £75,000
They're the design team of a rapidly expanding software company focused across a broad range of areas in the XR industry - who have recently received significant investment to be channelled into their internal R&D/Innovation projects.
The company was established over 6 years ago by a team of industry veterans from the likes of Microsoft, Apple, and Meta/Facebook. They've partnered with some of worlds leading brands to support them in the first steps into the metaverse, through their events and experiences platform!
They currently have a headcount of 120 - across their UK and North America office locations and are fuelling headcount growth to over 150+ in the next six months.
They are now recruiting a Senior UX Designer to join their creative design team. You'll contribute to the vision and development of VR products, focussing on creating experiences that can enhance the senses of VR users across the world... You'll influence the future and how people connect across the globe!
As the Senior UX Designer you'll be working closely with the Creative Director to create and design original features for a VR platform.
You'll provide clear workflows, wireframes, UI, prototypes, and design documentation where needed, creating and maintain documentation for features and processes.
In return, you can expect to be working on cutting-edge projects, where you'll be playing a major role in helping to shape the future direction of the company! They offer remote working but are ideally looking for someone to come into their prestigious central London location once a week.
The role comes with fantastic career development, allowing you to move into a senior position with the remit to build your own team!
To apply for the exceptional role with an innovative business contact James on j.martin@fourpointzero.io
